r

ra

letter. (gram) letter r; 35th letter of the alphabet; retroflex semi-vowel ✓

Grammar letter, masc
Meaning (gram) letter r; 35th letter of the alphabet; retroflex semi-vowel
Sanskrit ra

Example

a kavagga hā kaṇṭhajā, i cavagga yā tālujā, u pavaggā oṭṭhajā, ṭavagga ra ḷā muddhajā, tavagga la sā dantajā, e kaṇṭhatālujo, o kaṇṭh'oṭṭhajo, vo dant'oṭṭhajo.

bālāvatāra sandhi kaṇḍa
rakkha

adj. protecting; guarding [√rakkh + a] ✓

Grammar adj, in comps, from rakkati
Meaning protecting; guarding
Root Family √rakkh
Root √rakkh･1 a (protect)
Construction √rakkh + a
Derivative kita (a)
Synonym anurakkhī, pa, rakkhī
Sanskrit rakṣa
Sanskrit Root √rakṣ 1 (protect)

Example

phandanaṃ capalaṃ cittaṃ,
dūrakkhaṃ dunnivārayaṃ,
ujuṃ karoti medhāvī,
usukāro'va tejanaṃ.

DHP 33 cittavaggo
rakkhaka

masc. who guards, observes or keeps, guard [√rakkh] ✗
rakkhaṇa

nt. protecting; guarding; watching [√rakkh + aṇa] ~

Grammar nt, act, from rakkhati
Meaning protecting; guarding; watching
Root Family √rakkh
Root √rakkh･1 a (protect)
Construction √rakkh + aṇa
Derivative kita (aṇa)
Synonym gopana
Variant rakkhana
Sanskrit rakṣaṇa
Sanskrit Root √rakṣ 1 (protect)
rakkhati 1

pr. (+acc) protects; guards; watches over [√rakkh + a + ti] ✓

Grammar pr, trans (+acc)
Meaning protects; guards; watches over
Root Family √rakkh
Root √rakkh･1 a (protect)
Base √rakkh + a > rakkha
Construction rakkha + ti
Synonym anurakkhati, ārakkhati, gopeti, pāleti, sārakkhati
Sanskrit rakṣati
Sanskrit Root √rakṣ 1 (protect)

Examples

sududdasaṃ sunipuṇaṃ,
yatthakāmanipātinaṃ,
cittaṃ rakkhetha medhāvī,
cittaṃ guttaṃ sukh'āvahaṃ.

DHP 36 cittavaggo

seyyathā'pi, rāhula, rañño nāgo īsādanto urūḷhavā abhijāto saṅgām'āvacaro saṅgāmagato … dantehi'pi kammaṃ karoti, naṅguṭṭhena'pi kammaṃ karoti, rakkhati-eva soṇḍaṃ.

MN 61 ambalaṭṭhika rāhulovādasuttaṃ
rakkhati 2

pr. (+acc) wards off; prevents; guards against [√rakkh + a + ti] ✓

Grammar pr, trans (+acc)
Meaning wards off; prevents; guards against
Root Family √rakkh
Root √rakkh･1 a (protect)
Base √rakkh + a > rakkha
Construction rakkha + ti
Sanskrit rakṣati
Sanskrit Root √rakṣ 1 (protect)

Examples

kāyappakopaṃ rakkheyya,
kāyena saṃvuto siyā,
kāyaduccaritaṃ hitvā,
kāyena sucaritaṃ care.

DHP 231 kodhavaggo

samānabhāgaṃ kubbetha,
gāme akkuṭṭhavanditaṃ,
manopadosaṃ rakkheyya,
santo anuṇṇato care.

SNP 37 nālakasuttaṃ
mahāvaggo 11
rakkhana

nt. protection, observance [√rakkh] ✗
rakkhanaka

adj. observing, guarding [√rakkh] ✗
rakkhanta

prp. (+acc) protecting; guarding; watching [√rakkh + a + nta] ✓

Grammar prp of rakkhati, trans (+acc)
Meaning protecting; guarding; watching
Root Family √rakkh
Root √rakkh･1 a (protect)
Base √rakkh + a > rakkha
Construction rakkha + nta
Derivative kita (nta)
Synonym ārakkhanta, gopayanta, pālayanta
Sanskrit rakṣat
Sanskrit Root √rakṣ 1 (protect)

Examples

asajjhāyamalā mantā,
anuṭṭhānamalā gharā,
malaṃ vaṇṇassa kosajjaṃ,
pamādo rakkhato malaṃ.

DHP 241 malavaggo

tassa cittaṃ rakkhato āsavesu ca s'āsavesu ca dhammesu saddhindriyam'pi bhāvanāpāripūriṃ gacchati. vīriyindriyam'pi bhāvanāpāripūriṃ gacchati.

SN 48.56 patiṭṭhitasuttaṃ
rakkhamāna

prp. protecting; guarding; watching [√rakkh] ✗

rakkhasapariggahita

adj. owned by a goblin; taken possession of by an ogre ✗
rakkhassetaṃ

sandhi. watch (your words)!; careful (what you say)!; lit. you must guard this [rakkhassu + etaṃ] ✓

Grammar sandhi, imp + pron
Meaning watch (your words)!; careful (what you say)!; lit. you must guard this
Construction rakkhassu + etaṃ
Sanskrit rakṣyasva + etam

Example

rakkhass'etaṃ, māgaṇḍiya, vācaṃ, rakkhass'etaṃ, māgaṇḍiya, vācaṃ. bahū hi tassa bhoto gotamassa khattiyapaṇḍitā'pi brāhmaṇapaṇḍitā'pi gahapatipaṇḍitā'pi samaṇapaṇḍitā'pi abhippasannā vinītā ariye ñāye dhamme kusale'ti.

MN 75 māgaṇḍiyasuttaṃ
rakkhassetaṃ vācaṃ

idiom. watch your words!; careful what you say!; lit. you must guard this speech [rakkhassu + etaṃ + vācaṃ] ✓

Grammar idiom, imp + pron + fem
Meaning watch your words!; careful what you say!; lit. you must guard this speech
Construction rakkhassu + etaṃ + vācaṃ
Sanskrit rakṣyasva + etam + vācām

Example

rakkhass'etaṃ, māgaṇḍiya, vācaṃ, rakkhass'etaṃ, māgaṇḍiya, vācaṃ. bahū hi tassa bhoto gotamassa khattiyapaṇḍitā'pi brāhmaṇapaṇḍitā'pi gahapatipaṇḍitā'pi samaṇapaṇḍitā'pi abhippasannā vinītā ariye ñāye dhamme kusale'ti.

MN 75 māgaṇḍiyasuttaṃ
rakkhā 1

fem. protection; defence; security [√rakkh + ā] ✓

Grammar fem, abstr, from rakkhati
Meaning protection; defence; security
Root Family √rakkh
Root √rakkh･1 a (protect)
Construction √rakkh + ā
Derivative kita (ā)
Synonym tāṇatā
Sanskrit rakṣā
Sanskrit Root √rakṣ 1 (protect)

Examples

ahivicchikā satapadī,
uṇṇanābhī sarabū mūsikā,
katā me rakkhā katā me parittā,
paṭikkamantu bhūtāni.

AN 4.67 ahirājasuttaṃ

bāhirā h'esā rakkhā, n'esā rakkhā ajjhattikā, tasmā tesaṃ arakkhito attā.

SN 3.5 attarakkhitasuttaṃ
rakkhā 2

fem. protections spell; safeguard mantra [√rakkh + ā] ~

Root √rakkh･1 a (protect)

Sanskrit Root √rakṣ 1 (protect)
rakkhāpeti

pr. makes guard; causes to protect [√rakkh] ✗
rakkhāvaraṇa

nt. protection and security [rakkhā + āvaraṇa] ~

Grammar nt, comp
Meaning protection and security
Construction rakkhā + āvaraṇa
Compound dvanda (rakkhā ca āvaraṇa ca)
Commentary (DNa) rakkhāvaraṇaguttin'ti rakkhāsaṅkhātañ'c'eva āvaraṇasaṅkhātañ'ca guttiṃ. sā pan'esā na āvudhahatthe purise ṭhapentena dhammikā nāma saṃvidahitā hoti. yathā pana avelāya kaṭṭhahārikapaṇṇahārik'ādayo vihāraṃ na pavisanti, migaluddak'ādayo vihārasīmāya mige vā macche vā na gaṇhanti, evaṃ saṃvidahantena dhammikā nāma rakkhā saṃvihitā hoti, taṃ sandhāy'āha, dhammikan'ti.
rakkhāvaraṇagutti

fem. safety and security; guarding and protection ✗
rakkhi

aor. (+acc) protected; guarded [√rakkh + i] ✓

Grammar aor of rakkhati, trans (+acc)
Meaning protected; guarded
Root Family √rakkh
Root √rakkh･1 a (protect)
Construction √rakkh + i
Sanskrit arakṣīt
Sanskrit Root √rakṣ 1 (protect)

Example

kikī'va aṇḍaṃ rakkheyya,
cāmarī viya vāladhiṃ,
nipako sīlasampanno,
mamaṃ rakkhi mahāmuni.

APA 18 rāhula therāpadānaṃ
rakkhika

adj. protecting; guarding [√rakkh] ✗
rakkhita 1

pp. (+instr) protected (by); guarded (by) [√rakkh + ita] ✓

Grammar pp of rakkhati (+instr)
Meaning protected (by); guarded (by)
Root Family √rakkh
Root √rakkh･1 a (protect)
Construction √rakkh + ita
Derivative kita (ita)
Synonym ārakkhita, gutta, gopita
Commentary (VINa) ārakkhasaṃvidhānena rakkhitattā rakkhitaṃ. (MNa) rakkhitan'ti ṭhapitarakkhaṃ.
Sanskrit rakṣita
Sanskrit Root √rakṣ 1 (protect)

Examples

yā tā māturakkhitā piturakkhitā mātāpiturakkhitā bhāturakkhitā bhaginirakkhitā ñātirakkhitā gottarakkhitā dhammarakkhitā sasāmikā saparidaṇḍā antamaso mālāguḷaparikkhittā'pi

AN 10.176 cundasuttaṃ

adinnaṃ nāmaṃ yaṃ adinnaṃ anissaṭṭhaṃ apariccattaṃ rakkhitaṃ gopitaṃ mamāyitaṃ parapariggahitaṃ. etaṃ adinnaṃ nāma.

VIN 1.1.2 dutiyapārājikaṃ

rakkhitakāyakammanta

adj. guarded in physical action; lit. protected body action [rakkhita + kāyakammanta] ~

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning guarded in physical action; lit. protected body action
Construction rakkhita + kāyakammanta
Antonym arakkhitakāyakammanta
rakkhitacitta

nt. guarded mind; protected mind [rakkhita + citta] ✓

Grammar nt, comp
Meaning guarded mind; protected mind
Construction rakkhita + citta
Compound kammadhāraya (rakkhita + citta)
Commentary (UDa) tattha tasmā rakkhitacittassā'ti yasmā arakkhitacitto mārassa yathākāmakaraṇīyo hutvā saṃsāre'y'eva hoti, tasmā satisaṃvarena manacchaṭṭhānaṃ indriyānaṃ rakkhaṇena pidahanena rakkhitacitto assa. citte hi rakkhite cakkh'ādiindriyāni rakkhitān'eva hontī'ti.
Sanskrit rakṣita + citta

Example

tasmā rakkhitacittassa,
sammāsaṅkappagocaro,
sammādiṭṭhipurekkhāro,
ñatvāna udayabbayaṃ,
thīnamiddh'ābhibhū bhikkhu,
sabbā duggatiyo jaheti.

fem. Theragāthā 79 (TH79) ✗

rakkhitar

masc. protector; defender; guard; preserver [√rakkh + itar] ✓

Grammar masc, agent, from rakkhati
Meaning protector; defender; guard; preserver
Root Family √rakkh
Root √rakkh･1 a (protect)
Construction √rakkh + itar
Derivative kita (itar)
Synonym ārakkha, ārakkhaka, pāla, pālaka
Sanskrit rakṣitṛ
Sanskrit Root √rakṣ 1 (protect)

Examples

pañcahi, bhikkhave, aṅgehi samannāgato rañño nāgo rāj'āraho hoti rājabhoggo, rañño aṅgaṃtv'eva saṅkhaṃ gacchati. katamehi pañcahi? idha, bhikkhave, rañño nāgo sotā ca hoti, hantā ca, rakkhitā ca, khantā ca, gantā ca.

AN 5.140 sotasuttaṃ

idha, bhikkhave, rañño nāgo saṅgāmagato rakkhati purimaṃ kāyaṃ, rakkhati pacchimaṃ kāyaṃ, rakkhati purime pāde, rakkhati pacchime pāde, rakkhati sīsaṃ, rakkhati kaṇṇe, rakkhati dante, rakkhati soṇḍaṃ, rakkhati vāladhiṃ, rakkhati hatth'āruhaṃ. evaṃ kho, bhikkhave, rañño nāgo rakkhitā hoti.

AN 5.140 sotasuttaṃ
rakkhitavacīkammanta

adj. guarded in speech; lit. protected speech action [rakkhita + vacīkammanta] ~

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning guarded in speech; lit. protected speech action
Construction rakkhita + vacīkammanta
Antonym arakkhitavacīkammanta
rakkhitavanasaṇḍa

masc. name of forest; lit. protected forest grove [rakkhita + vanasaṇḍa] ✓

Grammar masc, comp
Meaning name of forest; lit. protected forest grove
Construction rakkhita + vanasaṇḍa
Compound kammadhāraya (rakkhita + vanasaṇḍa)
Commentary (VINa) pālileyyake viharati rakkhitavanasaṇḍe'ti pālileyyakaṃ upanissāya rakkhitavanasaṇḍe viharati.
Sanskrit rakṣita + vanaṣaṇḍa, vanakhaṇḍa

Example

atha kho so hatthināgo yūthā apakkamma yena pālileyyakaṃ rakkhitavanasaṇḍo bhaddasālamūlaṃ yena bhagavā ten'upasaṅkami. tatra sudaṃ so hatthināgo yasmiṃ padese bhagavā viharati taṃ padesaṃ appaharitaṃ karoti, soṇḍāya ca bhagavato pānīyaṃ paribhojanīyaṃ upaṭṭhāpeti .

rakhasā

Meaning ?? psoriasis; (comm) disease in the place scratched by the nails

ragā

fem. name of one of the three daughters of Death; lit. lust; passion [√raj + ā] ✓

Grammar fem, from rajjati
Meaning name of one of the three daughters of Death; lit. lust; passion
Root Family √raj
Root √raj･3 ya (desire)
Construction √raj > rag + ā
Derivative kita (ā)
Phonetic Change j > g
Commentary (DHPa) athassa taṇhā aratī ragā'ti imā tisso dhītaro
Sanskrit rāgā
Sanskrit Root √raj √rañj 1, 4 (colour)

Example

atha kho taṇhā ca arati ca ragā ca māradhītaro yena māro pāpimā ten'upasaṅkamiṃsu.

SN 4.25 māradhītusuttaṃ
raṅga 1

masc. dye; colour [√rañj + a] ✓

Grammar masc, from rañjati
Meaning dye; colour
Root Family √rañj
Root √rañj･1 a (dye, desire)
Construction √rañj > raṅg + a
Derivative kita (a)
Phonetic Change ñj > ṅg
Sanskrit raṅga
Sanskrit Root √rañj √raj 1, 4 (colour)

Examples

tam'enaṃ rajako yasmiṃ yasmiṃ raṅgajāte upasaṃhareyya, yadi nīlakāya yadi pītakāya yadi lohitakāya yadi mañjeṭṭhakāya durattavaṇṇam'ev'assa aparisuddhavaṇṇam'ev'assa.

MN 7 vatthasuttaṃ

evaṃ vutte, bhante, rattapāṇi rajakaputto taṃ brāhmaṇaṃ etadavoca, ayaṃ kho te, makkaṭacchāpako raṅgakkhamo hi kho, no ākoṭanakkhamo, no vimajjanakkhamo'ti.

MN 56 upālisuttaṃ
raṅga 2

masc. paint [√rañj] ✗
raṅga 3

masc. stage; theatre [√rañj + a] ✓

Grammar masc, from rañjati
Meaning stage; theatre
Root Family √rañj
Root √rañj･1 a (dye, desire)
Construction √rañj > raṅg + a
Derivative kita (a)
Phonetic Change ñj > ṅg
Sanskrit raṅga
Sanskrit Root √rañj √raj 1, 4 (colour)

Example

muṭṭhīhi'pi yujjhanti, raṅgamajjhe'pi saṅghāṭiṃ pattharitvā naccakiṃ evaṃ vadanti, idha, bhagini, naccassū'ti, nalāṭikam'pi denti, vividham'pi anācāraṃ ācaranti.

VIN 1.2.13 kuladūsaka sikkhāpadaṃ
raṅga 4

masc. play [√rañj] ✗
raṅgakāra

masc. dyer, actor ✗
raṅgakkhama

adj. able to be dyed; can be coloured [raṅga + khama] ✓

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning able to be dyed; can be coloured
Construction raṅga + khama
Compound chaṭṭhī tappurisa (raṅgassa + khama)
Commentary (MNa) raṅgakkhamo hi kho'ti saviññāṇakam'pi aviññāṇakam'pi raṅgaṃ pivati. tasmā evam'āha.
Sanskrit raṅga + kṣama

Example

evaṃ vutte, bhante, rattapāṇi rajakaputto taṃ brāhmaṇaṃ etadavoca, ayaṃ kho te, makkaṭacchāpako raṅgakkhamo hi kho, no ākoṭanakkhamo, no vimajjanakkhamo'ti.

MN 56 upālisuttaṃ
raṅgajāta

nt. kind of die; type of colour; shade [raṅga + jāta] ✓

Grammar nt, comp
Meaning kind of die; type of colour; shade
Construction raṅga + jāta
Compound kammadhāraya (raṅga + jāta)
Sanskrit raṅga + jāta

Examples

tam'enaṃ rajako yasmiṃ yasmiṃ raṅgajāte upasaṃhareyya, yadi nīlakāya yadi pītakāya yadi lohitakāya yadi mañjeṭṭhakāya durattavaṇṇam'ev'assa aparisuddhavaṇṇam'ev'assa.

MN 7 vatthasuttaṃ

upasaṅkamitvā rattapāṇiṃ rajakaputtaṃ evaṃ vadehi, icchām'ahaṃ, samma rattapāṇi, imaṃ makkaṭacchāpakaṃ pīt'āvalepanaṃ nāma raṅgajātaṃ rajitaṃ ākoṭitapaccākoṭitaṃ ubhatobhāgavimaṭṭhan'ti.

MN 56 upālisuttaṃ
raṅgamajjha

masc. middle of the stage; centre stage [raṅga + majjha] ✓

Grammar masc, comp
Meaning middle of the stage; centre stage
Construction raṅga + majjha
Compound chaṭṭhī tappurisa (raṅgassa + majjha)
Sanskrit raṅga + madhya

Example

muṭṭhīhi'pi yujjhanti, raṅgamajjhe'pi saṅghāṭiṃ pattharitvā naccakiṃ evaṃ vadanti, idha, bhagini, naccassū'ti, nalāṭikam'pi denti, vividham'pi anācāraṃ ācaranti.

VIN 1.2.13 kuladūsaka sikkhāpadaṃ
raṅgaratta

adj. dyed with ✗
raṅgājīva

masc. painter or dyer ✗
racanā

fem. arrangement, treatise [√rac] ✗
racayati

pr. (+acc) arranges, composes, prepares [√rac] ✗
racayi

aor. (+acc) arranged, composed, prepared [√rac] ✗
racayitvā

abs. (+acc) having arranged; having prepared; (comm) having filled [√rac + *aya + itvā] ✓

Grammar abs of racayati, trans (+acc)
Meaning having arranged; having prepared; (comm) having filled
Root Family √rac
Root √rac･8 *aya (prepare, arrange)
Base √rac + aya > racaya
Construction racaya + itvā
Synonym kappetvā
Commentary (MNa) racayitvā'ti vaḍḍhetvā, paripūretvā'ti attho, kuṇapaṃ gahetvā kaṃsapātiyaṃ pakkhipitvā'ti vuttaṃ hoti.
Sanskrit racayitvā
Sanskrit Root √rac 10 (produce)

Example

seyyathā'pi, āvuso, kaṃsapāti ābhatā āpaṇā vā kammārakulā vā parisuddhā pariyodātā. tam'enaṃ sāmikā ahikuṇapaṃ vā kukkurakuṇapaṃ vā manussakuṇapaṃ vā racayitvā aññissā kaṃsapātiyā paṭikujjitvā antarāpaṇaṃ paṭipajjeyyuṃ.

MN 5 anaṅgaṇasuttaṃ
racita

pp. arranged, composed, prepared [√rac] ✗
racitvā

abs. having arranged, having composed, having prepared [√rac] ✗
racchā

fem. carriage road; highway; main road; lit. related to chariots [ratha + yā] ✓

Grammar fem, from ratha
Meaning carriage road; highway; main road; lit. related to chariots
Construction ratha + yā
Derivative taddhita (yā)
Phonetic Change thy > cch
Sanskrit rathyā

Example

sārambhaṃ nāma ... rājavatthunissitaṃ vā hoti, hatthisālānissitaṃ vā hoti, assasālānissitaṃ vā hoti, bandhan'āgāranissitaṃ vā hoti, pān'āgāranissitaṃ vā hoti, sūnanissitaṃ vā hoti, racchānissitaṃ vā hoti

VIN 1.2.6 kuṭikārasikkhāpadaṃ
racchānissita

adj. situated near a carriage road; located near a highway [racchā + nissita] ✓

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning situated near a carriage road; located near a highway
Construction racchā + nissita
Compound dutiyā tappurisa (racchaṃ + nissita)
Sanskrit rathyā + niśrita

Example

sārambhaṃ nāma ... rājavatthunissitaṃ vā hoti, hatthisālānissitaṃ vā hoti, assasālānissitaṃ vā hoti, bandhan'āgāranissitaṃ vā hoti, pān'āgāranissitaṃ vā hoti, sūnanissitaṃ vā hoti, racchānissitaṃ vā hoti

VIN 1.2.6 kuṭikārasikkhāpadaṃ
raja

adj. dusty; dirty [√raj + as + a] ~

Grammar adj, from rajas
Meaning dusty; dirty
Root Family √raj
Root √raj･1 a (colour)
Construction √raj + as + a
rajas + a
Derivative taddhita (a)
Synonym rajāpatha, saraja
Sanskrit raja
Sanskrit Root √raj √rañj 1, 4 (colour)
rajaka 1

masc. painter; artist; lit. who dyes or paints [√raj + aka] ✓

Grammar masc, agent, from rajati
Meaning painter; artist; lit. who dyes or paints
Root Family √raj
Root √raj･1 a (colour)
Construction √raj + aka
Derivative kita (aka)
Synonym cittakāraka
Commentary (SNa) rajako'ti vatthesu raṅgena rūpasamuṭṭhāpanako.
Sanskrit rañjaka
Sanskrit Root √raj √rañj 1, 4 (colour)

Example

seyyathā'pi, bhikkhave, rajako vā cittakārako vā rajanāya vā lākhāya vā haliddiyā vā nīliyā vā mañjiṭṭhāya vā suparimaṭṭhe phalake vā bhittiyā vā dussapaṭṭe vā itthirūpaṃ vā purisarūpaṃ vā abhinimmineyya sabb'aṅgapacc'aṅgiṃ.

SN 22.100 dutiyagaddulabaddhasuttaṃ
rajaka 2

masc. laundryman; dyer; lit. who dyes or paints [√raj + aka] ✓

Grammar masc, agent, from rajati
Meaning laundryman; dyer; lit. who dyes or paints
Root Family √raj
Root √raj･1 a (colour)
Construction √raj + aka
Derivative kita (aka)
Sanskrit rañjaka
Sanskrit Root √raj √rañj 1, 4 (colour)

Examples

kiñ'c'āpi taṃ hoti vatthaṃ parisuddhaṃ pariyodātaṃ, atha khv'assa hoti yeva anusahagato ūsagandho vā khāragandho vā gomayagandho vā asamūhato. tam'enaṃ rajako sāmikānaṃ deti.

SN 22.89 khemakasuttaṃ

tam'enaṃ rajako yasmiṃ yasmiṃ raṅgajāte upasaṃhareyya, yadi nīlakāya yadi pītakāya yadi lohitakāya yadi mañjeṭṭhakāya durattavaṇṇam'ev'assa aparisuddhavaṇṇam'ev'assa.

MN 7 vatthasuttaṃ
rajakattharaṇa

nt. place where the laundry workers spread their cloth [rajaka + attharaṇa] ✓

Grammar nt, comp
Meaning place where the laundry workers spread their cloth
Construction rajaka + attharaṇa
Commentary (VINa) rajak'attharaṇaṃ gantvā'ti rajakatitthaṃ gantvā, tañ'hi yasmā tattha rajakā vatthāni attharanti, tasmā rajak'attharaṇan'ti vuccati.

Example

tena kho pana samayena chabbaggiyā bhikkhū rajak'attharaṇaṃ gantvā rajakabhaṇḍikaṃ avaharitvā ārāmaṃ haritvā bhājesuṃ.

VIN 1.1.2 dutiyapārājikaṃ
rajakadoṇi

fem. wash bucket; wooden wash basin [rajaka + doṇi] ~

Grammar fem, comp
Meaning wash bucket; wooden wash basin
Construction rajaka + doṇi
rajakaputta

masc. dyer's son; colourist's son [rajaka + putta] ✓

Grammar masc, comp
Meaning dyer's son; colourist's son
Construction rajaka + putta
Compound chaṭṭhī tappurisa (rajakassa + putta)
Sanskrit rañjaka + putra

Example

upasaṅkamitvā rattapāṇiṃ rajakaputtaṃ evaṃ vadehi, icchām'ahaṃ, samma rattapāṇi, imaṃ makkaṭacchāpakaṃ pīt'āvalepanaṃ nāma raṅgajātaṃ rajitaṃ ākoṭitapaccākoṭitaṃ ubhatobhāgavimaṭṭhan'ti.

MN 56 upālisuttaṃ
rajakabhaṇḍikā

fem. bundle of laundry; lit. dyer's goods [rajaka + bhaṇḍikā] ✓

Grammar fem, comp
Meaning bundle of laundry; lit. dyer's goods
Construction rajaka + bhaṇḍikā
Commentary (VINa) rajakabhaṇḍikan'ti rajakānaṃ bhaṇḍikaṃ. rajakā sāyanhasamaye nagaraṃ pavisantā bahūni vatthāni ek'ekaṃ bhaṇḍikaṃ bandhanti. tato ekaṃ bhaṇḍikaṃ tesaṃ pamādena apassantānaṃ avaharitvā thenetvā'ti attho.
Sanskrit rañjaka + bhāṇḍaka

Example

tena kho pana samayena chabbaggiyā bhikkhū rajak'attharaṇaṃ gantvā rajakabhaṇḍikaṃ avaharitvā ārāmaṃ haritvā bhājesuṃ.

VIN 1.1.2 dutiyapārājikaṃ
rajakkha

adj. with dirt in the eye [rajas + akkha] ✓

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning with dirt in the eye
Construction rajas + akkha
Commentary (MNa) apparaj'akkhajātikā'ti paññāmaye akkhimhi appaṃ parittaṃ rāgadosamoharajaṃ etesaṃ, evaṃsabhāvā'ti apparaj'akkhajātikā
Sanskrit rajas + akṣa

Example

desetu, bhante, bhagavā dhammaṃ, desetu sugato dhammaṃ. santi sattā apparaj'akkhajātikā, assavanatā dhammassa parihāyanti. bhavissanti dhammassa aññātāro'ti.

rajakkhandha

Meaning money, coins
Root Family √raj
Root √raj･1 a (colour)
Construction √raj + ata

Sanskrit rajata
Sanskrit Root √raj √rañj 1, 4 (colour)

Examples

idha, visākhe, mātugāmo yaṃ bhattā āharati dhanaṃ vā dhaññaṃ vā rajataṃ vā jātarūpaṃ vā taṃ ārakkhena guttiyā sampādeti, tattha ca hoti adhuttī athenī asoṇḍī avināsikā.

AN 8.49 paṭhamaidhalokikasuttaṃ

anupubbena medhāvī,
thokaṃ thokaṃ khaṇe khaṇe,
kammāro rajatass'eva,
niddhame malam'attano.

seyyathā'pi nāma suddhaṃ vatthaṃ apagatakāḷakaṃ samma'd'eva rajanaṃ paṭiggaṇheyya, evam'eva tesaṃ caturāsītipāṇasahassānaṃ tasmiṃ'y'eva āsane virajaṃ vītamalaṃ dhammacakkhuṃ udapādi, yaṃ kiñci samudayadhammaṃ sabbaṃ taṃ nirodhadhamman'ti

rajanīye na rajjati, dussanīye na dussati, mohanīye na muyhati, kuppanīye na kuppati, madanīye na majjati.

rajamādeti

sandhi. gets dirty; gathers dust; lit. takes dust [rajaṃ + ādeti] ✓

Grammar sandhi, masc + pr
Meaning gets dirty; gathers dust; lit. takes dust
Construction rajaṃ + ādeti
Commentary (SNa) pañcahi pana nīvaraṇeh'eva kilesarajaṃ ādiyati gaṇhāti parāmasati.
Sanskrit rajaḥ + ādatte

Examples

kati jāgarataṃ suttā,
kati suttesu jāgarā,
katibhi rajam'ādeti,
katibhi parisujjhatī'ti.

pañca jāgarataṃ suttā,
pañca suttesu jāgarā,
pañcabhi rajam'ādeti,
pañcabhi parisujjhatī'ti.

SN 1.6 jāgarasuttaṃ
rajas 1

masc. (mental) impurity; defilement [√raj + as] ✓

Grammar masc, mano group, from rajati
Meaning (mental) impurity; defilement
Root Family √raj
Root √raj･1 a (colour)
Construction √raj + as
Derivative kita (as)
Synonym kilesa, kelisa, klesa, paṅka, saṅkilesa, saṃkilesa
Commentary (ANa) rajan'ti āgantukaupakkilesaṃ.
Notes rajo in comps
Sanskrit rajas
Sanskrit Root √raj √rañj 1, 4 (colour)

Examples

pamādo rajo pamādo,
pamād'ānupatito rajo,
appamādena vijjāya,
abbahe sallam'attano'ti.

SNP 22 uṭṭhānasuttaṃ
cūḷavaggo 10

ath'āparaṃ pañca rajāni loke,
yesaṃ satīmā vinayāya sikkhe,
rūpesu saddesu atho rasesu,
gandhesu phassesu sahetha rāgaṃ.

SNP 54 sāriputtasuttaṃ
aṭṭhakavaggo 16
rajas 2

masc. dust; dirt [√raj + as] ✓

Grammar masc, mano group, from rajati
Meaning dust; dirt
Root Family √raj
Root √raj･1 a (colour)
Construction √raj + as
Derivative kita (as)
Synonym paṃsu
Commentary (ANa) rajan'ti āgantukaupakkilesaṃ.
Notes rajo in comps
Sanskrit rajas
Sanskrit Root √raj √rañj 1, 4 (colour)

Examples

yo appaduṭṭhassa narassa dussati,
suddhassa posassa anaṅgaṇassa,
tam'eva bālaṃ pacceti pāpaṃ,
sukhumo rajo paṭivātaṃ'va khitto.

DHP 125 pāpavaggo

tayo vitakke kusale vitakkaye,
tayo pana akusale nirākare,
sa ve vitakkāni vicāritāni,
sameti vuṭṭhī'va rajaṃ samūhataṃ.

rajas 3

madhurañ'ca pavanti sabbaso,

ehi ramāma supupphite vane.

THI 71 subhājīvakambavanikātherīgāthā
rajas 4

rajānukiṇṇa

adj. scattered with dust; strewn with dirt [rajas + anukiṇṇa] ✓

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning scattered with dust; strewn with dirt
Construction rajas + anukiṇṇa
Compound tatiyā tappurisa (rajasā + anukiṇṇa)
Commentary (UDa) ubhayam'etaṃ rajānukiṇṇan'ti etaṃ ubhayaṃ pattaṃ pattabbañca rāgarajādīhi anukiṇṇaṃ. sampatte hi vatthukāme anubhavanto rāgarajena vokiṇṇo hoti, tattha pana saṃkiliṭṭhacittassa phale āyatiṃ āpanne domanassuppattiyā dosarajena vokiṇṇo hoti, ubhayatthā'pi moharajena vokiṇṇo hoti. kassa pan'etaṃ rajānukiṇṇanti āha (UDa) ubhayam'etaṃ rajānukiṇṇan'ti tadubhayaṃ dukkharaj'ānukiṇṇaṃ.
Sanskrit rajas + anukṝ

Example

yañ'ca pattaṃ yañ'ca pattabbaṃ, ubhayam'etaṃ raj'ānukiṇṇaṃ, āturass'ānusikkhato. ye ca sikkhāsārā sīlabbataṃ jīvitaṃ brahmacariyaṃ upaṭṭhānasārā, ayam'eko anto.

UD58 gaṇikāsuttaṃ
rajāpatha 1

adj. dusty; dirty; lit. dirty road [rajo + patha] ✓

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning dusty; dirty; lit. dirty road
Construction rajo + patha
Compound kammadhāraya (rajo + patha)
Synonym raja, saraja
Commentary (ANa) rajāpatho'ti rāgaraj'ādīnaṃ uṭṭhānaṭṭhānan'ti mahāaṭṭhakathāyaṃ vuttaṃ. āgamanapatho'ti'pi vaṭṭati.
Sanskrit rajas + patha

Example

sambādho ghar'āvāso rajāpatho, abbhokāso pabbajjā. na'y'idaṃ sukaraṃ agāraṃ ajjhāvasatā ek'antaparipuṇṇaṃ ek'antaparisuddhaṃ saṅkhalikhitaṃ brahmacariyaṃ carituṃ.

MN 112 chabbisodhanasuttaṃ
rajāpatha 2

masc. dirty place; lit. dirty road [rajo + patha] ✓

Grammar masc, comp
Meaning dirty place; lit. dirty road
Construction rajo + patha
Compound kammadhāraya (rajo + patha)
Commentary (MNa) rajāpathe'ti rajapathe. ayam'eva vā pāṭho, rajassa āgamanaṭṭhāne vā vuṭṭhānuṭṭhāne vā heṭṭhāmañce vā thusakoṭṭhake vā bhājanantare vā, yattha rajena okirīyatī'ti attho.
Sanskrit rajas + patha

Example

seyyathā'pi, āvuso, kaṃsapāti ābhatā āpaṇā vā kammārakulā vā rajena ca malena ca pariyonaddhā. tam'enaṃ sāmikā na c'eva paribhuñjeyyuṃ na ca pariyodapeyyuṃ, rajāpathe ca naṃ nikkhipeyyuṃ.

MN 5 anaṅgaṇasuttaṃ
rajāpeti

pr. (+acc) makes dye; causes to colour [√raj + *āpe + ti] ✓

Grammar pr, caus of rajati, trans (+acc)
Meaning makes dye; causes to colour
Root Family √raj
Root √raj･1 *āpe (colour)
Base √raj + āpe > rajāpe (caus)
Construction rajāpe + ti
Sanskrit rajayati, rañjayati
Sanskrit Root √raj √rañj 1, 4 (colour)

Examples

yo pana bhikkhu aññātikāya bhikkhuniyā purāṇacīvaraṃ dhovāpeyya vā rajāpeyya vā ākoṭāpeyya vā, nissaggiyaṃ pācittiyaṃ.

VIN PAT NP 4 purāṇacīvarasikkhāpadaṃ

yo pana bhikkhu aññātikāya bhikkhuniyā eḷakalomāni dhovāpeyya vā rajāpeyya vā vijaṭāpeyya vā, nissaggiyaṃ pācittiyaṃ.

VIN PAT NP 17 eḷakalomadhovāpanasikkhāpadaṃ
raji

aor. dyed [√raj] ✗
rajita

pp. dyed; coloured [√raj + ita] ✓

Grammar pp of rajati
Meaning dyed; coloured
Root Family √raj
Root √raj･1 a (colour)
Construction √raj + ita
Derivative kita (ita)
Synonym ratta
Sanskrit rakta
Sanskrit Root √raj √rañj 1, 4 (colour)

Example

upasaṅkamitvā rattapāṇiṃ rajakaputtaṃ evaṃ vadehi, icchām'ahaṃ, samma rattapāṇi, imaṃ makkaṭacchāpakaṃ pīt'āvalepanaṃ nāma raṅgajātaṃ rajitaṃ ākoṭitapaccākoṭitaṃ ubhatobhāgavimaṭṭhan'ti.

MN 56 upālisuttaṃ
rajitabba

ptp. should be dyed [√raj] ✗
rajitar

masc. who dyes; dyer [√raj + itar] ~

Grammar masc, agent, from rajati
Meaning who dyes; dyer
Root Family √raj
Root √raj･1 a (colour)
Construction √raj + itar
Derivative kita (itar)
Sanskrit Root √raj √rañj 1, 4 (colour)
rajitvā

abs. (+acc) having dyed; having coloured [√raj + itvā] ~

Grammar abs of rajati, trans (+acc)
Meaning having dyed; having coloured
Root Family √raj
Root √raj･1 a (colour)
Construction √raj + itvā
Sanskrit raktvā
Sanskrit Root √raj √rañj 1, 4 (colour)
rajokiṇṇa

adj. strewn with dust; covered with dirt; lit. dust scattered down [rajo + okiṇṇa] ✓

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning strewn with dust; covered with dirt; lit. dust scattered down
Construction rajo + okiṇṇa
Compound tatiyā tappurisa (rajasā + okiṇṇa)
Commentary (VINt) raj'okiṇṇe'ti rajasā okiṇṇe
Sanskrit rajas + avakīrṇa

Example

disvāna mahāpajāpatiṃ gotamiṃ etadavoca, kiṃ nu tvaṃ, gotami, sūnehi pādehi rajokiṇṇena gattena dukkhī dummanā assumukhī rudamānā bahidvārakoṭṭhake ṭhitā'ti?

AN 8.51 gotamīsuttaṃ
rajojalla

nt. dust and mud; dust and dirt [rajo + jalla] ✓

Grammar nt, comp
Meaning dust and mud; dust and dirt
Construction rajo + jalla
Compound dvanda (rajo ca jalla ca)
Commentary (SNa) rajojallan'ti rajañ'ca jallañ'ca.
Sanskrit rajojala (bsk)

Examples

na naggacariyā na jaṭā na paṅkā,
n'ānāsakā thaṇḍilasāyikā vā,
rajojallaṃ ukkuṭikappadhānaṃ,
sodhenti maccaṃ avitiṇṇakaṅkhaṃ.

DHP 141 daṇḍavaggo

seyyathā'pi, bhikkhave, gimhānaṃ pacchime māse ūhataṃ rajojallaṃ, tam'enaṃ mahāakālamegho ṭhānaso antaradhāpeti vūpasameti.

SN 54.9 vesālīsuttaṃ
rajojalladhara

adj. wearing dust and mud ✗
rajojallika

masc. ascetic who is covered in dust and mud [rajo + jalla + ika] ✓

Grammar masc, comp, from rajojalla
Meaning ascetic who is covered in dust and mud
Construction rajo + jalla + ika
rajojalla + ika
Derivative taddhita (ika)
Commentary (MNa) rajojallikassā'ti rajojalladhārino.
Sanskrit rajojala (bsk) + ika

Example

n'āhaṃ, bhikkhave, rajojallikassa rajojallikamattena sāmaññaṃ vadāmi.

MN 40 cūḷāssapurasuttaṃ
rajojallikamatta

nt. mere fact of being covered in dust and mud [rajojallika + matta] ✓

Grammar nt, abstr, comp
Meaning mere fact of being covered in dust and mud
Construction rajojallika + matta
Sanskrit rajojala + mātra

Example

n'āhaṃ, bhikkhave, saṅghāṭikassa saṅghāṭidhāraṇamattena sāmaññaṃ vadāmi. n'āhaṃ, bhikkhave, acelakassa acelakamattena sāmaññaṃ vadāmi. n'āhaṃ, bhikkhave, rajojallikassa rajojallikamattena sāmaññaṃ vadāmi.

MN 40 cūḷāssapurasuttaṃ
rajodhātu

fem. element of dust; state of dirt; (comm) dirty places [rajo + dhātu] ✓

Grammar fem, abstr, comp
Meaning element of dust; state of dirt; (comm) dirty places
Construction rajo + dhātu
Compound kammadhāraya (rajo + dhātu)
Commentary (MNa) rajodhātuyo'ti rajaokiraṇaṭṭhānāni. hatthapiṭṭhipādapiṭṭh'ādīni sandhāya vadati.
Sanskrit rajas + dhātu

Example

ek'ūnapaññāsa ājīvakasate, ek'ūnapaññāsa paribbājakasate, ek'ūnapaññāsa nāg'āvāsasate, vīse indriyasate, tiṃse nirayasate, chattiṃsa rajodhātuyo, satta saññīgabbhā, satta asaññīgabbhā, satta nigaṇṭhigabbhā, satta devā

MN 76 sandakasuttaṃ
rajopatha

adj. dusty, dirty; lit. in dusty condition, in state of dirt ✗
rajosūka

nt. dust particles; fine grains of dust; (comm) dirt and dust particles [rajo + sūka] ✓

Grammar nt, comp
Meaning dust particles; fine grains of dust; (comm) dirt and dust particles
Construction rajo + sūka
Compound kammadhāraya (rajo + sūka)
Commentary (MNa) rajosūkan'ti rajo ca vīhisuk'ādi ca sūkaṃ.
Sanskrit rajas + sūkṣma

Example

mā ca vāt'ātape cārittaṃ anuyuñji, mā te vāt'ātape cārittaṃ anuyuttassa rajosūkaṃ vaṇamukhaṃ anuddhaṃsesi. vaṇānurakkhī ca, ambho purisa, vihareyyāsi vaṇasāropī'ti.

MN 105 sunakkhattasuttaṃ
rajoharaṇa

nt. dusting cloth; floor mat; lit. carrying dirt [rajo + haraṇa] ✓

Grammar nt, comp
Meaning dusting cloth; floor mat; lit. carrying dirt
Construction rajo + haraṇa
Compound dutiyā tappurisa (rajaṃ + haraṇa)
Commentary (ANa) rajoharaṇan'ti rajasammajjanacoḷakaṃ, pādapuñchan'ti, tass'eva nāmaṃ.
Sanskrit rajoharaṇa

Example

seyyathā'pi, bhante, rajoharaṇaṃ sucim'pi ... puñchati, na ca tena rajoharaṇaṃ aṭṭīyati vā harāyati vā jigucchati vā.

AN 9.11 sīhanādasuttaṃ
rajoharaṇasama

adj. like a dusting cloth; similar to a cleaning rag; lit. dust carrying same [rajoharaṇa + sama] ✓

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning like a dusting cloth; similar to a cleaning rag; lit. dust carrying same
Construction rajoharaṇa + sama
Compound tatiyā tappurisa (rajoharaṇena + sama)
Sanskrit rajoharaṇa + sama

Example

seyyathāpi, bhante, rajoharaṇaṃ lohitagatam'pi puñchati, na ca tena rajoharaṇaṃ aṭṭīyati vā harāyati vā jigucchati vā, evam'evaṃ kho ahaṃ, bhante, rajoharaṇasamena cetasā viharāmi vipulena mahaggatena appamāṇena averena abyāpajjena.

AN 9.11 sīhanādasuttaṃ
rajja

nt. kingship; rulership; sovereignty; dominion; power [√rāj + ya] ✓

Grammar nt, abstr
Meaning kingship; rulership; sovereignty; dominion; power
Root Family √rāj
Root √rāj･1 a (rule, shine)
Construction √rāj + ya
Derivative kita (ya)
Phonetic Change y > j
Synonym issariya, rajjatta
Sanskrit rājya
Sanskrit Root √rāj 1 (be kingly)

Examples

appabhogo mahātaṇho,
khattiye jāyate kule,
so ca rajjaṃ patthayati,
taṃ parābhavato mukhaṃ.

SNP 6 parābhavasuttaṃ
uragavaggo 6

ṭhānañ'hi so manuj'indo,
rajjaṃ laddhāna khattiyo,
so kuddho rājadaṇḍena,
tasmiṃ pakkamate bhusaṃ,
tasmā taṃ parivajjeyya,
rakkhaṃ jīvitam'attano.

SN 3.1 daharasuttaṃ
rajjati 1

pr. (+loc) finds pleasure (in); is enamoured (with); is infatuated (with); is attached (to) [√raj + ya + ti] ✓

Grammar pr, pass, intrans (+loc)
Meaning finds pleasure (in); is enamoured (with); is infatuated (with); is attached (to)
Root Family √raj
Root √raj･3 ya (desire)
Base √raj + ya > rajja (pass)
Construction rajja + ti
Phonetic Change y > j
Antonym virajjati
Sanskrit rajyati
Sanskrit Root √raj √rañj 1, 4 (colour)

Examples

aniccā hi calā saddhā,
evaṃ diṭṭhā hi sā mayā,
rajjanti'pi virajjanti,
tattha kiṃ jiyyate muni.

TH 179 sāṭimattiyattheragāthā

rajanīye rajjati, dussanīye dussati, mohanīye muyhati, kuppanīye kuppati, madanīye majjati.

AN 5.81 rajanīyasuttaṃ
rajjati 2

pr. (+loc) takes pleasure (in); finds pleasure (in) [√raj + ya + ti] ✓

Grammar pr, pass, intrans (+loc)
Meaning takes pleasure (in); finds pleasure (in)
Root Family √raj
Root √raj･3 ya (desire)
Base √raj + ya > rajja (pass)
Construction rajja + ti
Phonetic Change y > j
Antonym virajjati
Sanskrit rajyati
Sanskrit Root √raj √rañj 1, 4 (colour)

Examples

na so rajjati rūpesu,
rūpaṃ disvā paṭissato,
virattacitto vedeti,
tañ'ca n'ājjhosa tiṭṭhati.

SN 35.95 mālukyaputtasuttaṃ

dhono na hi tena maññati,
yadidaṃ diṭṭhasutaṃ mutesu vā,
n'āññena visuddhim'icchati,
na hi so rajjati no virajjatī'ti.

aṭṭhakavaggo 6

prp. finding pleasure in [√raj] ✗

DNa 19.8 mahāgovinda suttavaṇṇanā

sutvāna nesaṃ etadahosi, nissaṃsayaṃ kho, āvuso, āyasmā bhaddiyo kāḷīgodhāya putto anabhirato brahmacariyaṃ carati, yaṃ'sa pubbe agāriyabhūtassa rajjasukhaṃ, so tam'anussaramāno araññagato'pi rukkhamūlagato'pi suññ'āgāragato'pi abhikkhaṇaṃ udānaṃ udānesi, aho sukhaṃ, aho sukhan'ti!

UD20 bhaddiyasuttaṃ
rajjasutta

nt. Saṃyutta Nikāya 4.20 (SN4.20) ✗
rajjaṃ kāreti

idiom. rules; reigns; is in charge; lit. causes to make a kingdom ✓

Grammar idiom, nt + pr
Meaning rules; reigns; is in charge; lit. causes to make a kingdom

Examples

rājā nāma yo koci rajjaṃ kāreti.

VIN 1.4.1.10 rājasikkhāpadaṃ

andhabālo'si, mahārāja, kiñ'c'āpi mahābhakkho'si, anekasūpabyañjanavikatikaṃ doṇapākaṃ bhojanaṃ bhuñjasi, dvīsu raṭṭhesu rajjaṃ kāresi, paññā pana te mandā'ti

DHPa 1.5.1 aññatarapurisa vatthu
rajjaṃ kāretvā

idiom. having ruled; having reigned; lit. having caused to make a kingdom ✓

Grammar idiom, nt + abs
Meaning having ruled; having reigned; lit. having caused to make a kingdom

Example

dhammena rajjaṃ kāretvā,
asmiṃ pathavimaṇḍale,
mahaddhane mahābhoge,
aḍḍhe ajāyi'haṃ kule.

AN 7.62 mettasuttaṃ
rajjaṃ kārenta

idiom. ruling; reigning; lit. causing to make a kingdom ✓

Grammar idiom, nt + prp
Meaning ruling; reigning; lit. causing to make a kingdom

Examples

atīte bārāṇasiyaṃ brahmadatte rajjaṃ kārente bodhisatto kāsigāmake kumbhakārakule nibbattitvā kumbhakārakammaṃ katvā puttadāraṃ posesi.

JAa 178 kacchapa jātaka vaṇṇanā

atīte bārāṇasiyaṃ brahmadatte rajjaṃ kārente bodhisatto bhātikasatassa kaniṭṭho ahosī'ti sabbaṃ heṭṭhā takkasilājātake vuttanayen'eva vitthāretabbaṃ.

JAa 132 bhīruka jātakavaṇṇanā
rajjaṃ laddhāna

idiom. having taken the throne; having come into power; lit. having got the kingdom ✓

Grammar idiom, nt + abs

so kuddho rājadaṇḍena,

tasmā taṃ parivajjeyya,

SN 3.1 daharasuttaṃ
rajji

Meaning rope; cord; line

Examples

visaṃ khādanti mucchitā,
rajjuyā bajjha mīyanti,
pabbatām'api kandare.

AN 7.64 kodhanasuttaṃ

daḷhāya rajjuyā bandhitvā daḷhe khīle vā thambhe vā upanibandheyya. atha kho te, bhikkhave, chappāṇakā nānāvisayā nānāgocarā sakaṃ sakaṃ gocaravisayaṃ āviñcheyyuṃ.

SN 35.247 chappāṇakasuttaṃ
rajjuka

SN 3.10 bandhanasuttaṃ

raññā pana vandite bhagavantaṃ avanditvā ṭhātuṃ samattho nāma ekasākiyo'pi n'āhosi, sabbe vandiṃsu'y'eva.

JAa 1.N.3 santike nidānakathā
rañño 1

masc. to king; for king [√rāj + a + ino] ✓

Grammar masc, dat sg of rāja, atta group, irreg
Meaning to king; for king
Root Family √rāj
Root √rāj･1 a (rule, shine)
Construction √rāj + a + ino
rāja + ino > rājino > rājyno > rañño
Phonetic Change ny > ññ
Sanskrit rājñe
Sanskrit Root √rāj 1 (be kingly)

Example

seyyathā'pi, bhikkhave, coraṃ āgucāriṃ gahetvā rañño dasseyyuṃ, ayaṃ te, deva, coro āgucārī, imassa yaṃ icchasi taṃ daṇḍaṃ paṇehī'ti

SN 12.63 puttamaṃsūpamasuttaṃ
rañño 2

masc. of king; king’s [√rāj + a + ino] ✓

Grammar masc, gen sg of rāja, atta group, irreg
Meaning of king; king’s
Root Family √rāj
Root √rāj･1 a (rule, shine)
Construction √rāj + a + ino
rāja + ino > rājino > rājyno > rañño
Phonetic Change ny > ññ
Sanskrit rājñaḥ
Sanskrit Root √rāj 1 (be kingly)

Examples

seyyathā'pi, rāhula, rañño nāgo īsādanto urūḷhavā abhijāto saṅgām'āvacaro saṅgāmagato purimehi'pi pādehi kammaṃ karoti, pacchimehi'pi pādehi kammaṃ karoti

MN 61 ambalaṭṭhika rāhulovādasuttaṃ

seyyathā'pi saha bhaṇḍena gahitacoraṃ, vadhetha nan'ti rañño āṇāya rājapurisā bandhitvā catukke catukke pahārasatāni dentā āghātanaṃ nenti.

VISM 1.9.2 karuṇābhāvanākathā
rañño 3

masc. when king [√rāj + a + ino] ✓

Grammar masc, gen sg of rāja, atta group, gen abs, irreg
Meaning when king
Root Family √rāj
Root √rāj･1 a (rule, shine)
Construction √rāj + a + ino
rāja + ino > rājino > rājyno > rañño
Phonetic Change ny > ññ
Sanskrit rājñaḥ
Sanskrit Root √rāj 1 (be kingly)

Examples

atha kho bhagavā acirapakkantassa rañño māgadhassa ajātasattussa vedehiputtassa bhikkhū āmantesi

DN 2.32 sāmaññaphalasuttaṃ

bhūtapubb'āhaṃ, bhikkhu, rājā ahosiṃ khattiyo muddh'āvasitto. tassa mayhaṃ, bhikkhu, rañño sato khattiyassa muddh'āvasittassa caturāsītinagarasahassāni ahesuṃ kusāvatī rājadhānippamukhāni.

SN 22.96 gomayapiṇḍasuttaṃ
raṭṭha

nt. country; land; kingdom; realm [√rāj + ta] ✓

Grammar nt
Meaning country; land; kingdom; realm
Root Family √rāj
Root √rāj･1 a (rule, shine)
Construction √rāj + ta
Derivative kita (ta)
Phonetic Change jt > ṭṭh
Synonym vijita
Sanskrit rāṣṭra
Sanskrit Root √rāj 1 (be kingly)

Examples

no ce labhetha nipakaṃ sahāyaṃ,
saddhiṃcaraṃ sādhuvihāridhīraṃ,
rājā'va raṭṭhaṃ vijitaṃ pahāya,
eko care mātaṅg'araññ'eva nāgo.

DHP 329 nāgavaggo

dhajo rathassa paññāṇaṃ,
dhūmo paññāṇam'aggino,
rājā raṭṭhassa paññāṇaṃ,
bhattā paññāṇam'itthiyā'ti.

SN 1.72 rathasuttaṃ
raṭṭhapāla

masc. personal name of an arahant monk ✗
raṭṭhapālattheragāthā

fem. Theragāthā 251 (TH251) ✗
raṭṭhapālasutta

nt. Majjhima Nikāya 82 (MN82) ✗
raṭṭhapiṇḍa

masc. country’s alms food; food from the people [raṭṭha + piṇḍa] ✓

Grammar masc, comp
Meaning country’s alms food; food from the people
Construction raṭṭha + piṇḍa
Compound chaṭṭhī tappurisa (raṭṭhassa + piṇḍa)
Sanskrit rāṣṭra + piṇḍa

Example

seyyo ayoguḷo bhutto,
tatto aggisikh'ūpamo,
yañ'ce bhuñjeyya dussīlo,
raṭṭhapiṇḍam'asaññato.

DHP 308 nirayavaggo
raṭṭhapūjita

adj. revered by a kingdom [raṭṭha + pūjita] ~

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning revered by a kingdom
Construction raṭṭha + pūjita
Commentary (VINa) gāmena pūjitaṃ gāmassa vā pūjitan'ti gāmapūjitaṃ. es'eva nayo sesapadesu'pi ... raṭṭhan'ti sakalarajjaṃ veditabbaṃ, sakalarajjam'pi hi kadāci kadāci tassa rukkhassa pūjaṃ karoti, tena vuttaṃ raṭṭhapūjitan'ti.
raṭṭhavaḍḍhana

adj. which develops the kingdom; which fosters the country; lit. kingdom increasing [raṭṭha + vaḍḍhana] ~

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning which develops the kingdom; which fosters the country; lit. kingdom increasing
Construction raṭṭha + vaḍḍhana
Compound dutiyā tappurisa (raṭṭhaṃ + vaḍḍhana)
Commentary (CPa) raṭṭhavaḍḍhanā'ti raṭṭhavaḍḍhīkara. (JAa) sivīnaṃ raṭṭhavaḍḍhane'ti siviraṭṭhassa vuddhikare.
Sanskrit rāṣṭra + vardhana
raṭṭhavant

adj. ruling the country; in charge of the land; lit. having country quality [√rāj + ta + vant] ✓

Grammar adj, from raṭṭha
Meaning ruling the country; in charge of the land; lit. having country quality
Root Family √rāj
Root √rāj･1 a (rule, shine)
Construction √rāj + ta + vant
raṭṭha + vant
Derivative taddhita (vant)
Phonetic Change jt > ṭṭh
Commentary (VVa) raṭṭhavanto'ti raṭṭhasāmikā, anekayojanaparimāṇaṃ raṭṭhaṃ pasāsantā'ti adhippāyo.
Sanskrit rāṣṭra + vat
Sanskrit Root √rāj 1 (be kingly)

Example

mahaddhanā mahābhogā,
raṭṭhavanto'pi khattiyā,
aññam'aññ'ābhigijjhanti,
kāmesu analaṅ'katā.

raṇa

nt. conflict; trouble; harm; (comm) defilement [√raṇ + a] ✓

Grammar nt
Meaning conflict; trouble; harm; (comm) defilement
Root Family √raṇ
Root √raṇ×1 a (conflict, make war)

Commentary (SNa) raṇañ'jahā'ti kilesañ'jahā.

Example

appamattā raṇañ'jahā'ti.

rata

pp. (+loc) delighted (with); devoted (to); taking pleasure (in); pleased (with); enjoying [√ram + ta] ✓

Grammar pp of ramati (+loc)
Meaning delighted (with); devoted (to); taking pleasure (in); pleased (with); enjoying

Root √ram･1 a (delight, please)
Construction √ram + ta
Derivative kita (ta)
Phonetic Change mt > t
Synonym attamana, pamudita, pamodita, pasanna, pahaṭṭha, pīṇita, matta, rāma, vitta, sampahaṃsita, sammudita, sukhita
Sanskrit rata

Examples

evaṃ visesato ñatvā,
appamādamhi paṇḍitā,
appamāde pamodanti,
ariyānaṃ gocare ratā.

DHP 22 appamādavaggo

tass'āhaṃ vacanaṃ sutvā,
vihāsiṃ sāsane rato,
samādhiṃ paṭipādesiṃ,
uttam'atthassa pattiyā.

TH 236 cūḷapanthakattheragāthā
ratattha

adj. for pleasure [rata + attha] ~

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning for pleasure
Construction rata + attha
ratana 1

nt. jewel; gem; gemstone ✓

Grammar nt
Meaning jewel; gem; gemstone
Commentary (VIN 2.5.9.4) ratanaṃ nāma muttā maṇi veḷuriyo saṅkho silā pavālaṃ rajataṃ jātarūpaṃ lohit'aṅko masāragallaṃ.
Sanskrit ratna

Examples

yattakaṃ tulitā esā,
tuyhaṃ dhītā anopamā,
tato aṭṭhaguṇaṃ dassaṃ,
hiraññaṃ ratanāni ca.

THI 54 anopamātherīgāthā

yaṃ kiñci vittaṃ idha vā huraṃ vā,
saggesu vā yaṃ ratanaṃ paṇītaṃ,
na no samaṃ atthi tathāgatena,
idam'pi buddhe ratanaṃ paṇītaṃ,
etena saccena suvatthi hotu.

SNP 13 ratanasuttaṃ,
cūḷavaggo 1
ratana 2

nt. treasure; precious thing ✓

Grammar nt
Meaning treasure; precious thing
Sanskrit ratna

Examples

tass'imāni satta ratanāni bhavanti, seyyath'idaṃ, cakkaratanaṃ, hatthiratanaṃ, assaratanaṃ, maṇiratanaṃ, itthiratanaṃ, gahapatiratanaṃ, pariṇāyakaratanam'eva sattamaṃ.

MN 91 brahmāyusuttaṃ

puna caparaṃ, bhikkhave, mahāsamuddo bahuratano anekaratano. tatr'imāni ratanāni, seyyath'idaṃ muttā maṇi veḷuriyo saṅkho silā pavāḷaṃ rajataṃ jātarūpaṃ lohitaṅgo masāragallaṃ

UD 45 uposathasuttaṃ

nt. queen; woman; lit. jewel; treasure ✓

Grammar nt
Meaning queen; woman; lit. jewel; treasure
Commentary (VINa) ratanaṃ vuccati mahesī
Sanskrit ratna

Examples

VIN PAT PC 83 antepurasikkhāpadaṃ

et'ādisaṃ ce ratanaṃ na icchasi,
nāriṃ nar'indehi bahūhi patthitaṃ,
diṭṭhigataṃ sīlavataṃ nu jīvitaṃ,
bhav'ūpapattiñ'ca vadesi kīdisaṃ.

SNP 47 māgaṇḍiyasuttaṃ
aṭṭhakavaggo 9
ratana 4

Meaning measure of length; cubit
Synonym hattha
Notes 2 vidatthi = 1 ratana 7 ratana = 1 yaṭṭhi
Sanskrit ratni

Example

puthulato pana diyaḍḍharatanaṃ dvīsu passesu ratanamattānucaṅkamaṃ dīghato saṭṭhihatthaṃ mudutalaṃ samavippakiṇṇavālukaṃ caṅkamaṃ vaṭṭati cetiyagirimhi dīpappasādakamahindattherassa caṅkamanaṃ viya, t'ādisaṃ taṃ ahosi.

JAa 1.N.1 sumedha kathā
ratana 5

adj. with jewels; having gems; possessing gemstones [ratana + a] ✓

Grammar adj, in comps
Meaning with jewels; having gems; possessing gemstones
Construction ratana + a
Derivative taddhita (a)
Commentary (NIDD2a) bahuratano sāgar'ūpamo'ti bahūnaṃ dhammaratanānaṃ ākarattā anekavidharatanasampanno mahāsamuddo viya bahuratano sāgarasadiso.
Sanskrit ratna

Example

puna caparaṃ, bhante, mahāsamuddo bahuratano anekaratano. tatr'imāni ratanāni, seyyath'idaṃ, muttā maṇi veḷuriyo saṅkho silā pavāḷaṃ rajataṃ jātarūpaṃ lohitako masāragallaṃ.

ratanaṃ vā pana bhikkhunā ratanasammataṃ vā ajjhārāme vā ajjhāvasathe vā uggahetvā vā uggahāpetvā vā nikkhipitabbaṃ, yassa bhavissati, so harissatī'ti, ayaṃ tattha sāmīci.

dhovā'ti āṇāpeti, āpatti dukkaṭassa. dhotāni nissaggiyāni honti. rajā'ti āṇāpeti, āpatti dukkaṭassa. rattāni nissaggiyāni honti. vijaṭehī'ti āṇāpeti, āpatti dukkaṭassa. vijaṭitāni nissaggiyāni honti.

rattapāṇi

masc. name of a dyer; lit. red-handed [ratta + pāṇi] ✓

Grammar masc, comp
Meaning name of a dyer; lit. red-handed
Construction ratta + pāṇi
Compound kammadhāraya (ratta + pāṇi)
Sanskrit rakta + pāṇi

Example

icchām'ahaṃ, samma rattapāṇi, imaṃ makkaṭacchāpakaṃ pīt'āvalepanaṃ nāma raṅgajātaṃ rajitaṃ ākoṭitapaccākoṭitaṃ ubhatobhāgavimaṭṭhan'ti.

fem. night ✓

Grammar fem, irreg
Meaning night
Synonym natta, nisā, saṃvarī
Sanskrit rātri

Examples

dīghā jāgarato ratti,
dīghaṃ santassa yojanaṃ,
dīgho bālānaṃ saṃsāro,
saddhammaṃ avijānataṃ.

DHP 60 bālavaggo

ajja kho, pan'ānanda, rattiyā pacchime yāme kusinārāyaṃ upavattane mallānaṃ sālavane antarena yamakasālānaṃ tathāgatassa parinibbānaṃ bhavissati

rattidivasasutta

nt. Aṅguttara Nikāya 6.84 (AN6.84) ✗
rattinuṭṭhānadassī

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning considering night as the time to get up
Construction rattiṃ + uṭṭhāna + dassī

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning in the habit of getting up at night
Construction rattiṃ + uṭṭhāna + sīlī
rattindiva 1

nt. day and night; lit. night and day [ratti + divā + a] ✓

Grammar nt, comp
Meaning day and night; lit. night and day
Construction ratti + [n] + divā + a
rattindivā + a
Derivative taddhita (a)
Phonetic Change +n
Compound dvanda (ratti ca diva ca)
Commentary (DNa) rattindivā'ti tato sūriyatthaṅgamanato yāva aruṇuggamanā ratti, aruṇuggamanato yāva sūriyatthaṅgamanā divā'ti evaṃ rattindivā paññāyiṃsu.
Sanskrit rātriṃdiva

Examples

taṃ kiṃ maññath'āvuso nigaṇṭhā, pahoti rājā māgadho seniyo bimbisāro, aniñjamāno kāyena, abhāsamāno vācaṃ, satta rattindivāni ek'antasukhaṃ paṭisaṃvedī viharitun'ti? no h'idaṃ, āvuso.

MN 13 mahādukkhakkhandhasuttaṃ

kathaṃbhūtassa me rattindivā vītivattantī'ti pabbajitena abhiṇhaṃ paccavekkhitabbaṃ

AN 10.48 dasadhammasuttaṃ
rattindiva 2

masc. night and day [rattiṃ + diva] ~

Grammar masc, comp
Meaning night and day
Construction rattiṃ + diva
Synonym nattamaha
Variant rattidiva
rattindivakkhaya

masc. (experiences) slow destruction by day and night [rattiṃ + diva + khaya] ✓

Grammar masc, comp
Meaning (experiences) slow destruction by day and night
Construction rattiṃ + diva + khaya
Compound tatiyā tappurisa (rattindivehi + khaya)
Commentary (SNa) rattin'divakkhayo'ti rattidivehi, rattidivesu vā khīyati.
Sanskrit rātriṃdiva + kṣaya

Examples

kiṃsu uppatho akkhāto,
kiṃsu rattin'divakkhayo,
kiṃ malaṃ brahmacariyassa,
kiṃ sinānam'anodakan'ti.

SN 1.58 uppathasuttaṃ

rāgo uppatho akkhāto,
vayo rattin'divakkhayo,
itthī malaṃ brahmacariyassa,
etth'āyaṃ sajjate pajā,
tapo ca brahmacariyañ'ca,
taṃ sinānam'anodakan'ti.

SN 1.58 uppathasuttaṃ

Meaning making effort day and night; lit. by night by day not lazy
Construction rattindivaṃ + atandita
rattindivaṃ

ind. day and night; for days and nights; lit. night and day [ratti + diva + aṃ] ✓

Grammar ind, adv, comp, in comps, acc sg of rattindiva
Meaning day and night; for days and nights; lit. night and day
Construction ratti + [n] + diva + aṃ
rattindiva + aṃ
Phonetic Change +n
Compound dvanda (rattiṃ ca divaṃ ca)
Variant rattidivaṃ
Sanskrit rātridivam

Examples

kathaṃsu tarati oghaṃ,
rattindivam'atandito,
appatiṭṭhe anālambe,
ko gambhīre na sīdatī'ti.

SN 2.15 candanasuttaṃ

namassamāno aṭṭhāsiṃ,
sattarattin'divaṃ ahaṃ,
vuṭṭhahitvā samādhimhā,
satthā loke anuttaro,
mama kammaṃ pakittento,
idaṃ vacanam'abravi.

APA 23 subhūti therāpadānaṃ
rattipariyanta

adj. with a time limit; having a time constraint; lit. night limit [ratti + pariyanta] ✓

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning with a time limit; having a time constraint; lit. night limit
Construction ratti + pariyanta
Compound kammadhāraya (ratti + pariyanta)
Antonym bhesajjapariyanta
Commentary (VIN 2.5.5.7) rattipariyantā nāma rattiyo pariggahitāyo honti, ettakāsu rattīsu pavāremī'ti.
Sanskrit rātri + paryanta

Example

tato ce uttari sādiyeyyā'ti atthi pavāraṇā bhesajjapariyantā na rattipariyantā, atthi pavāraṇā rattipariyantā na bhesajjapariyantā, atthi pavāraṇā bhesajjapariyantā ca rattipariyantā ca

VIN 2.5.5.7 mahānāmasikkhāpadaṃ

rattibhāgasamanantare

ind. later that night ✗
rattibhāgaṃ

ind. during the night; lit. night part [ratti + bhāga + aṃ] ✓

Grammar ind, adv, comp, acc sg of rattibhāga
Meaning during the night; lit. night part
Construction ratti + bhāga + aṃ
rattibhāga + aṃ
Antonym divasabhāgaṃ
Commentary (MNa) rattibhāgaṃ vā divasabhāgaṃ vā'ti rattikoṭṭhāse vā divasakoṭṭhāse vā. ettha ca rattibhāge paṭisañcikkhamānena ñatvā rattiṃ'y'eva pakkamitabbaṃ, rattiṃ caṇḍavāḷ'ādīnaṃ paribandhe sati aruṇuggamanaṃ āgametabbaṃ.
Sanskrit rātri + bhāgam

Example

tena, bhikkhave, bhikkhunā rattibhāgaṃ vā divasabhāgaṃ vā tamhā vanapatthā pakkamitabbaṃ, na vatthabbaṃ.

musā na bhāse na ca majjapo siyā,
abrahmacariyā virameyya methunā,
rattiṃ na bhuñjeyya vikālabhojanaṃ.

gām'antam'abhihāraye,
avhānaṃ n'ābhinandeyya,
abhihārañ'ca gāmato.

pabbaji dāni brāhmaṇo,
sujāto tīhi rattīhi,
tisso vijjā aphassayi.

yānaṃ nāma vayhaṃ ratho sakaṭaṃ sandamānikā sivikā pāṭaṅkī.

VIN 2.7.7 pādukavaggo
ratha 2.1

masc. pleasure; joy; delight [√ram + tha] ✓

Grammar masc, in comps, from ramati
Meaning pleasure; joy; delight
Root Family √ram
Root √ram･1 a (delight, please)
Construction √ram + tha
Derivative kita (tha)
Phonetic Change mth > th
Synonym abhinanda
Sanskrit ratha
Sanskrit Root √ram 1 (be or make content)

Example

sabbattha sukhito hutvā,
saṃsaritvā bhav'ābhave,
anāgatamhi addhāne,
lacchase taṃ manorathaṃ.

rathavinīta

nt. relay chariot; (comm) chariot yoked to a trained horse [ratha + vinīta] ✓

Grammar nt, comp
Meaning relay chariot; (comm) chariot yoked to a trained horse
Construction ratha + vinīta
Compound kammadhāraya (ratha + vinīta)
Commentary (MNa) satta rathavinītānī'ti vinīt'āssājāniyayutte satta rathe.
Sanskrit ratha + vinīta

Examples

seyyathā'pi, āvuso, rañño pasenadissa kosalassa sāvatthiyaṃ paṭivasantassa sākete kiñci'd'eva accāyikaṃ karaṇīyaṃ uppajjeyya. tassa antarā ca sāvatthiṃ antarā ca sāketaṃ satta rathavinītāni upaṭṭhapeyyuṃ.

MN 24 rathavinītasuttaṃ

atha kho, āvuso, rājā pasenadi kosalo sāvatthiyā nikkhamitvā antepuradvārā paṭhamaṃ rathavinītaṃ abhiruheyya, paṭhamena rathavinītena dutiyaṃ rathavinītaṃ pāpuṇeyya, paṭhamaṃ rathavinītaṃ vissajjeyya dutiyaṃ rathavinītaṃ abhiruheyya.

MN 24 rathavinītasuttaṃ
rathavinītasutta

nt. Majjhima Nikāya 24; Discourse on the Relay Chariots (MN24) [rathavinīta + sutta] ~

Grammar nt, comp
Meaning Majjhima Nikāya 24; Discourse on the Relay Chariots (MN24)
Construction rathavinīta + sutta
Sanskrit ratha + vinīta + sūtra
rathasata

nt. one hundred chariots [ratha + sata] ~

Grammar nt, comp
Meaning one hundred chariots
Construction ratha + sata
Commentary (ANa) pañcahi rathasatehī'ti bhuttapātarāsā pitu santikaṃ pesetvā pañca rathasatāni yojāpetvā tehi parivutā'ti attho.
rathasadda

masc. sound of chariots ✗
rathasammadda

adj. crowded with chariots; lit. trampled by chariots [ratha + sammadda] ~

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning crowded with chariots; lit. trampled by chariots
Construction ratha + sammadda
Commentary (VINa) rājantepuraṃ hatthisammaddan'tiādīsu hatthīhi sammaddo etthā'ti hatthisammaddaṃ, hatthisambādhan'ti attho. assarathasammaddapade'pi es'eva nayo.
rathasahassāni

nt. one thousand chariots [ratha + sahassa + āni] ✓

Grammar nt pl, comp
Meaning one thousand chariots
Construction ratha + sahassa + āni
rathasahassa + āni
Compound digu (ratha + sahassa)
Sanskrit ratha + sahasra

Example

tesaṃ kho pana, bhikkhu, caturāsītiyā rathasahassānaṃ eko'y'eva so ratho hoti yam'ahaṃ tena samayena abhiruhāmi, vejayanto ratho.

SN 22.96 gomayapiṇḍasuttaṃ
rathasippa

nt. coach-craft; chariotry [ratha + sippa] ✓

Grammar nt, comp
Meaning coach-craft; chariotry
Construction ratha + sippa
Compound chaṭṭhī tappurisa (rathānaṃ + sippa)
Commentary (UDa) rathasippaṃ pana rathayoggānaṃ damanasāraṇ'ādividhānavasena c'eva rathassa karaṇavasena ca veditabbaṃ.
Sanskrit ratha + śilpa

Example

ekacce evam'āhaṃsu, assasippaṃ sippānaṃ aggan'ti. ekacce evam'āhaṃsu, rathasippaṃ sippānaṃ aggan'ti. ekacce evam'āhaṃsu, dhanusippaṃ sippānaṃ aggan'ti.

UD29 sippasuttaṃ
rathasutta

nt. Saṃyutta Nikāya 1.72 (SN1.72) ✗
rathassāṇi

fem. lynchpin of a chariot [rathassa + āṇi] ✓

Grammar fem, comp
Meaning lynchpin of a chariot
Construction rathassa + āṇi
Compound alutta chaṭṭhī tappurisa (rathassa + āṇi)
Commentary (ANa) rathass'āṇī'va yāyato'ti yathā rathassa gacchato āṇi saṅgaho nāma hoti, sā rathaṃ saṅgaṇhāti, evam'ime saṅgahā lokaṃ saṅgaṇhanti.
Sanskrit ratha + āṇi

Example

dānañ'ca peyyavajjañ'ca,
atthacariyā ca yā idha,
samānattatā ca dhammesu,
tattha tattha yath'ārahaṃ,
ete kho saṅgahā loke,
rathass'āṇī'va yāyato.

AN 4.32 saṅgahasuttaṃ
rathā

masc. chariots; one of the four divisions of an army [ratha + ā] ✓

Grammar masc pl of ratha
Meaning chariots; one of the four divisions of an army
Construction ratha + ā
Sanskrit rathāḥ

Examples

senā nāma hatthī assā rathā pattī. dvādasapuriso hatthī, tipuriso asso, catupuriso ratho, cattāro purisā sarahatthā patti. dassanāya gacchati, āpatti dukkaṭassa.

VIN 2.5.5.8 uyyuttasenāsikkhāpadaṃ

bal'aggaṃ nāma ettakā hatthī, ettakā assā, ettakā rathā, ettakā pattī.

VIN 2.5.5.10 uyyodhikasikkhāpadaṃ

Example

idha, bhikkhave, rañño nāgo saṅgāmagato hatthim'pi hanati, hatth'āruham'pi hanati, assam'pi hanati, ass'āruham'pi hanati, ratham'pi hanati, rathikam'pi hanati, pattikam'pi hanati. evaṃ kho, bhikkhave, rañño nāgo hantā hoti.

AN 5.162 dutiyaāghātapaṭivinayasuttaṃ

seyyathā'pi, bhante, usabho chinnavisāṇo sūrato sudanto suvinīto rathiyāya rathiyaṃ siṅghāṭakena siṅghāṭakaṃ anvāhiṇḍanto na kiñci hiṃsati pādena vā visāṇena vā

AN 9.11 sīhanādasuttaṃ

Meaning carriage pole
Construction ratha + īsā

Sanskrit ratha + īṣā

Example

Synonym vivara

pasaṃsam'icchaṃ vinighāti hoti,
apāhatasmiṃ pana maṅku hoti,
nindāya so kuppati randham'esī.

aṭṭhakavaggo 8

SNP 46 pasūrasuttaṃ
aṭṭhakavaggo 8
randhayi

Grammar aor of randhayati, caus, trans (+acc)
Meaning afflicted; harmed; oppressed; hurt
Root Family √randh
Root √randh･1 *aya (hurt, wound)
Base √randh + aya > randhaya (caus)
Construction randhaya + i
Synonym ābādhayi, hiṃsi
Sanskrit randh
Sanskrit Root √radh √randh 2, 4 (be or make subject)

Example

evaṃ bho purisa jānāhi,
pāpadhammā asaññatā,
mā taṃ lobho adhammo ca,
ciraṃ dukkhāya randhayuṃ.

Example

attānam'abhitosayaṃ.

mahāvaggo 11

TH 262 tālapuṭattheragāthā

kāḷassa meghassa bhayena tajjitā,
palehiti ālayam'ālay'esinī,
tadā nadī ajakaraṇī rameti maṃ.

TH 196 sappakattheragāthā
ramessu

imp. (+loc) you yourself must enjoy; you yourself must take pleasure (in); lit. you yourself must cause to enjoy [√ram + *e + ssu] ✓

Grammar imp, reflx 2nd sg of rametu, caus, intrans (+loc)
Meaning you yourself must enjoy; you yourself must take pleasure (in); lit. you yourself must cause to enjoy
Root Family √ram
Root √ram･1 *e (delight, please)
Base √ram + *e > rāme > rame (caus, irreg)
Construction rame + ssu
Variant bhamassu, bhavassu, ramassu
Sanskrit ramasva
Sanskrit Root √ram 1 (be or make content)

Example

jhāya bhikkhu mā pamādo,
mā te kāmaguṇe ramessu cittaṃ,
mā lohaguḷaṃ gilī pamatto,
mā kandi dukkham'idan'ti ḍayhamāno.

rambhā

Root √ram･1 a (delight, please)

Commentary (THIa) ramman'ti ramaṇīyaṃ. taṃ kira bhūmibhāgasampattiyā chāyūdakasampattiyā ca rukkhānaṃ ropitākārena ativiya manuññaṃ manoramaṃ.

rammā vanā niyyatu rājadhāniṃ,
tuttehi so haññatu pācanehi,
bhisāni te brāhmaṇa yo ahāsi.

ravati

pr. makes a noise, cries [√ru] ✗

prp. making a noise, crying [√ru] ✗
ravi 1.1

aor. made a noise, cried [√ru] ✗
ravi 2.1

masc. sun ✗
ravita 1

nt. sound; cry; lit. sounded [√ru + a + ita] ✓

Grammar nt, pp of ravati
Meaning sound; cry; lit. sounded
Root Family √ru
Root √ru･1 a (cry, howl)
Base √ru + a > rava
Construction rava + ita
Derivative kita (ita)
Phonetic Change u > av
Sanskrit ravita (bsk)
Sanskrit Root √ru 1, 2, 6 (cry)

Example

yathā vā pana, mahārāja, brāhmaṇamāṇavakānaṃ ... bhūmikampaṃ disādāhaṃ bhumm'antalikkhaṃ jotisaṃ lok'āyatikaṃ sācakkaṃ migacakkaṃ antaracakkaṃ missak'uppādaṃ sakuṇarutaravitaṃ sikkhā karaṇīyā

MIL 4.3.7 buddhapūjanapañho
ravita 2

pp. made a noise, cried [√ru] ✗
ravitvā

abs. having a noise, having cried [√ru] ✗
ravivāra

masc. Sunday; lit. day of the Sun [ravi + vāra] ✓

Grammar masc, comp
Meaning Sunday; lit. day of the Sun
Construction ravi + vāra
Sanskrit ravidina, sūryavāra, ādityavāra, gabhastivāra, bhānuvāra, bhaṭṭārakavāra

Example

ayaṃ vasabha-saṃvacchare hemanta-utu. asmiṃ utumhi māgha-māsassa kālapakkhe catutthaṃ, ravivāram'idan'ti daṭṭhabbaṃ.

Sri Lanka buddha-vassa-sajjhāyanā

masc. kind of bird ✗
rasa 1

Grammar masc
Meaning taste; flavour

Construction √ras + a
Derivative kita (a)
Synonym rasas
Sanskrit rasa
Sanskrit Root √ras 10 (taste)

Examples

seyyathā'pi, bhikkhave, mahāsamuddo ekaraso loṇaraso, evam'eva kho, bhikkhave, ayaṃ dhammavinayo ekaraso vimuttiraso

UD 45 uposathasuttaṃ

cakkhūhi n'eva lol'assa,
gāmakathāya āvaraye sotaṃ,
rase ca n'ānugijjheyya,
na ca mamāyetha kiñci lokasmiṃ.

SNP 52 tuvaṭakasuttaṃ
aṭṭhakavaggo 14

Construction √ras + a

Examples

rasaṃ upasamassa ca,
niddaro hoti nippāpo,
dhammapītirasaṃ pivaṃ.

Example

Example

āhāre paṭikūlasaññāparicitena, bhikkhave, bhikkhuno cetasā bahulaṃ viharato rasataṇhāya cittaṃ patilīyati patikuṭati pativattati, na sampasāriyati upekkhā vā pāṭikulyatā vā saṇṭhāti.

DHP 222 kodhavaggo
rassa 1

adj. short; small ✓

Grammar adj
Meaning short; small
Antonym dīgha
Synonym appa, dahara
Sanskrit hrasva

Examples

yo'dha dīghaṃ va rassaṃ vā,
aṇuṃ thūlaṃ subh'āsubhaṃ,
loke adinnaṃ n'ādiyati,
tam'ahaṃ brūmi brāhmaṇaṃ.

DHP 409 brāhmaṇavaggo

kattha āpo ca pathavī,
tejo vāyo na gādhati,
kattha dīghañ'ca rassañ'ca,
aṇuṃ thūlaṃ subh'āsubhaṃ,
kattha nāmañ'ca rūpañ'ca,
asesaṃ uparujjhatī'ti?

DN 16.11 mahāparinibbānasuttaṃ
rassa 2

Meaning (gram) short; brief
Antonym dīgha

Examples

342, 337. saro rasso napuṃsake.

kaccāyana samāsakappa 342

abbhāse vattamānassa sarassa rasso hoti. dadhāti, jahāti.

kaccāyana ākhyātakappa 460
rassa 3

Meaning (gram) short vowel; phoneme containing only one measure

Sanskrit hrasva

Example

tattha saresu lahumattā a, i, u iti tayo rassā.

bālāvatāra sandhi kaṇḍa
rassaka

adj. short [rassa + ka] ✓

Grammar adj, from rassa
Meaning short
Construction rassa + ka
Derivative taddhita (ka)
Antonym dīgha
Sanskrit hrasvaka

Example

ye keci pāṇabhūt'atthi,
tasā vā thāvarā vā anavasesā,
dīghā vā y'eva mahantā vā,
majjhimā rassakā aṇukathūlā.

KHP 9 karaṇīya mettasuttaṃ
rassatta

nt. shortness [rassa] ✗
rassaṃ

ind. (of breathing) for a short time; shallowly [rassa + aṃ] ✓

Grammar ind, adv, acc sg of rassa
Meaning (of breathing) for a short time; shallowly
Construction rassa + aṃ
Antonym dīghaṃ
Sanskrit hrasva

Example

rassaṃ vā assasanto rassaṃ assasāmī'ti pajānāti rassaṃ vā passasanto rassaṃ passasāmī'ti pajānāti

DN 22.2 mahāsatipaṭṭhānasuttaṃ
rasso hoti

idiom. is shortened ~

Grammar idiom, masc + pr
Meaning is shortened
rahada

masc. deep pool; lake ✓

Grammar masc
Meaning deep pool; lake
Sanskrit hrada

Examples

yathā'pi rahado gambhīro,
vippasanno anāvilo,
evaṃ dhammāni sutvāna,
vippasīdanti paṇḍitā.

DHP 82 paṇḍitavaggo

yadūnakaṃ taṃ saṇati,
yaṃ pūraṃ santam'eva taṃ,
aḍḍhakumbh'ūpamo bālo,
rahado pūro'va paṇḍito.

SNP 37 nālakasuttaṃ
mahāvaggo 11
rahas 1

masc. private place; secret location [√rah + as] ✓

Grammar masc, mano group
Meaning private place; secret location
Root Family √rah
Root √rah×1 a (leave, desert)
Construction √rah + as
Derivative kita (as)
Notes raho in comps
Sanskrit rahas
Sanskrit Root √rah 1 (desert)

Example

n'atthi loke raho nāma,
pāpakammaṃ pakubbato,
attā te purisa jānāti,
saccaṃ vā yadi vā musā.

AN 3.40 ādhipateyyasuttaṃ
rahas 2

masc. privacy; seclusion; solitude [√rah + as] ✓

Grammar masc, mano group
Meaning privacy; seclusion; solitude
Root Family √rah
Root √rah×1 a (leave, desert)
Construction √rah + as
Derivative kita (as)
Synonym paṭisallāṇa, paṭisallāna, paviveka, raho, viveka, vūpakāsa
Notes raho in comps
Sanskrit rahas
Sanskrit Root √rah 1 (desert)

Example

tena kho pana samayena āyasmā soṇo rājagahe viharati sītavanasmiṃ. atha kho āyasmato soṇassa rahogatassa paṭisallīnassa evaṃ cetaso parivitakko udapādi

AN 6.55 soṇasuttaṃ
rahassa 1

adj. secretive; private; concealed; covert [√rah + as + ya] ✓

Grammar adj, from rahas
Meaning secretive; private; concealed; covert
Root Family √rah
Root √rah×1 a (leave, desert)
Construction √rah + as + ya
rahas + ya
Derivative taddhita (ya)
Phonetic Change y > s
Commentary (VINa) raho paṭicchanne okāse kattabbatāya rahassaṃ. yaṃ taṃ rahassaṃ, so methunadhammo'ti evaṃ yojanā veditabbā.
Sanskrit rahasya
Sanskrit Root √rah 1 (desert)

Example

methunadhammo nāma yo so asaddhammo gāmadhammo vasaladhammo duṭṭhullaṃ odak'antikaṃ rahassaṃ dvayaṃdvayasamāpatti, eso methunadhammo nāma.

VIN 1.1.1 paṭhamapārājikaṃ, santhatabhāṇavāro
rahassa 2

nt. secret [√rah] ✗
rahābhāva

masc. state of not being secret ✗
rahāyati

pr. is in solitude; seeks privacy [√rah + āya + ti] ~

Grammar pr, deno of rahas, intrans
Meaning is in solitude; seeks privacy
Root Family √rah
Root √rah×1 āya (leave, desert)
Base √rah + as + āya > rahāya (deno)
Construction rahāya + ti
Sanskrit rahāyate
Sanskrit Root √rah 1 (desert)
rahita 1

adj. lonely; deserted [√rah + ita] ✓

Grammar adj, from rahas
Meaning lonely; deserted
Root Family √rah
Root √rah×1 a (leave, desert)
Construction √rah + ita
Derivative kita (ita)
Commentary (THIa) rahitan'ti janarahitaṃ vijanaṃ.
Sanskrit rahita
Sanskrit Root √rah 1 (desert)

Example

vāḷamigasaṅghasevitaṃ,
kuñjaramattakareṇuloḷitaṃ,
asahāyikā gantum'icchasi,
rahitaṃ bhiṃsanakaṃ mahāvanaṃ.

THI 71 subhājīvakambavanikātherīgāthā
rahita 2

adj. (+instr) free (from); devoid (of) [√rah + ita] ~

Grammar adj, from rahas, neg (+instr)
Meaning free (from); devoid (of)
Root Family √rah
Root √rah×1 a (leave, desert)
Construction √rah + ita
Derivative kita (ita)
Synonym apeta, virahita
Sanskrit rahita
Sanskrit Root √rah 1 (desert)
raho 1

ind. privately; secretly; in seclusion; alone [√rah + as + o] ✓

Grammar ind, adv, masc nom sg of rahas, mano group
Meaning privately; secretly; in seclusion; alone
Root Family √rah
Root √rah×1 a (leave, desert)
Construction √rah + as + o
rahas + o
Antonym āvi
Synonym anuraho
Commentary (VIN 1.3.1) raho nāma cakkhussa raho, sotassa raho. (ANa) āvi c'eva raho cā'ti sammukhā ca parammukhā ca.
Notes see SCPN §2
Sanskrit rahas
Sanskrit Root √rah 1 (desert)

Examples

so eko gāmaṃ piṇḍāya pavisati eko paṭikkamati eko raho nisīdati eko caṅkamaṃ adhiṭṭhāti.

SN 21.10 theranāmakasuttaṃ

sānuṃ pabuddhaṃ vajjāsi,
yakkhānaṃ vacanaṃ idaṃ,
m'ākāsi pāpakaṃ kammaṃ,
āvi vā yadi vā raho.

SN 10.5 sānusuttaṃ
raho 2

masc. privacy; seclusion; solitude [√rah + as + o] ✓

Root √rah×1 a (leave, desert)
Construction √rah + as + o
rahas + o

Examples

rahovādaṃ na bhāseyya, sammukhā na khīṇaṃ bhaṇe. ataramāno'va bhāseyya, no taramāno.

Examples

yadā kho, āvuso, tassa purisassa evam'assa, saṃvissattho kho my'āyaṃ gahapati vā gahapatiputto vā'ti, atha naṃ rahogataṃ viditvā tiṇhena satthena jīvitā voropeyya.

SN 22.85 yamakasuttaṃ

atha kho āyasmato anuruddhassa rahogatassa paṭisallīnassa evaṃ cetaso parivitakko udapādi

adj. having rays [rasmi] ✗

fem. light, ray [rasmi] ✗

masc. sun ✗
raṃsimant 2

adj. radiant ✗
rāga 1

masc. (+loc) desire (for); passion (for); infatuation (with); lust (for); lit. attachment [√raj + *a] ✓

Grammar masc, from rajjati (+loc)
Meaning desire (for); passion (for); infatuation (with); lust (for); lit. attachment
Root Family √raj
Root √raj･3 ya (desire)
Construction √raj > rag > rāg + *a
Derivative kita (*a)
Phonetic Change a > ā
j > g
Commentary (SNa) rāgo'tiādīni lobhass'eva nāmāni. so hi rañjanavasena rāgo, nandanavasena nandī, taṇhāyanavasena taṇhā'ti vuccati.
Sanskrit rāga
Sanskrit Root √raj √rañj 1, 4 (colour)

Examples

kabaḷīkāre ce, bhikkhave, āhāre atthi rāgo atthi nandī atthi taṇhā, patiṭṭhitaṃ tattha viññāṇaṃ virūḷhaṃ. yattha patiṭṭhitaṃ viññāṇaṃ virūḷhaṃ, atthi tattha nāmarūpassa avakkanti.

SN 12.64 atthirāgasuttaṃ

aññaṃ ito y'ābhivadanti dhammaṃ,
aparaddhā suddhim'akevalī te,
evam'pi titthyā puthuso vadanti,
sandiṭṭhirāgena hi te'bhirattā.

SNP 50 cūḷabyūhasuttaṃ
aṭṭhakavaggo 12
rāga 2

masc. colour, hue, dye [√raj] ✗
rāga dosa moha

idiom. craving, aversion and delusion; lust, hatred and illusion ✓

Grammar idiom, masc + masc + masc
Meaning craving, aversion and delusion; lust, hatred and illusion
Sanskrit rāga + dveṣa + moha

Examples

tasmā't'iha, bhikkhave, abhikkhaṇaṃ sakaṃ cittaṃ paccavekkhitabbaṃ, dīgharattam'idaṃ cittaṃ saṃkiliṭṭhaṃ rāgena dosena mohenā'ti. cittasaṃkilesā, bhikkhave, sattā saṃkilissanti. cittavodānā sattā visujjhanti.

SN 22.100 dutiyagaddulabaddhasuttaṃ

rāgo kho, āvuso, appasāvajjo dandhavirāgī, doso mahāsāvajjo khippavirāgī, moho mahāsāvajjo dandhavirāgī'ti.

AN 3.69 aññatitthiyasuttaṃ
rāgakkhaya

masc. wearing away of desire; extinction of desire [rāga + khaya] ✓

Grammar masc, comp
Meaning wearing away of desire; extinction of desire
Construction rāga + khaya
Compound chaṭṭhī tappurisa (rāgassa + khaya)
Commentary (ITIa) yo rāgakkhayo'ti rāgassa khayo khīṇ'ākāro abhāvo accantam'anuppādo.
Sanskrit rāga + kṣaya

Examples

tassa tiṭṭhant'eva pañc'indriyāni yesaṃ avighātattā manāp'āmanāpaṃ paccanubhoti, sukhadukkhaṃ paṭisaṃvedeti. tassa yo rāgakkhayo, dosakkhayo, mohakkhayo, ayaṃ vuccati, bhikkhave, saupādisesā nibbānadhātu.

ITI 44 nibbānadhātusuttaṃ

katamā ca, bhikkhave, pariññā? rāgakkhayo, dosakkhayo, mohakkhayo, ayaṃ vuccati, bhikkhave, pariññā

SN 22.106 pariññeyyasuttaṃ
rāgaggi

masc. fire of lust; fire of desire; fire of craving [rāga + aggi] ✓

Grammar masc, comp
Meaning fire of lust; fire of desire; fire of craving
Construction rāga + aggi
Compound chaṭṭhī tappurisa (rāgassa + aggi)
Sanskrit rāga + agni

Example

kena ādittaṃ? rāg'agginā, dos'agginā, moh'agginā ādittaṃ, jātiyā jarāya maraṇena sokehi paridevehi dukkhehi domanassehi upāyāsehi ādittan'ti vadāmi.

SN 35.28 ādittasuttaṃ
rāgacarita

adj. of lustful behaviour ✗
rāgaja

adj. born from desire; produced by lust [rāga + ja] ✓

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning born from desire; produced by lust
Construction rāga + ja
Compound pañcamī tappurisa (rāgamhā + ja)
Sanskrit rāga + ja

Examples

api nu tassa gahapatissa vā gahapatiputtassa vā uppajjeyyuṃ rāgajā pariḷāhā kāyikā vā cetasikā vā yehi so rāgajehi pariḷāhehi pariḍayhamāno dukkhaṃ sayeyyā'ti? evaṃ, bhante'ti.

AN 3.35 hatthakasuttaṃ

idha, bhikkhave, ekacco pakatiyā tibbarāgajātiko hoti, so abhikkhaṇaṃ rāgajaṃ dukkhaṃ domanassaṃ paṭisaṃvedeti

masc. desire and hatred; craving and aversion; lust and hate [rāga + dosa] ✓

Grammar masc, comp
Meaning desire and hatred; craving and aversion; lust and hate
Construction rāga + dosa

Sanskrit rāga + dveṣa

Example

evaṃ mano chassu yadā subhāvito,
phuṭṭhassa cittaṃ na vikampate kvaci,
te rāgadose abhibhuyya bhikkhavo,
bhavattha jātimaraṇassa pāragā'ti.

SN 35.94 adantāguttasuttaṃ
rāgadosa 2

adj. ruined by desire; spoiled by passion; corrupted by lust [rāga + dosa] ✓

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning ruined by desire; spoiled by passion; corrupted by lust
Construction rāga + dosa
Compound kammadhāraya (rāga eva dosa)
Sanskrit rāga + doṣa

Example

tiṇadosāni khettāni,
rāgadosā ayaṃ pajā,
tasmā hi vītarāgesu,
dinnaṃ hoti mahapphalaṃ.

DHP 356 taṇhāvaggo
rāgadosaparikkiṭṭha

adj. dragged around by desire and hatred; afflicted by craving and aversion [rāgadosa + parikkiṭṭha] ~

Meaning dragged around by desire and hatred; afflicted by craving and aversion
Construction rāgadosa + parikkiṭṭha

adj. who has eradicated lust and hatred; who has destroyed desire and ill-will [rāga + dosa + parikkhīṇa] ✓

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning who has eradicated lust and hatred; who has destroyed desire and ill-will
Construction rāga + dosa + parikkhīṇa
Compound dutiyā tappurisa (rāgadosaṃ + parikkhīṇa)
Sanskrit rāga + dveṣa + parikṣīṇa

Example

avihaṃ upapannāse,
vimuttā satta bhikkhavo,
rāgadosaparikkhīṇā,
tiṇṇā loke visattikan'ti.

SN 1.50 ghaṭīkārasuttaṃ
rāgadosapareta

adj. afflicted with desire and hatred; overwhelmed by craving and aversion [rāgadosa + pareta] ✓

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning afflicted with desire and hatred; overwhelmed by craving and aversion
Construction rāgadosa + pareta
Compound tatiyā tappurisa (rāgadosena + pareta)
Commentary (MNa) rāgadosaparetehī'ti rāgadosapariphuṭṭhehi rāgados'ānugatehi vā.
Sanskrit rāga + dveṣa + parīta

Example

kicchena me adhigataṃ,
h'alaṃ dāni pakāsituṃ,
rāgadosaparetehi,
n'āyaṃ dhammo susambudho.

MN 26 pāsarāsisuttaṃ
rāgadosamoha

masc. passion, hatred and delusion; craving, aversion and confusion [rāga + dosa + moha] ✓

Grammar masc, comp
Meaning passion, hatred and delusion; craving, aversion and confusion
Construction rāga + dosa + moha
Compound dvanda (rāga ca dosa ca moha ca)
Sanskrit rāga + dveṣa + moha

Examples

tasmā evaṃ samannāgato bhikkhu iminā paramena upasam'ādhiṭṭhānena samannāgato hoti. eso hi, bhikkhu, paramo ariyo upasamo yadidaṃ, rāgadosamohānaṃ upasamo.

MN 140 dhātuvibhaṅgasuttaṃ

santi, bhikkhave, bhikkhū imasmiṃ bhikkhusaṅghe tiṇṇaṃ saṃyojanānaṃ parikkhayā rāgadosamohānaṃ tanuttā sakadāgāmino saki'd'eva imaṃ lokaṃ āgantvā dukkhass'antaṃ karissanti, evarūpā'pi, bhikkhave, santi bhikkhū imasmiṃ bhikkhusaṅghe.

rāgadosamohakkhaya

DHP 339 taṇhāvaggo

Meaning dependent on desire

rāgapatha

masc. (+loc) path of passion (in); way of lust (in); sensuality (in) [rāga + patha] ✓

Grammar masc, comp (+loc)
Meaning path of passion (in); way of lust (in); sensuality (in)
Construction rāga + patha
Compound chaṭṭhī tappurisa (rāgassa + patha)
Sanskrit rāga + patha

Example

disvāna rūpāni manoramāni,
atho'pi disvāna amanoramāni,
manorame rāgapathaṃ vinodaye,
na c'āppiyaṃ me'ti manaṃ padosaye.

SN 35.94 adantāguttasuttaṃ
rāgapariyuṭṭhita

adj. obsessed by lust; consumed by desire [rāga + pariyuṭṭhita] ✓

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning obsessed by lust; consumed by desire
Construction rāga + pariyuṭṭhita
Compound tatiyā tappurisa (rāgena + pariyuṭṭhita)
Commentary (ANa) n'ev'assa rāgapariyuṭṭhitan'ti na uppajjamānena rāgena uṭṭhahitvā gahitaṃ.
Sanskrit rāga + paryavasthita

Example

yasmiṃ, mahānāma, samaye ariyasāvako tathāgataṃ anussarati n'ev'assa tasmiṃ samaye rāgapariyuṭṭhitaṃ cittaṃ hoti, na dosapariyuṭṭhitaṃ cittaṃ hoti, na mohapariyuṭṭhitaṃ cittaṃ hoti, ujugatam'ev'assa tasmiṃ samaye cittaṃ hoti tathāgataṃ ārabbha.

AN 6.10 mahānāmasuttaṃ
rāgapareta

adj. afflicted with lust; overcome by passion [rāga + pareta] ~

Meaning afflicted with lust; overcome by passion
Construction rāga + pareta

Commentary (ANa) rāgapariyuṭṭhito'mhi, āvuso, rāgapareto'ti ahaṃ, āvuso, rāgena ratto, rāgena anugato.
rāgapāsa

masc. snare of sensual desire; trap of lust [rāga + pāsa] ~

Grammar masc, comp
Meaning snare of sensual desire; trap of lust
Construction rāga + pāsa
rāgapeyyāla 1

nt. Chapter 19 of Dukanipāta, Aṅguttara Nikāya 2.231-246 ✗

rāgapeyyāla 4

rāgapeyyāla 5

rāgapeyyāla 6

rāgapeyyāla 7

nt. Chapter 11 of Aṭṭhakanipāta, Aṅguttara Nikāya 8.117-626 ✗
rāgapeyyāla 8

nt. Chapter 10 of Navakanipāta, Aṅguttara Nikāya 9.93-432 ✗
rāgapeyyāla 9

nt. Chapter 23 of Dasakanipāta, Aṅguttara Nikāya 10.237-746 ✗
rāgappahāna

nt. abandoning lust; giving up desire [rāga + pahāna] ~

Grammar nt, comp
Meaning abandoning lust; giving up desire
Construction rāga + pahāna
rāgabandhanabaddha

adj. imprisoned by desire; held captive by lust; lit. bound with the bond of desire [rāga + bandhanabaddha] ~

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning imprisoned by desire; held captive by lust; lit. bound with the bond of desire
Construction rāga + bandhanabaddha
rāgarajas

masc. dirt of lust [rāga + rajas] ~

Grammar masc, comp, mano group
Meaning dirt of lust
Construction rāga + rajas
rāgaratta

adj. filled with passion; infatuated with lust [rāga + ratta] ✓

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning filled with passion; infatuated with lust
Construction rāga + ratta
Compound tatiyā tappurisa (rāgena + ratta)
Antonym virāgaratta
Sanskrit rāga + rakta

Examples

ye rāgaratt'ānupatanti sotaṃ,
sayaṃkataṃ makkaṭako'va jālaṃ,
etam'pi chetvāna vajanti dhīrā,
anapekkhino sabbadukkhaṃ pahāya.

DHP 347 taṇhāvaggo

āsīsanti thomayanti abhijappanti juhanti,
kām'ābhijappanti paṭicca lābhaṃ,
te yājayogā bhavarāgarattā,
n'ātariṃsu jātijaran'ti brūmi.

SNP 58 puṇṇaka māṇava pucchā
pārāyanavaggo 3
rāgarāgī

adj. who is infatuated by infatuation; who desires desire; who is attached to attachment [rāga + rāgī] ✓

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning who is infatuated by infatuation; who desires desire; who is attached to attachment
Construction rāga + rāgī
Compound tatiyā tappurisa (rāgena + rāgī)
Sanskrit rāga + rāgin

Example

sīm'ātigo brāhmaṇo tassa n'atthi,
ñatvā va disvā va samuggahītaṃ,
na rāgarāgī na virāgaratto,
tass'īdha n'atthī param'uggahītan'ti.

SNP 42 suddhaṭṭhakasuttaṃ
aṭṭhakavaggo 4
rāgavasena

ind. due to desire; because of lust [rāga + vasena] ~

Grammar ind, adv, comp
Meaning due to desire; because of lust
Construction rāga + vasena
Sanskrit rāga + vaśena
rāgavinaya

masc. removal of lust; dispelling of desire [rāga + vinaya] ~

Grammar masc, comp
Meaning removal of lust; dispelling of desire
Construction rāga + vinaya
rāgavinayapariyosāna

adj. removing and ending desire [rāga + vinaya + pariyosāna] ~

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning removing and ending desire
Construction rāga + vinaya + pariyosāna
Commentary (SNa) idāni'ssa niddosabhāvañ'c'eva saṅgāma-vijaya-bhāvañ'ca dassento rāgavinayapariyosānā'ti-ādim'āha. tattha rāgaṃ vinayamānā pariyosāpeti pariyosānaṃ gacchati nipphajjatī'ti rāgavinayapariyosānā. esa nayo sabbattha.
rāgavinayasutta

nt. Aṅguttara Nikāya 4.96 (AN4.96) ✗
rāgavinibandha

adj. (+loc) bound by lust (for); shackled by desire (for) [rāga + vinibandha] ✓

Grammar adj, comp (+loc)
Meaning bound by lust (for); shackled by desire (for)
Construction rāga + vinibandha
Compound tatiyā tappurisa (rāgena + vinibandha)
Commentary (SNa) rūpadhāturāgavinibaddhan'ti rūpadhātumhi rāgena vinibaddhaṃ
Sanskrit rāga + vinibandha

Example

rūpadhātu kho, gahapati, viññāṇassa oko. rūpadhāturāgavinibandhañ'ca pana viññāṇaṃ, okasārī'ti vuccati.

SN 22.3 hāliddikānisuttaṃ
rāgavirāga

masc. fading of desire; disappearance of lust [rāga + virāga] ✓

Grammar masc, comp
Meaning fading of desire; disappearance of lust
Construction rāga + virāga
Compound chaṭṭhī tappurisa (rāgassa + virāga)
Commentary (ANa) rāgavirāgā cetovimuttī'ti rāgassa khayavirāgena cetovimutti nāma hoti. phalasamādhiss'etaṃ nāmaṃ.
Sanskrit rāga + virāga

Example

rāg'upakkiliṭṭhaṃ vā, bhikkhave, cittaṃ na vimuccati, avijj'upakkiliṭṭhā vā paññā bhāvīyati. iti kho, bhikkhave, rāgavirāgā cetovimutti, avijjāvirāgā paññāvimuttī'ti.

AN 2.33 bālavaggo
rāgavirāgattha

adj. for the fading of desire; for the disappearance of lust; for the sake of dispassion [rāga + virāga + attha] ~

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning for the fading of desire; for the disappearance of lust; for the sake of dispassion
Construction rāga + virāga + attha
rāgavirāgasutta

nt. Saṃyutta Nikāya 45.41 (SN45.41) ✗
rāgavirāgī

adj. with and without lust; who is attached and unattached [rāga + virāgī] ✓

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning with and without lust; who is attached and unattached
Construction rāga + virāgī
Compound dvanda (rāga ca virāgī ca)
Sanskrit rāga + virāgin

Example

paroparañ'ca jānāsi,
atho rāgavirāginaṃ,
itthabhāv'aññathābhāvaṃ,
sattānaṃ āgatiṃ gatin'ti.

MN 49 brahmanimantanikasuttaṃ
rāgavepullatta

nt. abundance of desire; massive amount of passion [rāga + vepullatta] ~

Grammar nt, abstr, comp
Meaning abundance of desire; massive amount of passion
Construction rāga + vepullatta
rāgasama

adj. like desire; like passion; equal to lust [rāga + sama] ✓

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning like desire; like passion; equal to lust
Construction rāga + sama
Compound tatiyā tappurisa (rāgena + sama)
Sanskrit rāga + sama

Examples

n'atthi rāgasamo aggi,
n'atthi dosasamo kali,
n'atthi khandhasamā dukkhā,
n'atthi santiparaṃ sukhaṃ.

DHP 202 sukhavaggo

n'atthi rāgasamo aggi,
n'atthi dosasamo gaho,
n'atthi mohasamaṃ jālaṃ,
n'atthi taṇhāsamā nadī.

DHP 251 malavaggo
rāgasutta

nt. Aṅguttara Nikāya 6.107 (AN6.107) ✗
rāgādiviraha

masc. absence of lust etc.; non existence of passion, hatred and delusion [rāga + ādi + viraha] ✓

Grammar masc, comp
Meaning absence of lust etc.; non existence of passion, hatred and delusion
Construction rāga + ādi + viraha

Example

evaṃ rāg'ādivirahena cakkhuviññāṇamattam'eva me javanaṃ bhavissati, cakkhuviññāṇ'appamāṇen'eva javanaṃ ṭhapessāmī'ti.

UDa 1.10 bāhiyasuttaṃ vaṇṇanā
rāgādhikaraṇaṃ

ind. because of desire; due to lust [rāga + adhikaraṇa + aṃ] ~

Grammar ind, adv, comp
Meaning because of desire; due to lust
Construction rāga + adhikaraṇa + aṃ
rāgādhikaraṇa + aṃ
Commentary (THa) rāg'ādhikaraṇan'ti rāgahetu.
rāgānuddhaṃsa

adj. invaded by lust; filled with desire; overtaken by passion [rāga + anuddhaṃsa] ✓

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning invaded by lust; filled with desire; overtaken by passion
Construction rāga + anuddhaṃsa
Compound tatiyā tappurisa (rāgena + anuddhaṃsa)
Sanskrit rāga + anudhvaṃs

Example

so rāg'ānuddhaṃsena cittena maraṇaṃ vā nigacchati maraṇamattaṃ vā dukkhaṃ. maraṇañ'h'etaṃ, bhikkhave, ariyassa vinaye yo sikkhaṃ paccakkhāya hīnāy'āvattati.

SN 20.10 biḷārasuttaṃ
rāgānuddhaṃsita

adj. invaded by lust; overwhelmed with passion [rāga + anuddhaṃsita] ✓

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning invaded by lust; overwhelmed with passion
Construction rāga + anuddhaṃsita
Compound tatiyā tappurisa (rāgena + anuddhaṃsita)
Sanskrit rāga + anudhvaṃsita

Examples

so tattha passati mātugāmaṃ dunnivatthaṃ vā duppārutaṃ vā. tassa mātugāmaṃ disvā dunnivatthaṃ vā duppārutaṃ vā rāgo cittaṃ anuddhaṃseti. so rāg'ānuddhaṃsitena cittena sikkhaṃ paccakkhāya hīnāy'āvattati.

AN 4.122 ūmibhayasuttaṃ

so rāg'ānuddhaṃsitena cittena maraṇaṃ vā nigaccheyya maraṇamattaṃ vā dukkhaṃ.

MN 105 sunakkhattasuttaṃ
rāgānusaya 1

masc. underlying tendency towards desire; lit. desire sleeping alongside [rāga + anusaya] ✓

Grammar masc, comp
Meaning underlying tendency towards desire; lit. desire sleeping alongside
Construction rāga + anusaya
Compound catutthī tappurisa (rāgassa + anusaya)
Sanskrit rāga + anuśaya

Examples

so sabbaso rāg'ānusayaṃ pahāya paṭigh'ānusayaṃ paṭivinodetvā asmī'ti diṭṭhimān'ānusayaṃ samūhanitvā avijjaṃ pahāya vijjaṃ uppādetvā diṭṭh'eva dhamme dukkhass'antakaro hoti

MN 9 sammādiṭṭhisuttaṃ

sukhāya, bhikkhave, vedanāya rāg'ānusayo pahātabbo, dukkhāya vedanāya paṭigh'ānusayo pahātabbo, adukkham'asukhāya vedanāya avijj'ānusayo pahātabbo.

SN 36.3 pahānasuttaṃ
rāgānusaya 2

adj. with the underlying tendency towards desire; lit. desire sleeping alongside [rāga + anusaya] ~

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning with the underlying tendency towards desire; lit. desire sleeping alongside
Construction rāga + anusaya
Compound catutthī tappurisa (rāgassa + anusaya)
Sanskrit rāga + anuśaya
rāgiñjita

nt. agitation of lust ✗
rāgī

adj. who desires; who is passionate about; who is infatuated [√raj + *ī] ✓

Grammar adj, from rajjati
Meaning who desires; who is passionate about; who is infatuated
Root Family √raj
Root √raj･3 ya (desire)
Construction √raj > rag > rāg + *ī
Derivative kita (*ī)
Phonetic Change a > ā
j > g
Sanskrit rāgin
Sanskrit Root √raj √rañj 1, 4 (colour)

Example

sīm'ātigo brāhmaṇo tassa n'atthi,
ñatvā va disvā va samuggahītaṃ,
na rāgarāgī na virāgaratto,
tass'īdha n'atthī param'uggahītan'ti.

SNP 42 suddhaṭṭhakasuttaṃ
aṭṭhakavaggo 4
rāgupakkiliṭṭha

adj. defiled by lust; contaminated with desire [rāga + upakkiliṭṭha] ✓

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning defiled by lust; contaminated with desire
Construction rāga + upakkiliṭṭha
Compound tatiyā tappurisa (rāgena + upakkiliṭṭha)
Commentary (ANa) rāg'upakkiliṭṭhaṃ ... rāgena upakkiliṭṭhattā
Sanskrit rāga + upa + kliṣṭa

Example

rāg'upakkiliṭṭhaṃ vā, bhikkhave, cittaṃ na vimuccati, avijj'upakkiliṭṭhā vā paññā bhāvīyati. iti kho, bhikkhave, rāgavirāgā cetovimutti, avijjāvirāgā paññāvimuttī'ti.

AN 2.33 bālavaggo
rāgūpatthambha

masc. erection due to lust [rāga + upatthambha] ~

Grammar masc, comp
Meaning erection due to lust
Construction rāga + upatthambha
Commentary (VINa) rāg'ūpatthambhe'ti rāgassa balavabhāve, rāgena vā aṅgajātassa upatthambhe, thaddhabhāve sañjāte'ti vuttaṃ hoti.
rāgūpasaṃhita

adj. connected with lust; to do with desire; provocative of passion [rāga + upasaṃhita] ~

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning connected with lust; to do with desire; provocative of passion
Construction rāga + upasaṃhita
Commentary (SNa) subhaṃ rāg'ūpasaṃhitan'ti rāgavaḍḍhan'ārammaṇaṃ subhaṃ parivajjento asubhasaññāya parivajjeyya, sabbattha anabhiratisaññāya.
rāja 1

masc. king; ruler [√rāj + a] ✓

Grammar masc, atta group
Meaning king; ruler
Root Family √rāj
Root √rāj･1 a (rule, shine)
Construction √rāj + a
Derivative kita (a)
Synonym inda
Commentary (VIN 1.4.1.10) rājā nāma yo koci rajjaṃ kāreti.
Sanskrit rājan
Sanskrit Root √rāj 1 (be kingly)

Examples

bhikkhuṃ pan'eva uddissa rājā vā rājabhoggo vā brāhmaṇo vā gahapatiko vā dūtena cīvaracetāpannaṃ pahiṇeyya, iminā cīvaracetāpannena cīvaraṃ cetāpetvā itthan'nāmaṃ bhikkhuṃ cīvarena acchādehī'ti.

VIN PAT NP 10 rājasikkhāpadaṃ

khat'āyaṃ, bhikkhave, rājā. upahat'āyaṃ, bhikkhave, rājā. sac'āyaṃ, bhikkhave, rājā pitaraṃ dhammikaṃ dhammarājānaṃ jīvitā na voropessatha, imasmiññ'eva āsane virajaṃ vītamalaṃ dhammacakkhuṃ uppajjissathā'ti.

DN 2.32 sāmaññaphalasuttaṃ
rāja 2

adj. royal [√rāj + a + a] ✓

Grammar adj, in comps, from rājā
Meaning royal
Root Family √rāj
Root √rāj･1 a (rule, shine)
Construction √rāj + a + a
rāja + a
Derivative taddhita (a)
Sanskrit rāja
Sanskrit Root √rāj 1 (be kingly)

Example

sūro yathā rājakhādāya puṭṭho,
abhigajjam'eti paṭisūram'icchaṃ,
yen'eva so tena palehi sūra,
pubb'eva n'atthi yadidaṃ yudhāya.

SNP 46 pasūrasuttaṃ
aṭṭhakavaggo 8

rājakakudhabhaṇḍa

nt. ensign of royalty, regalia ✗
rājakaññā

fem. princess ✗
