Meaning royal appointer; king-maker
Construction rāja + kattar
rājakathā

fem. talk about kings; discussion of rulers [rāja + kathā] ✓

Grammar fem, comp
Meaning talk about kings; discussion of rulers
Construction rāja + kathā
Compound chaṭṭhī tappurisa (rājānaṃ + kathā)
Commentary (ANa) tattha rājānaṃ ārabbha, mahāsammato mandhātā dhammāsoko evaṃmah'ānubhāvo'tiādinā nayena pavattakathā rājakathā.
Sanskrit rāja + kathā

Example

rājakathaṃ corakathaṃ mahāmattakathaṃ senākathaṃ bhayakathaṃ yuddhakathaṃ annakathaṃ pānakathaṃ vatthakathaṃ sayanakathaṃ mālākathaṃ gandhakathaṃ ñātikathaṃ yānakathaṃ gāmakathaṃ

rājakārāmavagga

masc. Chapter 2 of the Sotāpattisaṃyuttaṃ, Book 5 of the Saṃyutta Nikāya ✗
rājakumāra

masc. prince; king's son [rāja + kumāra] ✓

Grammar masc, comp
Meaning prince; king's son
Construction rāja + kumāra
Compound chaṭṭhī tappurisa (rañño + kumāra)
Synonym khattiya
Sanskrit rājakumāra

Examples

evaṃ me sutaṃ, ekaṃ samayaṃ bhagavā rājagahe viharati veḷuvane kalandakanivāpe. atha kho abhayo rājakumāro yena nigaṇṭho nāṭaputto ten'upasaṅkami, upasaṅkamitvā nigaṇṭhaṃ nāṭaputtaṃ abhivādetvā ekam'antaṃ nisīdi.

MN 58 abhayarājakumārasuttaṃ

satthari hi paṭhamagamanena kapilapuraṃ gantvā kaniṭṭhabhātikaṃ nandarājakumāraṃ pabbājetvā kapilapurā nikkhamma anupubbena sāvatthiṃ gantvā viharante āyasmā nando anabhirato ahosi

JAa 182 saṅgāmāvacara jātakavaṇṇanā

rājakula 1

nt. royal family [rāja + kula] ✓

Grammar nt, comp
Meaning royal family
Construction rāja + kula
Compound chaṭṭhī tappurisa (rañño + kula)
Sanskrit rājakula

Example

na hi nūna so, bhikkhave, bhikkhu cattāri ahirājakulāni mettena cittena phari. sace hi so, bhikkhave, bhikkhu cattāri ahirājakulāni mettena cittena phareyya, na hi so, bhikkhave, bhikkhu ahinā daṭṭho kālaṅ'kareyya.

AN 4.67 ahirājasuttaṃ
rājakula 2

nt. royal court; lit. royal family [rāja + kula] ✓

Grammar nt, comp
Meaning royal court; lit. royal family
Construction rāja + kula
Compound chaṭṭhī tappurisa (rañño + kula)
Sanskrit rājakula

Examples

saṃvijjati kho, bho raṭṭhapāla, imasmiṃ rājakule pahūtaṃ hiraññasuvaṇṇaṃ bhūmigatañ'ca vehāsagatañ'ca.

MN 82 raṭṭhapālasuttaṃ

idha, bhikkhave, ekacco puggalo sabhaggato vā parisaggato vā ñātimajjhagato vā pūgamajjhagato vā rājakulamajjhagato vā abhinīto sakkhipuṭṭho

AN 3.28 gūthabhāṇīsuttaṃ
rājakulamajjhagata

adj. amidst the royal court; among royalty [rāja + kula + majjha + gata] ✓

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning amidst the royal court; among royalty
Construction rāja + kula + majjha + gata
Compound missaka > bahubbīhi (rājakulassa + majjhagata)
Commentary (ANa) rājakulamajjhagato'ti rājakulassa majjhe mahāvinicchaye ṭhito.
Sanskrit rājakula + madhyagata

Example

idha, bhikkhave, ekacco puggalo sabhaggato vā parisaggato vā ñātimajjhagato vā pūgamajjhagato vā rājakulamajjhagato vā abhinīto sakkhipuṭṭho

AN 3.28 gūthabhāṇīsuttaṃ
rājakosa

masc. royal treasury; royal storehouse [rāja + kosa] ✓

Grammar masc, comp
Meaning royal treasury; royal storehouse
Construction rāja + kosa
Compound kammadhāraya (rāja + kosa)
Sanskrit rāja + kośa

Example

kodhanassa, bhikkhave, purisapuggalassa kodh'ābhibhūtassa kodhaparetassa, ye'pi'ssa te honti bhogā uṭṭhānavīriy'ādhigatā bāhābalaparicitā sed'āvakkhittā dhammikā dhammaladdhā, te'pi rājāno rājakosaṃ pavesenti kodh'ābhibhūtassa.

AN 7.64 kodhanasuttaṃ
rājakhādā

fem. royal food; royal cuisine; king's food [rāja + khādā] ✓

Grammar fem, comp
Meaning royal food; royal cuisine; king's food
Construction rāja + khādā
Compound kammadhāraya (rāja + khādā)
Sanskrit rāja + khāda

Example

sūro yathā rājakhādāya puṭṭho,
abhigajjam'eti paṭisūram'icchaṃ,
yen'eva so tena palehi sūra,
pubb'eva n'atthi yadidaṃ yudhāya.

SNP 46 pasūrasuttaṃ
aṭṭhakavaggo 8
rājagaha

masc. name of a city; capital of Magadha; lit. king’s house [rāja + gaha] ✓

Grammar masc, comp
Meaning name of a city; capital of Magadha; lit. king’s house
Construction rāja + gaha
Compound chaṭṭhī tappurisa (rañño + gaha)
Commentary (MNa) rājagahe'ti evaṃnāmake nagare, tañ'hi mandhātumahāgovind'ādīhi pariggahitattā rājagahan'ti vuccati.
Sanskrit rājagṛha

Examples

taṃ kiṃ maññasi, brāhmaṇa, idha puriso āgaccheyya rājagahaṃ gantu'kāmo. so taṃ upasaṅkamitvā evaṃ vadeyya, icchām'ahaṃ, bhante, rājagahaṃ gantuṃ, tassa me rājagahassa maggaṃ upadisā'ti.

MN 107 gaṇakamoggallānasuttaṃ

tena kho pana samayena āyasmā soṇo rājagahe viharati sītavanasmiṃ. atha kho āyasmato soṇassa rahogatassa paṭisallīnassa evaṃ cetaso parivitakko udapādi

AN 6.55 soṇasuttaṃ
rājagahaka

adj. of Rājagaha [rāja + gaha + ka] ✓

Grammar adj, comp, from rājagaha
Meaning of Rājagaha
Construction rāja + gaha + ka
rājagaha + ka
Derivative taddhita (ka)
Commentary (VBt) rājagahako'ti rājagahavāsī.
Sanskrit rājagṛhaka

Example

tena kho pana samayena rājagahakassa seṭṭhissa sattavassiko sīs'ābādho hoti. bahū mahantā mahantā disāpāmokkhā vejjā āgantvā n'āsakkhiṃsu arogaṃ kātuṃ.

VIN 4.8.205 rājagahaseṭṭhi vatthu
rājagahagāmī

adj. going to Rājagaha; headed to Rājagaha [rājagaha + gāmī] ✓

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning going to Rājagaha; headed to Rājagaha
Construction rājagaha + gāmī
Compound dutiyā tappurisa (rājagahaṃ + gāmī)
Sanskrit rājagṛha + gāmin

Example

tena hi, brāhmaṇa, taṃ'y'ev'ettha paṭipucchissāmi. yathā te khameyya tathā naṃ byākareyyāsi. taṃ kiṃ maññasi, brāhmaṇa, kusalo tvaṃ rājagahagāmissa maggassā'ti?

DHPa 1.2.1 sāmāvatīvatthu
rājacorādivasena

rājañña

masc. man of the ruling class; young noble [√rāj + an + ya] ✓

Grammar masc, from rāja
Meaning man of the ruling class; young noble
Root Family √rāj
Root √rāj･1 a (rule, shine)
Construction √rāj + an + ya
rājan + ya
Derivative taddhita (ya)
Phonetic Change ny > ññ
Sanskrit rājanya
Sanskrit Root √rāj 1 (be kingly)

Example

atha kho pāyāsi rājañño uttaraṃ māṇavaṃ āmantāpetvā etadavoca, saccaṃ kira tvaṃ, tāta uttara, dānaṃ datvā evaṃ anuddisasi, imin'āhaṃ dānena pāyāsiṃ rājaññam'eva imasmiṃ loke samāgacchiṃ, mā parasmin'ti

rājati

pr. shines [√rāj] ✗
rājato

masc. from the king; from the government [√rāj + a + to] ✓

Grammar masc, abl sg of rāja, atta group
Meaning from the king; from the government
Root Family √rāj
Root √rāj･1 a (rule, shine)
Construction √rāj + a + to
rāja + to
Sanskrit rājñe

Example

rājato vā upasaggaṃ,
abbhakkhānañ'ca dāruṇaṃ,

bhogānañ'ca pabhaṅguraṃ.

DHP 139 daṇḍavaggo
rājatta

nt. kingship [√rāj] ✗
rājadaṇḍa

masc. royal punishment; royal retribution [rāja + daṇḍa] ✓

Grammar masc, comp
Meaning royal punishment; royal retribution
Construction rāja + daṇḍa
Compound kammadhāraya (rāja + daṇḍa)
Commentary (SNa) rājadaṇḍenā'ti rañño uddhaṭadaṇḍena, so appako nāma na hoti, dasasahassa-vīsatisahassappamāṇo hoti'y'eva.
Sanskrit rājadaṇḍa

Example

ṭhānañ'hi so manuj'indo,
rajjaṃ laddhāna khattiyo,
so kuddho rājadaṇḍena,
tasmiṃ pakkamate bhusaṃ,
tasmā taṃ parivajjeyya,
rakkhaṃ jīvitam'attano.

SN 3.1 daharasuttaṃ
rājadattattheragāthā

tvaññ'eva no citta karosi brāhmaṇo,
tvaṃ khattiyo rājadasī karosi,
vessā ca suddā ca bhavāma ekadā,
devattanaṃ v'āpi tav'eva vāhasā.

so bajjhataṃ pāsasatehi chabbhi,
rammā vanā niyyatu rājadhāniṃ,
tuttehi so haññatu pācanehi,
bhisāni te brāhmaṇa yo ahāsi.

MIL 2.3.10 milindapañho, saññālakkhaṇapañho
rājabhogga 1

Grammar adj, comp

Compound tatiyā tappurisa (rājena + bhogga)
Commentary (MNa) rājabhoggo'ti rañño upabhogo.
Sanskrit rājabhogya (nutmeg)

Examples

aṭṭhahi, bhikkhave, aṅgehi samannāgato rañño bhaddo ass'ājānīyo rāj'āraho hoti rājabhoggo, rañño aṅgan't'eva saṅkhaṃ gacchati. katamehi aṭṭhahi?

AN 8.13 assājānīyasuttaṃ

catūhi, bhikkhave, aṅgehi samannāgato yodh'ājīvo rāj'āraho hoti rājabhoggo, rañño aṅgan't'eva saṅkhaṃ gacchati. katamehi catūhi?

AN 4.181 yodhājīvasuttaṃ

Compound chaṭṭhī tappurisa (rañño + bhogga)
Commentary (VIN 1.4.1.10) rājabhoggo nāma yo koci rañño bhattavetan'āhāro. (VINa) rājabhoggo'ti rājato bhoggaṃ bhuñjitabbaṃ ass'atthī'ti rājabhoggo
Sanskrit rājabhogya (nutmeg)

Examples

gahapatiko nāma ṭhapetvā rājaṃ rājabhoggaṃ brāhmaṇaṃ avaseso gahapatiko nāma.

Examples

DN 2.32 sāmaññaphalasuttaṃ

kathañ'ca, bhikkhave, mahācoro balavanissito hoti? idha, bhikkhave, mahācoro rājānaṃ vā rājamahāmattānaṃ vā nissito hoti.

DHPa 1.5.1 aññatarapurisa vatthu
rājāno

masc. authorities; officers; lit. king's men [√rāj + a + āno] ✓

Grammar masc, atta group, nom and acc pl of rāja
Meaning authorities; officers; lit. king's men
Root Family √rāj
Root √rāj･1 a (rule, shine)
Construction √rāj + a + āno
rāja + āno
Commentary (VIN 1.1.2) rājāno nāma pathabyārājā padesarājā maṇḍalikā antarabhogikā akkhadassā mahāmattā, ye vā pana chejjabhejjaṃ karontā anusāsanti. ete rājāno nāma.
Sanskrit rājānaḥ
Sanskrit Root √rāj 1 (be kingly)

Examples

yo pana bhikkhu gāmā vā araññā vā adinnaṃ theyyasaṅkhātaṃ ādiyeyya, yathārūpe adinn'ādāne rājāno coraṃ gahetvā haneyyuṃ vā bandheyyuṃ vā pabbājeyyuṃ vā

VIN PAT PA 2 adinnādānasikkhāpadaṃ

kodhanassa, bhikkhave, purisapuggalassa kodh'ābhibhūtassa kodhaparetassa, ye'pi'ssa te honti bhogā uṭṭhānavīriy'ādhigatā bāhābalaparicitā sed'āvakkhittā dhammikā dhammaladdhā, te'pi rājāno rājakosaṃ pavesenti kodh'ābhibhūtassa.

MN 36 mahāsaccakasuttaṃ

ayaṃ kho udako rāmaputto paṇḍito viyatto medhāvī dīgharattaṃ apparaj'akkhajātiko. yaṃnūn'āhaṃ udakassa rāmaputtassa paṭhamaṃ dhammaṃ deseyyaṃ. so imaṃ dhammaṃ khippam'eva ājānissatī'ti.

MIL 4.3.7 buddhapūjanapañho
rāhubhadda

masc. auspicious Rāhu [rāhu + bhadda] ~

Meaning auspicious Rāhu
Construction rāhu + bhadda
rāhumukha

nt. name of a torture; lit. Rāhu's mouth [rāhu + mukha] ✓

Grammar nt, comp
Meaning name of a torture; lit. Rāhu's mouth
Construction rāhu + mukha
Compound chaṭṭhī tappurisa (rāhuno + mukha)
Commentary (MNa) rāhumukhan'ti rāhumukhakammakāraṇaṃ, taṃ karontā saṅkunā mukhaṃ vivaritvā antomukhe dīpaṃ jālenti. kaṇṇacūḷikāhi vā paṭṭhāya mukhaṃ nikhādanena khaṇanti. lohitaṃ paggharitvā mukhaṃ pūreti.
Sanskrit rāhumukha

Example

tam'enaṃ rājāno gahetvā vividhā kammakāraṇā kārenti ... bilaṅgathālikam'pi karonti, saṅkhamuṇḍikam'pi karonti, rāhumukham'pi karonti, jotimālikam'pi karonti, hatthapajjotikam'pi karonti, erakavattikam'pi karonti

MN 13 mahādukkhakkhandhasuttaṃ
rāhula

masc. name of a monk; Buddha's son ✓

Grammar masc
Meaning name of a monk; Buddha's son
Sanskrit rāhula

Example

tena kho pana samayena āyasmā rāhulo ambalaṭṭhikāyaṃ viharati.

MN 61 ambalaṭṭhikarāhulovādasuttaṃ
rāhulattheragāthā

fem. Theragāthā 193 (TH193) ✗
rāhulasaṃyutta

nt. Saṃyutta Nikāya 18 (SN18) ✗
rāhulasutta 1

nt. Saṃyutta Nikāya 22.91 (SN22.91) ✗
rāhulasutta 2

nt. Aṅguttara Nikāya 4.177 (AN4.177) ✗
rāhulasutta 3

nt. Sutta Nipāta 2.11 (SNP 23) ✗
rāhulovādasutta

nt. Saṃyutta Nikāya 35.121 (SN35.121) ✗
riccati

pr. is neglected; is forgotten; is abandoned; is lost; lit. is empty [√ric + ya + ti] ✓

Grammar pr, pass of riñcati, intrans
Meaning is neglected; is forgotten; is abandoned; is lost; lit. is empty
Root Family √ric
Root √ric･2 ya (empty)
Base √ric + ya > ricca (pass)
Construction ricca + ti
Synonym nassati
Sanskrit ricyate
Sanskrit Root √ric 7 (leave)

Example

otiṇṇo sātarūpena,
puna gabbhāya gacchati,
yato ca bhikkhu ātāpī,
sampajaññaṃ na riccati.

AN 8.56 bhayasuttaṃ
riñcati

pr. (+acc) neglects; omits; excludes; is negligent (about); (comm) abandons; lit. empties [√ric + ṃa + ti] ✓

Grammar pr, trans (+acc)
Meaning neglects; omits; excludes; is negligent (about); (comm) abandons; lit. empties
Root Family √ric
Root √ric･2 ṃa (empty)
Base √ric + ṃa > riñca
Construction riñca + ti
Synonym hāpayati
Commentary (SNa) sampajaññaṃ na riñcatī'ti sampajaññaṃ na jahati. (ANa) riñcati paṭisallānan'ti ekībhāvaṃ vissajjeti.
Sanskrit riṇakti
Sanskrit Root √ric 7 (leave)

Examples

so tāya dhammapariyattiyā divasaṃ atināmeti, riñcati paṭisallānaṃ, n'ānuyuñjati ajjhattaṃ cetosamathaṃ. ayaṃ vuccati, bhikkhu, bhikkhu pariyattibahulo, no dhammavihārī.

AN 5.73 paṭhamadhammavihārīsuttaṃ

yato ca bhikkhu ātāpī,
sampajaññaṃ na riñcati,
tato so vedanā sabbā,
parijānāti paṇḍito.

SN 36.3 pahānasuttaṃ
riñcamāna

prp. neglecting, abandoning [√ric] ✗
riñci

aor. neglected, abandoned, emptied [√ric] ✗
riñcitvā

abs. having neglected, having abandoned, having emptied [√ric] ✗
ritta 1

pp. empty; emptied; hollow; lit. emptied [√ric + ta] ✓

Grammar pp of riñcati
Meaning empty; emptied; hollow; lit. emptied
Root Family √ric
Root √ric･2 ṃa (empty)
Construction √ric + ta
Derivative kita (ta)
Phonetic Change c > t
Synonym aghagata, ākāsagata, tuccha, tucchaka
Sanskrit rikta
Sanskrit Root √ric 7 (leave)

Examples

yo passati pānīyaghaṭaṃ vā paribhojanīyaghaṭaṃ vā vaccaghaṭaṃ vā rittaṃ tucchaṃ so upaṭṭhāpeti

MN 31 cūḷagosiṅgasuttaṃ

atha kho bhagavā taṃ udak'ādhānaṃ ukkujjitvā āyasmantaṃ rāhulaṃ āmantesi, passasi no tvaṃ, rāhula, imaṃ udak'ādhānaṃ rittaṃ tucchan'ti? evaṃ, bhante.

MN 61 ambalaṭṭhika rāhulovādasuttaṃ
ritta 2

adj. (+abl) free (from); rid (of); lit. empty [√ric + ta] ✓

Grammar pp of riñcati (+abl)
Meaning free (from); rid (of); lit. empty
Root Family √ric
Root √ric･2 ṃa (empty)
Construction √ric + ta
Derivative kita (ta)
Phonetic Change c > t
Sanskrit rikta
Sanskrit Root √ric 7 (leave)

Examples

rittassa munino carato,
kāmesu anapekkhino,
oghatiṇṇassa pihayanti,
kāmesu gadhitā pajā'ti.

SNP 45 tissametteyyasuttaṃ
aṭṭhakavaggo 7

okaṃ pahāya aniketasārī,
gāme akubbaṃ muni santhavāni,
kāmehi ritto apurekkharāno,
kathaṃ na viggayha janena kayirā.

SNP 47 māgaṇḍiyasuttaṃ
aṭṭhakavaggo 9
rittaka

adj. empty; vacuous; insubstantial [√ric + ta + ka] ✓

Grammar adj, from ritta
Meaning empty; vacuous; insubstantial
Root Family √ric
Root √ric･2 ṃa (empty)
Construction √ric + ta + ka
ritta + ka
Derivative taddhita (ka)
Phonetic Change c > t
Synonym aghagata, ākāsagata, tucchaka
Sanskrit riktaka
Sanskrit Root √ric 7 (leave)

Examples

sace kho, mārisa, sabbassa sabbattena ananubhūtaṃ, tadabhiññāya mā h'eva te rittakam'eva ahosi, tucchakam'eva ahosī'ti.

MN 49 brahmanimantanikasuttaṃ

tassa taṃ passato nijjhāyato yoniso upaparikkhato rittakaññ'eva khāyeyya, tucchakaññ'eva khāyeyya, asārakaññ'eva khāyeyya.

SN 22.95 pheṇapiṇḍūpamasuttaṃ
rittakatta

nt. fact of being empty; vacuousness; insubstantiality [√ric + ta + ka + tta] ~

Grammar nt, abstr, from rittaka
Meaning fact of being empty; vacuousness; insubstantiality
Root Family √ric
Root √ric･2 ṃa (empty)
Construction √ric + ta + ka + tta
rittaka + tta
Derivative taddhita (tta)
Phonetic Change c > t
Sanskrit riktaka
Sanskrit Root √ric 7 (leave)
rittapatta

masc. empty bowl [ritta + patta] ~

Grammar masc, comp
Meaning empty bowl
Construction ritta + patta
Commentary (MNt) rittapatt'ovā'ti yesu kulesu paṭipiṇḍavasena pavattati, tesaṃ sabbapacchimaṃ attano yathāladdhaṃ datvā tattha kiñci aladdhā rittapatto vihāraṃ pavisitvā nipajjati jighacchādubbalyenā'ti adhippāyo.
rittapesuṇa

adj. devoid of divisive speech; free of slander [ritta + pesuṇa] ✓

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning devoid of divisive speech; free of slander
Construction ritta + pesuṇa
Compound kammadhāraya (ritta + pesuṇa)
Commentary (SNPa) rittapesuṇo'ti pahīnapesuṇo. (THa) pisuṇavācāvirahitato rittapesuṇo
Sanskrit rikta + paiśuna

Example

sacco siyā appagabbho,
amāyo rittapesuṇo,
akkodhano lobhapāpaṃ,
vevicchaṃ vitare muni.

SNP 53 attadaṇḍasuttaṃ
aṭṭhakavaggo 15
rittamuṭṭhi

masc. empty fist ✗
rittassāda

Construction ritta + assāda
Commentary (ANa) ritt'assādan'ti jhānasukh'ābhāvena ritt'assādaṃ.
rittahattha

adj. empty-handed ✗
riva 1

sandhi. like; as [[r] + iva] ✓

Grammar sandhi, letter + ind
Meaning like; as
Construction [r] + iva > riva
Phonetic Change +r
Sanskrit iva

Example

vāri pokkharapatt'eva,
ār'agge'riva sāsapo,
yo na limpati kāmesu,
tam'ahaṃ brūmi brāhmaṇaṃ.

DHP 401 brāhmaṇavaggo
riva 2

sandhi. only; just; so; even [[r] + eva] ✓

Grammar sandhi, letter + ind
Meaning only; just; so; even
Construction [r] + eva > riva
Phonetic Change +r
e > ri (Kacc 22, 28)
Sanskrit eva

Example

evaṃ bhaṇeti, bhaṇayati, bhaṇāpeti, bhaṇāpayati. bhaṇenti, bhaṇayanti, bhaṇāpenti, bhaṇāpayanti. tatha'riva aññe'pi yojetabbā.

kaccāyana ākhyātakappa 438
rissamāna

prp. (+instr) being injured (by); being hurt (by) [√ris + ya + māna] ✓

Grammar prp of rissati, pass, intrans (+instr)
Meaning being injured (by); being hurt (by)
Root Family √ris
Root √ris×1 ya (hurt)
Base √ris + ya > rissa (pass)
Construction rissa + māna
Derivative kita (māna)
Synonym vajjhamāna
Variant īrayamāna, samphassamāna
Commentary (MNa) rissamāno'ti ruppamāno, ghaṭṭiyamāno.
Sanskrit riṣyamāṇa
Sanskrit Root √riṣ 1, 4 (be hurt)

Example

sītassa purakkhato uṇhassa purakkhato ḍaṃsamakasa-vāt'ātapa-sarīṃsapa-samphassehi rissamāno khuppipāsāya mīyamāno, ayam'pi, bhikkhave, kāmānaṃ ādīnavo sandiṭṭhiko, dukkhakkhandho kāmahetu kāmanidānaṃ kām'ādhikaraṇaṃ kāmānam'eva hetu.

MN 13 mahādukkhakkhandhasuttaṃ
rukkha 1

masc. tree ✓

Grammar masc
Meaning tree
Synonym duma, mahiruha, pādapa, taru, viṭapī
Sanskrit vṛkṣa

Examples

subh'ānupassiṃ viharantaṃ,
indriyesu asaṃvutaṃ,
bhojanamhi c'āmattaññuṃ,
kusītaṃ hīnavīriyaṃ,
taṃ ve pasahati māro,
vāto rukkhaṃ'va dubbalaṃ.

DHP 7 yamakavaggo

yathā'pi mūle anupaddave daḷhe,
chinno'pi rukkho puna'r'eva rūhati,
evam'pi taṇh'ānusaye anūhate,
nibbattatī dukkham'idaṃ punappunaṃ.

DHP 338 taṇhāvaggo
rukkha 2

nt. tree ✓

Grammar nt
Meaning tree
Synonym duma, mahiruha, pādapa, taru, viṭapī
Notes masc declension is much more common
Sanskrit vṛkṣa

Example

so yaṃ yadeva rukkhaṃ kuṭhāripāsena ākoṭeyya tattha yāni tāni rukkhāni daḷhāni sāravantāni tāni kuṭhāripāsena ākoṭitāni kakkhaḷaṃ paṭinadanti, yāni pana tāni rukkhāni antopūtīni avassutāni kasambujātāni tāni kuṭhāripāsena ākoṭitāni daddaraṃ paṭinadanti.

AN 8.10 kāraṇḍavasuttaṃ
rukkhagacchā

masc. trees and shrubs ✗
rukkhagahaṇa

nt. thicket of trees ✗
rukkhagahana

nt. thicket of trees [rukkha + gahana] ✓

Grammar nt, comp
Meaning thicket of trees
Construction rukkha + gahana
Compound chaṭṭhī tappurisa (rukkhānaṃ + gahana)
Sanskrit vṛkṣa + gahana

Example

kathañ'ca, bhikkhave, mahācoro gahananissito hoti? idha, bhikkhave, mahācoro tiṇagahanaṃ vā nissito hoti, rukkhagahanaṃ vā rodhaṃ vā mahāvanasaṇḍaṃ vā.

nt. tree shrine [rukkha + cetiya] ✓

Meaning tree shrine
Construction rukkha + cetiya

Sanskrit vṛkṣa + caitya, caityavṛkṣa

yaṃnūn'āhaṃ yā tā rattiyo abhiññātā abhilakkhitā, cātuddasī pañcadasī aṭṭhamī ca pakkhassa, tathārūpāsu rattīsu yāni tāni ārāmacetiyāni vanacetiyāni rukkhacetiyāni bhiṃsanakāni salomahaṃsāni tathārūpesu sen'āsanesu vihareyyaṃ app'eva nām'āhaṃ bhayabheravaṃ passeyyan'ti.

MN 4 bhayabheravasuttaṃ
rukkhacchāyā

Example

atha puriso āgaccheyya ghamm'ābhitatto ghammapareto kilanto tasito pipāsito. so taṃ pokkharaṇiṃ ogāhetvā nhātvā ca pivitvā ca paccuttaritvā tatth'eva rukkhacchāyāya nisīdeyya vā nipajjeyya vā.

atha kho, bhikkhave, tasmiṃ sāle adhivatthāya devatāya mittāmaccā ñātisālohitā ārāmadevatā vanadevatā rukkhadevatā osadhitiṇavanappatīsu adhivatthā devatā saṅgamma samāgamma evaṃ samassāseyyuṃ, mā bhavaṃ bhāyi, mā bhavaṃ bhāyi

nt. Jātaka 74 (JA 74) ✗

yācitak'ūpamā kāmā vuttā bhagavatā bahudukkhā bah'upāyāsā, ādīnavo ettha bhiyyo. rukkhaphala-upamā kāmā vuttā bhagavatā bahudukkhā bah'upāyāsā, ādīnavo ettha bhiyyo.

MN 22 alagaddūpamasuttaṃ
rukkhaphalūpama

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning like a fruit tree; similar to a fruit tree
Construction rukkha + phala + upama
Compound kammadhāraya (rukkhaphala + upama)

Sanskrit vṛkṣa + phala + upama

Examples

evam'eva kho, gahapati, ariyasāvako iti paṭisañcikkhati, rukkhaphal'ūpamā kāmā vuttā bhagavatā bahudukkhā bah'upāyāsā, ādīnavo ettha bhiyyo'ti.

MN 54 potaliyasuttaṃ

aṭṭhikaṅkal'ūpamā ... maṃsapes'ūpamā ... tiṇ'ukk'ūpamā ... aṅgārakās'ūpamā ... supinak'ūpamā ... yācitak'ūpamā ... rukkhaphal'ūpamā ... asisūn'ūpamā ... sattisūl'ūpamā ... sappasir'ūpamā kāmā vuttā bhagavatā bahudukkhā bahupāyāsā, ādīnavo ettha bhiyyo'ti.

MN 22 alagaddūpamasuttaṃ
rukkhamūla

nt. foot of a tree; base of a tree [rukkha + mūla] ✓

Grammar nt, comp
Meaning foot of a tree; base of a tree
Construction rukkha + mūla
Compound chaṭṭhī tappurisa (rukkhassa + mūla)
Commentary (MNa) rukkhamūlan'ti yaṃkiñci sandacchāyaṃ vivittaṃ rakkhamūlaṃ.
Sanskrit vṛkṣamūla

Examples

etāni, bhikkhu, rukkhamūlāni, etāni suññ'āgārāni. jhāyatha, bhikkhu, mā pamād'attha, mā pacchā vippaṭisārino ahuvattha. ayaṃ vo amhākaṃ anusāsanī'ti.

AN 5.73 paṭhamadhammavihārīsuttaṃ

araññe rukkhamūle vā,
suññ'āgāre'va bhikkhavo,
anussaretha sambuddhaṃ,
bhayaṃ tumhāka no siyā.

SN 11.3 dhajaggasuttaṃ
rukkhamūlagata

adj. gone to the foot of a tree [rukkhamūla + gata] ✓

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning gone to the foot of a tree
Construction rukkhamūla + gata
Compound dutiyā tappurisa (rukkhamūlaṃ + gata)
Sanskrit vṛkṣamūla + gata

Examples

tañ'ca nāgaṃ passati rukkhamūlagataṃ vā abbhokāsagataṃ vā gacchantaṃ vā tiṭṭhantaṃ vā nisinnaṃ vā nipannaṃ vā. so niṭṭhaṃ gacchati, ayam'eva so mahānāgo'ti.

MN 27 cūḷahatthipadopamasuttaṃ

idha, bhikkhave, bhikkhu araññagato vā rukkhamūlagato vā suññ'āgāragato vā nisīdati pallaṅkaṃ ābhujitvā ujuṃ kāyaṃ paṇidhāya parimukhaṃ satiṃ upaṭṭhapetvā

DN 22.2 mahāsatipaṭṭhānasuttaṃ
rukkhamūlagahana

nt. root of a tree or the forest [rukkhamūla + gahana] ~

Grammar nt, comp
Meaning root of a tree or the forest
Construction rukkhamūla + gahana
Commentary (THa) rukkhamūlagahanan'ti rukkhamūlabhūtaṃ gahanaṃ, gahanañ'hi atthi, na rukkhamūlaṃ, rukkhamūlañ'ca atthi, na gahanaṃ, tesu rukkhamūlaggahaṇena ṭhānassa chāyāsampannatāya vāt'ātapaparissayābhāvaṃ dasseti. gahanaggahaṇena nivātabhāvena vātaparissayābhāvaṃ janasambādhābhāvañ'ca dasseti, tadubhayena ca bhāvanāyogyataṃ.
rukkhamūlasenāsana

nt. living place at the foot of a tree [rukkhamūla + senāsana] ~

Grammar nt, comp
Meaning living place at the foot of a tree
Construction rukkhamūla + senāsana
rukkhamūlika

masc. ascetic who lives at the foot of tree; root of a tree dweller [rukkha + mūla + ika] ✓

Grammar masc, comp, from rukkhamūla
Meaning ascetic who lives at the foot of tree; root of a tree dweller
Construction rukkha + mūla + ika
rukkhamūla + ika
Derivative taddhita (ika)
Compound kammadhāraya > bahubbīhi (rukkha + mūlika)
Commentary (MNa) rukkhamūlikassā'ti rukkhamūlavāsino.
Sanskrit vṛkṣamūlika

Examples

n'āhaṃ, bhikkhave, rukkhamūlikassa rukkhamūlikamattena sāmaññaṃ vadāmi.

MN 40 cūḷāssapurasuttaṃ

so iti paṭisañcikkhati, ahaṃ kho'mhi rukkhamūliko, ime pan'aññe bhikkhū na rukkhamūlikā'ti. so tena rukkhamūlikattena attān'ukkaṃseti, paraṃ vambheti. ayam'pi, bhikkhave, asappurisadhammo.

MN 113 sappurisasuttaṃ
rukkhamūlikaṅga

nt. practice of living at the foot of tree ✗
rukkhamūlikatta

nt. fact of being an ascetic who lives at the foot of tree; fact of being a root of a tree dweller [rukkha + mūla + ika + tta] ✓

Grammar nt, abstr, comp, from rukkhamūlika
Meaning fact of being an ascetic who lives at the foot of tree; fact of being a root of a tree dweller
Construction rukkha + mūla + ika + tta
rukkhamūlika + tta
Derivative taddhita (tta)
Sanskrit vṛkṣamūlika + tva

Examples

so iti paṭisañcikkhati, ahaṃ kho'mhi rukkhamūliko, ime pan'aññe bhikkhū na rukkhamūlikā'ti. so tena rukkhamūlikattena attān'ukkaṃseti, paraṃ vambheti. ayam'pi, bhikkhave, asappurisadhammo.

MN 113 sappurisasuttaṃ

so paṭipadaṃ'y'eva antaraṃ karitvā tena rukkhamūlikattena n'ev'attān'ukkaṃseti, na paraṃ vambheti. ayam'pi, bhikkhave, sappurisadhammo.

MN 113 sappurisasuttaṃ
rukkhamūlikamatta

nt. mere fact of living at the foot of tree [rukkhamūlika + matta] ✓

Grammar nt, abstr, comp
Meaning mere fact of living at the foot of tree
Construction rukkhamūlika + matta
Sanskrit vṛkṣamūlika + mātra

Example

n'āhaṃ, bhikkhave, udakorohakassa udakorohaṇamattena sāmaññaṃ vadāmi. n'āhaṃ, bhikkhave, rukkhamūlikassa rukkhamūlikamattena sāmaññaṃ vadāmi. n'āhaṃ, bhikkhave, abbhokāsikassa abbhokāsikamattena sāmaññaṃ vadāmi.

MN 40 cūḷāssapurasuttaṃ
rukkhamūlikasutta

nt. Aṅguttara Nikāya 5.183 (AN5.183) ✗
rukkhasākhā

fem. branch of a tree [rukkha + sākhā] ✓

Grammar fem, comp
Meaning branch of a tree
Construction rukkha + sākhā
Compound chaṭṭhī tappurisa (rukkhassa + sākha)
Sanskrit vṛkṣa + śākhā

Example

seyyathā'pi nāma ulūko rukkhasākhāyaṃ mūsikaṃ maggayamāno jhāyati pajjhāyati nijjhāyati apajjhāyati.

ruci

fem. liking; preference; choice; inclination; approval; lit. pleasure [√ruc + i] ✓

Grammar fem, from ruccati
Meaning liking; preference; choice; inclination; approval; lit. pleasure
Root Family √ruc
Root √ruc･1 *a (shine, like)
Construction √ruc + i
Derivative kita (i)
Antonym aruci
Synonym vīmaṃsā
Sanskrit ruci
Sanskrit Root √ruc 1 (shine)

Examples

te evaṃ vadeyyuṃ m'āyasmanto etaṃ bhikkhuṃ kiñci avacuttha, dhammavādī c'eso bhikkhu, vinayavādī c'eso bhikkhu, amhākañ'c'eso bhikkhu chandañ'ca ruciñ'ca ādāya voharati

VIN PAT SA 11 bhedānuvattakasikkhāpadaṃ

sakañ'hi diṭṭhiṃ katham'accayeyya,
chand'ānunīto ruciyā niviṭṭho,
sayaṃ samattāni pakubbamāno,
yathā hi jāneyya tathā vadeyya.

SNP 41 duṭṭhaṭṭhakasuttaṃ
aṭṭhakavaggo 3
rucika

adj. preferring; choosing; liking [√ruc + i + ka] ✓

Grammar adj, in comps, from ruci
Meaning preferring; choosing; liking
Root Family √ruc
Root √ruc･1 ya (shine, like)
Construction √ruc + i + ka
ruci + ka
Derivative taddhita (ka)
Sanskrit rucika
Sanskrit Root √ruc 1 (shine)

Examples

dujjānaṃ kho etaṃ, poṭṭhapāda, tayā aññadiṭṭhikena aññakhantikena aññarucikena aññatr'āyogena aññatr'ācariyakena, saññā purisassa attā'ti vā, aññā'va saññā añño attā'ti vā'ti.

DN 9.4 poṭṭhapādasuttaṃ, saññāattakathā

anuvattakā'ti yaṃdiṭṭhiko so hoti yaṃkhantiko yaṃruciko te'pi taṃdiṭṭhikā honti taṃkhantikā taṃrucikā.

rucita

pp. pleased; liked [√ruc] ✗

Root Family √ruc

Sanskrit Root √ruc 1 (shine)

Examples

yathā'pi ruciraṃ pupphaṃ,
vaṇṇavantaṃ sugandhakaṃ,
evaṃ subhāsitā vācā,
saphalā hoti kubbato.

rucirajātaka

Examples

ye'pi'ssa te honti dāsā'ti vā pessā'ti vā kammakarā'ti vā, te'pi daṇḍatajjitā bhayatajjitā assumukhā rudamānā parikammāni karonti.

chandajātassa jantuno,

aṭṭhakavaggo 1

nt. Jātaka 482 (JA 482) ✗
rusita

pp. provoked; angered; irritated; infuriated [√rus + ita] ✓

Grammar pp of roseti
Meaning provoked; angered; irritated; infuriated
Root Family √rus
Root √rus･1 *a (be angry)
Construction √rus + ita
Derivative kita (ita)
Synonym kuddha, kopita, parikupita, saṅkupita
Sanskrit ruṣita
Sanskrit Root √ruṣ 1, 4, 6, 10 (be vexed)

Examples

sutvā rusito bahuṃ vācaṃ,
samaṇānaṃ vā puthujanānaṃ,
pharusena ne na paṭivajjā,
na hi santo paṭisenikaronti.

SNP 52 tuvaṭakasuttaṃ
aṭṭhakavaggo 14

annañ'ca laddhā vasanañ'ca kāle,
mattaṃ so jaññā idha tosan'atthaṃ,
so tesu gutto yatacāri gāme,
rusito'pi vācaṃ pharusaṃ na vajjā.

SNP 54 sāriputtasuttaṃ
aṭṭhakavaggo 16
ruha

adj. growing; growing in; growing on [√ruh + a] ✓

Grammar adj, in comps, from rūhati
Meaning growing; growing in; growing on
Root Family √ruh
Root √ruh･1 a (ascend, grow)
Construction √ruh + a
Derivative kita (a)
Sanskrit ruha
Sanskrit Root √ruh 1 (ascend)

Examples

yo rāgam'udacchidā asesaṃ,
bhisapupphaṃ'va saroruhaṃ vigayha,
so bhikkhu jahāti orapāraṃ,
urago jiṇṇam'iva tacaṃ purāṇaṃ.

SNP 1 uragasuttaṃ
uragavaggo 1

uttam'aṅgaruhā mayhaṃ,
ime jātā vayoharā,
pātubhūtā devadūtā,
pabbajjāsamayo mamā'ti.

JA 9 maghadeva jātakaṃ
ruhakajātaka

nt. Jātaka 191 (JA 191) ✗
ruhana

nt. rising up, growing up [√ruh] ✗
ruhira

nt. blood ✗
ruḷha

pp. healed; cured; lit. grown over [√ruh + ta] ✓

Grammar pp of ruhati
Meaning healed; cured; lit. grown over
Root Family √ruh
Root √ruh･1 a (ascend, grow)
Construction √ruh + ta > ruḍha > ruḷha
Derivative kita (ta)
Phonetic Change t > ḍ > ḷ
Sanskrit rūḍha
Sanskrit Root √ruh 1 (ascend)

Example

so ruḷhena vaṇena sañchavinā n'eva maraṇaṃ vā nigaccheyya na maraṇamattaṃ vā dukkhaṃ.

MN 105 sunakkhattasuttaṃ
ruḷhanīya

ptp. mountable; climbable [√ruh] ✗
rū 1

masc. the sound rū; the syllable rū ~

Grammar masc, onom
Meaning the sound rū; the syllable rū
rū 2

abbrev. abbreviation of rūpāvacara ~

Grammar abbrev
Meaning abbreviation of rūpāvacara
rūpa 1

nt. matter; material thing; materiality; experience of material world; physical objects of consciousness; first of the five aggregates; lit. form [√rūp + a] ✓

Grammar nt
Meaning matter; material thing; materiality; experience of material world; physical objects of consciousness; first of the five aggregates; lit. form
Root Family √rūp
Root √rūp･8 *e (form, produce)
Construction √rūp + a
Derivative kita (a)
Antonym arūpa
Sanskrit rūpa
Sanskrit Root √rūp 10 (form)

Examples

evaṃ passaṃ, bhikkhave, sutavā ariyasāvako rūpasmim'pi nibbindati vedanāya'pi nibbindati saññāya'pi nibbindati saṅkhāresu'pi nibbindati viññāṇasmim'pi nibbindati

SN 12.61 assutavāsuttaṃ

ahañ'c'eva kho pana anāgataṃ rūpaṃ abhinandeyyaṃ, anāgatam'p'āhaṃ addhānaṃ evam'eva rūpena khajjeyyaṃ, seyyathā'pi eta'r'ahi paccuppannena rūpena khajjāmī'ti

SN 22.79 khajjanīyasuttaṃ
rūpa 2

nt. body; physical body; material bodily; lit. form [√rūp + a] ✓

Grammar nt
Meaning body; physical body; material bodily; lit. form
Root Family √rūp
Root √rūp･8 *e (form, produce)
Construction √rūp + a
Derivative kita (a)
Antonym arūpa
Sanskrit rūpa
Sanskrit Root √rūp 10 (form)

Examples

seyyathā'pi, āvuso, kaṭṭhañ'ca paṭicca valliñ'ca paṭicca tiṇañ'ca paṭicca mattikañ'ca paṭicca ākāso parivārito agāraṃ tv'eva saṅkhaṃ gacchati, evam'eva kho, āvuso, aṭṭhiñ'ca paṭicca nhāruñ'ca paṭicca maṃsañ'ca paṭicca cammañ'ca paṭicca ākāso parivārito rūpaṃ tv'eva saṅkhaṃ gacchati.

MN 28 mahāhatthipadopamasuttaṃ

disvāna rūpesu vihaññamāne,
ruppanti rūpesu janā pamattā,
tasmā tuvaṃ piṅgiya appamatto,
jahassu rūpaṃ apunabbhavāya.

SNP 71 piṅgiya māṇava pucchā
pārāyanavaggo 16
rūpa 3

nt. (object of the eye) form; material form; shape; sight [√rūp + a] ✓

Grammar nt
Meaning (object of the eye) form; material form; shape; sight
Root Family √rūp
Root √rūp･8 *e (form, produce)
Construction √rūp + a
Derivative kita (a)
Antonym arūpa
Commentary (MNa) rūpā'ti nīlapīt'ādibhedaṃ rūp'ārammaṇaṃ.
Sanskrit rūpa
Sanskrit Root √rūp 10 (form)

Examples

andho hi, uttara, cakkhunā rūpaṃ na passati, badhiro sotena saddaṃ na suṇātī'ti

MN 152 indriyabhāvanāsuttaṃ

evam'eva kho, bhikkhave, yassa kassaci bhikkhuno kāyagatāsati abhāvitā abahulīkatā, taṃ cakkhu āviñchati manāpiyesu rūpesu, amanāpiyā rūpā paṭikūlā honti

SN 35.247 chappāṇakasuttaṃ
rūpa 4

adj. of character; having nature of; of type; of kind; having the quality of; lit. having form of [√rūp + a] ✓

Grammar adj, in comps
Meaning of character; having nature of; of type; of kind; having the quality of; lit. having form of
Root Family √rūp
Root √rūp･8 *e (form, produce)
Construction √rūp + a
Derivative kita (a)
Synonym ādisa
Sanskrit rūpa
Sanskrit Root √rūp 10 (form)

Examples

na monena munī hoti,
mūḷharūpo aviddasu,
yo ca tulaṃva paggayha,
varam'ādāya paṇḍito.

DHP 268 dhammaṭṭhavaggo

manasā dhammaṃ viññāya piyarūpe dhamme adhimuccati, appiyarūpe dhamme byāpajjati, anupaṭṭhitakāyassati ca viharati parittacetaso.

SN 35.247 chappāṇakasuttaṃ
rūpa 5

adj. as if; like someone; lit. having form of [√rūp + a] ✓

Grammar adj, in comps
Meaning as if; like someone; lit. having form of
Root Family √rūp
Root √rūp･8 *e (form, produce)
Construction √rūp + a
Derivative kita (a)
Sanskrit rūpa
Sanskrit Root √rūp 10 (form)

Examples

bhikkhū pan'eva kulesu nimantitā bhuñjanti, tatra ce sā bhikkhunī vosāsamānarūpā ṭhitā hoti, idha sūpaṃ detha, idha odanaṃ dethā'ti, tehi bhikkhūhi sā bhikkhunī apasādetabbā, apasakka tāva bhagini, yāva bhikkhū bhuñjantī'ti.

VIN PAT PD 2 dutiyapāṭidesanīyasikkhāpadaṃ

atha kho āyasmā sāriputto taramānarūpo nisīdanaṃ ādāya āyasmantaṃ puṇṇaṃ mantāṇiputtaṃ piṭṭhito piṭṭhito anubandhi sīs'ānulokī.

rūpaaññāṇasutta

rūpaasallakkhaṇādisuttapañcaka

nt. Saṃyutta Nikāya 33.26-30 (SN33.26-30) ✗
rūpaka 1

nt. form; image; likeness [√rūp + a + ka] ✓

Grammar nt, in comps, from rūpa
Meaning form; image; likeness
Root Family √rūp
Root √rūp･8 *e (form, produce)
Construction √rūp + a + ka
rūpa + ka
Derivative taddhita (ka)
Synonym bimba
Sanskrit rūpaka
Sanskrit Root √rūp 10 (form)

Example

seyyathā'pi, bhikkhave, issāso vā issās'antevāsī vā tiṇapurisarūpake vā mattikāpuñje vā yoggaṃ karitvā, so aparena samayena dūrepātī ca hoti akkhaṇavedhī ca mahato ca kāyassa padāletā.

rūpaka 2

nt. simile [√rūp] ✗
rūpaka 3

rūpakāya

masc. material body; material group; physical body [rūpa + kāya] ✓

Grammar masc, comp
Meaning material body; material group; physical body
Construction rūpa + kāya

Sanskrit rūpa + kāya

Example

yehi, ānanda, ākārehi yehi liṅgehi yehi nimittehi yehi uddesehi rūpakāyassa paññatti hoti, tesu ākāresu tesu liṅgesu tesu nimittesu tesu uddesesu asati api nu kho nāmakāye paṭighasamphasso paññāyethā'ti? no h'etaṃ, bhante.

rūpagata 1

adj. related to matter; connected with materiality; kind of matter [rūpa + gata] ✓

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning related to matter; connected with materiality; kind of matter
Construction rūpa + gata
Compound kammadhāraya (rūpa + gata)
Commentary (ANa) rūpam'eva rūpagataṃ. sesapadesu'pi es'eva nayo.
Sanskrit rūpagata

Example

so yadeva tattha hoti rūpagataṃ vedanāgataṃ saññāgataṃ saṅkhāragataṃ viññāṇagataṃ, te dhamme aniccato dukkhato rogato gaṇḍato sallato aghato ābādhato parato palokato suññato anattato samanupassati.

rūpaññū 1

adj. who knows the form; who knows the physical features [rūpa + ñū] ✓

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning who knows the form; who knows the physical features
Construction rūpa + ñū
Compound dutiyā tappurisa (rūpaṃ + ñū)
Commentary (ANa) na rūpaññū hotī'ti gaṇanato vā vaṇṇato vā rūpaṃ na jānāti.
Sanskrit rūpa + jñā

Example

idha, bhikkhave, gopālako na rūpaññū hoti, na lakkhaṇakusalo hoti, na āsāṭikaṃ hāretā hoti, na vaṇaṃ paṭicchādetā hoti, na dhūmaṃ kattā hoti, na titthaṃ jānāti, na pītaṃ jānāti, na vīthiṃ jānāti, na gocarakusalo hoti

AN 11.17 gopālasuttaṃ
rūpaññū 2

adj. who understands materiality [rūpa + ñū] ✓

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning who understands materiality
Construction rūpa + ñū
Compound dutiyā tappurisa (rūpaṃ + ñū)
Commentary (ANa) na rūpaññū hotī'ti cattāri mahābhūtāni catunnañ'ca mahābhūtānaṃ upādāyarūpan'ti evaṃ vuttaṃ rūpaṃ dvīh'ākārehi na jānāti gaṇanato vā samuṭṭhānato vā.
Sanskrit rūpa + jñā

Example

idha, bhikkhave, bhikkhu na rūpaññū hoti, na lakkhaṇakusalo hoti, na āsāṭikaṃ hāretā hoti, na vaṇaṃ paṭicchādetā hoti, na dhūmaṃ kattā hoti, na titthaṃ jānāti, na pītaṃ jānāti, na vīthiṃ jānāti, na gocarakusalo hoti

AN 11.17 gopālasuttaṃ
rūpataṇhā

fem. craving for material form [rūpa + taṇhā] ✓

Grammar fem, abstr, comp
Meaning craving for material form
Construction rūpa + taṇhā
Compound sattamī tappurisa (rūpe + taṇhā)
Sanskrit rūpa + tṛṣṇā

Examples

katamā ca, bhikkhave, taṇhā? cha'y'ime, bhikkhave, taṇhākāyā, rūpataṇhā, saddataṇhā, gandhataṇhā, rasataṇhā, phoṭṭhabbataṇhā, dhammataṇhā. ayaṃ vuccati, bhikkhave, taṇhā.

SN 12.2 vibhaṅgasuttaṃ

aparā'pi tisso taṇhā, kāmataṇhā rūpataṇhā arūpataṇhā

DN 33.6 saṅgītisuttaṃ
rūpataṇhāsutta

nt. Saṃyutta Nikāya 25.8 (SN25.8) ✗
rūpatā

Grammar fem, abstr, from rūpa

Root √rūp･8 *e (form, produce)

rūpa + tā

Sanskrit rūpatā
Sanskrit Root √rūp 10 (form)

Example

etha tumhe, kālāmā, mā anussavena, mā paramparāya, mā itikirāya, mā piṭakasampadānena, mā takkahetu, mā nayahetu, mā ākāraparivitakkena, mā diṭṭhinijjhānakkhantiyā, mā bhabbarūpatāya, mā samaṇo no garū'ti.

AN 3.66 kesamuttisuttaṃ
rūpatta 1.1

nt. fact of being material; fact of having form; lit. matter state [√rūp + a + tta] ✓

Grammar nt, abstr, from rūpa
Meaning fact of being material; fact of having form; lit. matter state
Root Family √rūp
Root √rūp･8 *e (form, produce)
Construction √rūp + a + tta
rūpa + tta
Derivative taddhita (tta)
Notes see rūpatta 2
Sanskrit rūpatā
Sanskrit Root √rūp 10 (form)

Example

rūpaṃ rūpattāya saṅkhatam'abhisaṅkharonti, vedanaṃ vedanattāya saṅkhatam'abhisaṅkharonti, saññaṃ saññattāya saṅkhatam'abhisaṅkharonti, saṅkhāre saṅkhārattāya saṅkhatam'abhisaṅkharonti, viññāṇaṃ viññāṇattāya saṅkhatam'abhisaṅkharonti

SN 22.79 khajjanīyasuttaṃ
rūpatta 2.1

adj. having form as one's self [rūpa + atta] ✓

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning having form as one's self
Construction rūpa + atta
Compound kammadhāraya (rūpa + atta)
Commentary (MNa) rūp'att'āyaṃ purisapuggalo'ti rūpaṃ attā assā'ti rūp'attā, rūpaṃ attā'ti gahetvā ṭhitapuggalaṃ dīpeti.
Notes see rūpatta 1
Sanskrit rūpa + ātman

Example

evam'eva kho, bho gotama, rūp'att'āyaṃ purisapuggalo rūpe patiṭṭhāya puññaṃ vā apuññaṃ vā pasavati, vedan'att'āyaṃ purisapuggalo vedanāyaṃ patiṭṭhāya puññaṃ vā apuññaṃ vā pasavati

MN 35 cūḷasaccakasuttaṃ
rūpadassana 1

nt. seeing of forms; seeing sights [rūpa + dassana] ✓

Grammar nt, act, comp
Meaning seeing of forms; seeing sights
Construction rūpa + dassana
Compound dutiyā tappurisa (rūpaṃ + dassana)
Sanskrit rūpa + darśana

Example

so yāni sammā nibbān'ādhimuttassa asappāyāni tāni anuyuñjeyya, asappāyaṃ cakkhunā rūpadassanaṃ anuyuñjeyya, asappāyaṃ sotena saddaṃ anuyuñjeyya

MN 105 sunakkhattasuttaṃ
rūpadassana 2

nt. seeing the physical body (of) ✗
rūpadhātu 1

fem. realm of form; world of form; realm of subtle materiality; lit. form state [rūpa + dhātu] ✓

Grammar fem, abstr, comp
Meaning realm of form; world of form; realm of subtle materiality; lit. form state
Construction rūpa + dhātu
Compound kammadhāraya (rūpa + dhātu)
Antonym arūpadhātu
Commentary (THa) rūpadhātusū'ti puthujjanabhav'aggapariyosānesu rūpabhavesu
Sanskrit rūpa + dhātu

Examples

rūpadhātu kho, gahapati, viññāṇassa oko. rūpadhāturāgavinibandhañ'ca pana viññāṇaṃ, okasārī'ti vuccati. vedanādhātu kho, gahapati, viññāṇassa oko.

SN 22.3 hāliddikānisuttaṃ

rūpadhātuvepakkañ'ca, ānanda, kammaṃ n'ābhavissa, api nu kho rūpabhavo paññāyethāti? no h'etaṃ bhante

AN 3.66 kesamuttisuttaṃ
rūpadhātu 2

fem. object of vision; lit. form state [rūpa + dhātu] ✓

Grammar fem, abstr, comp
Meaning object of vision; lit. form state
Construction rūpa + dhātu
Compound chaṭṭhī tappurisa (rūpassa + dhātu)
Commentary (SNa) cakkhudhātū'tiādīsu cakkhupasādo cakkhudhātu, rūpārammaṇaṃ rūpadhātu, cakkhupasādavatthukaṃ cittaṃ cakkhuviññāṇadhātu.
Sanskrit rūpa + dhātu

Example

evaṃ, bhante. idaṃ kho, gahapati, dhātunānattaṃ vuttaṃ bhagavatā, cakkhudhātu, rūpadhātu, cakkhuviññāṇadhātu … manodhātu, dhammadhātu, manoviññāṇadhātu.

nt. sign of form; image of matter [rūpa + nimitta] ✓

Meaning sign of form; image of matter
Construction rūpa + nimitta
Compound chaṭṭhī tappurisa (rūpassa + nimitta)

Example

kathañ'ca, gahapati, niketasārī hoti? rūpanimittaniketavisāravinibandhā kho, gahapati, niketasārī'ti vuccati.

SN 22.3 hāliddikānisuttaṃ
rūpanimittaniketavisāravinibandha

adj. bound by the expanding home of mental images of matter [rūpanimitta + niketa + visāra + vinibandha] ~

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning bound by the expanding home of mental images of matter
Construction rūpanimitta + niketa + visāra + vinibandha
Commentary (SNa) rūpanimittaniketavisāravinibandhā'ti rūpam'eva kilesānaṃ paccay'aṭṭhena nimittaṃ, ārammaṇakiriyasaṅkhātanivāsanaṭṭhān'aṭṭhena niketan'ti rūpanimittaniketaṃ. visāro ca vinibandho ca visāravinibandhā. ubhayen'api hi kilesānaṃ patthaṭabhāvo ca vinibandhanabhāvo ca vutto, rūpanimittanikete visāravinibandhā'ti rūpanimittaniketavisāravinibandhā, tasmā rūpanimittaniketamhi uppannena kilesavisārena c'eva kilesabandhanena cā'ti attho.
Notes A difficult term to translate. See CPB note 22.
rūpanimittassādagadhita

adj. tied by gratification to the mental representation of form [rūpanimitta + assāda + gadhita] ~

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning tied by gratification to the mental representation of form
Construction rūpanimitta + assāda + gadhita
rūpanimittassādavinibandha

adj. chained by gratification to the mental representation of form [rūpanimitta + assāda + vinibandha] ~

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning chained by gratification to the mental representation of form
Construction rūpanimitta + assāda + vinibandha
rūpanimittassādasaṃyojanasaṃyutta

adj. bound with a chain by gratification to the mental representation of form [rūpanimitta + assāda + saṃyojana + saṃyutta] ~

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning bound with a chain by gratification to the mental representation of form
Construction rūpanimitta + assāda + saṃyojana + saṃyutta
rūpanimittānusārī

adj. following the mental representation of form [rūpanimitta + anusārī] ~

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning following the mental representation of form
Construction rūpanimitta + anusārī
rūpanirodha

masc. ending of material form; cessation of the body [rūpa + nirodha] ✓

Grammar masc, comp
Meaning ending of material form; cessation of the body
Construction rūpa + nirodha
Compound chaṭṭhī tappurisa (rūpassa + nirodha)
Antonym rūpasamudaya
Sanskrit rūpa + nirodha

Example

āhārasamudayā rūpasamudayo, āhāranirodhā rūpanirodho.

SN 22.57 sattaṭṭhānasuttaṃ
rūpanirodhagāminī paṭipadā

idiom. path of practice leading to the end of material form [rūpa + nirodha + gāmī + paṭipadā] ✓

Grammar idiom, adj + fem
Meaning path of practice leading to the end of material form
Construction rūpa + nirodha + gāmī + paṭipadā
Sanskrit rūpa + nirodha + gāmin + pratipada

Example

ayam'eva ariyo aṭṭh'aṅgiko maggo rūpanirodhagāminī paṭipadā, seyyath'idaṃ sammādiṭṭhi sammāsaṅkappo sammāvācā sammākamm'anto sammāājīvo sammāvāyāmo sammāsati sammāsamādhi.

SN 22.57 sattaṭṭhānasuttaṃ
rūpanirodhagāmī

adj. leading to the end of material form [rūpa + nirodha + gāmī] ✓

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning leading to the end of material form
Construction rūpa + nirodha + gāmī
Compound dutiyā tappurisa (rūpanirodhaṃ + gāmī)
Sanskrit rūpa + nirodha + gāmin

Example

ayam'eva ariyo aṭṭh'aṅgiko maggo rūpanirodhagāminī paṭipadā, seyyath'idaṃ sammādiṭṭhi sammāsaṅkappo sammāvācā sammākamm'anto sammāājīvo sammāvāyāmo sammāsati sammāsamādhi.

SN 22.57 sattaṭṭhānasuttaṃ
rūpanissita

adj. dependent on form [rūpa + nissita] ~

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning dependent on form
Construction rūpa + nissita
rūpapaccayā

ind. dependent on form [rūpa + paccayā] ~

Grammar ind, adv, comp
Meaning dependent on form
Construction rūpa + paccayā
rūpapariyesanā

fem. quest for forms; search for sights [rūpa + pariyesanā] ~

Grammar fem, act, comp
Meaning quest for forms; search for sights
Construction rūpa + pariyesanā
Commentary (SNa) rūpapariyesanā'ti pariḷāhe uppanne sandiṭṭhasambhatte gahetvā tassa rūpassa paṭilābh'atthāya pariyesanā.
rūpapariḷāha

masc. fever for forms; burning passion for sights; strong desire for visible objects [rūpa + pariḷāha] ✓

Grammar masc, comp
Meaning fever for forms; burning passion for sights; strong desire for visible objects
Construction rūpa + pariḷāha
Compound sattamī tappurisa (rūpesu + pariḷāha)
Commentary (MNa) rūpapariḷāhan'ti rūpaṃ ārabbha uppajjanapariḷāhaṃ.
Sanskrit rūpa + paridāha

Example

so aparena samayena rūpānaṃ'y'eva samudayañ'ca atthaṅ'gamañ'ca assādañ'ca ādīnavañ'ca nissaraṇañ'ca yathābhūtaṃ viditvā rūpataṇhaṃ pahāya rūpapariḷāhaṃ paṭivinodetvā vigatapipāso ajjhattaṃ vūpasantacitto vihareyya.

MN 75 māgaṇḍiyasuttaṃ
rūpapātubhāva

masc. appearance of a form; manifestation of an image [rūpa + pātubhāva] ✓

Grammar masc, abstr, comp
Meaning appearance of a form; manifestation of an image
Construction rūpa + pātubhāva
Compound chaṭṭhī tappurisa (rūpassa + pātubhāva)
Sanskrit rūpa + prādurbhāva

Example

seyyathā'pi, bhikkhave, puriso āgaccheyya lākhaṃ vā haliddiṃ vā nīlaṃ vā mañjiṭṭhaṃ vā ādāya. so evaṃ vadeyya, ahaṃ imasmiṃ ākāse rūpaṃ likhissāmi, rūpapātubhāvaṃ karissāmī'ti.

MN 21 kakacūpamasuttaṃ
rūpappaccaya

masc. suitable reason; appropriate cause; good reason [rūpa + paccaya] ~

Grammar masc, comp
Meaning suitable reason; appropriate cause; good reason
Construction rūpa + paccaya
Compound kammadhāraya (rūpa + paccaya)
Variant tathā rūpappaccaya, tathārūpappaccaya
Sanskrit rūpa + pratyaya
rūpappaṭisaṃyutta

adj. connected with form (realm meditation) [rūpa + paṭisaṃyutta] ✓

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning connected with form (realm meditation)
Construction rūpa + paṭisaṃyutta
Compound tatiyā tappurisa (rūpena + paṭisaṃyutta)
Antonym arūpappaṭisaṃyutta
Sanskrit rūpa + pratisaṃyukta

Example

katamo ca, bhikkhave, sāmiso vimokkho? rūpappaṭisaṃyutto vimokkho sāmiso vimokkho. katamo ca, bhikkhave, nirāmiso vimokkho? arūpappaṭisaṃyutto vimokkho nirāmiso vimokkho.

SN 36.31 nirāmisasuttaṃ
rūpappaṭisaṃvedī

adj. experiencing sight, conscious of the material form ✗
rūpappatiṭṭha

adj. with form as a support; establish on matter [rūpa + patiṭṭha] ✓

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning with form as a support; establish on matter
Construction rūpa + patiṭṭha
Compound sattamī tappurisa (rūpe + patiṭṭha)
Commentary (DNt) rūpaṃ sahakārīkāraṇabhāvena patiṭṭhā etassā'ti rūpappatiṭṭhaṃ.
Sanskrit rūpa + pratiṣṭha

Example

upayo, bhikkhave, avimutto, anupayo vimutto. rūp'upayaṃ vā, bhikkhave, viññāṇaṃ tiṭṭhamānaṃ tiṭṭheyya, rūp'ārammaṇaṃ rūpappatiṭṭhaṃ nand'ūpasecanaṃ vuddhiṃ virūḷhiṃ vepullaṃ āpajjeyya.

SN 22.53 upayasuttaṃ
rūpappamāṇa

adj. who measures by appearance; appraising by form; who judges on the basis of external looks [rūpa + pamāṇa] ✓

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning who measures by appearance; appraising by form; who judges on the basis of external looks
Construction rūpa + pamāṇa
Compound tatiyā tappurisa (rūpena + pamāṇa)
Commentary (ANa) pañca'me rūpe pamāṇaṃ gahetvā pasanno rūpappamāṇo nāma
Sanskrit rūpa + pramāṇa

Example

rūpappamāṇo rūpappasanno, ghosappamāṇo ghosappasanno, lūkhappamāṇo lūkhappasanno, dhammappamāṇo dhammappasanno. ime kho, bhikkhave, cattāro puggalā santo saṃvijjamānā lokasmin'ti.

AN 4.65 rūpasuttaṃ
rūpappasanna

adj. who has confidence in appearances; whose faith is based on form; pleased by form [rūpa + pasanna] ✓

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning who has confidence in appearances; whose faith is based on form; pleased by form
Construction rūpa + pasanna
Compound tatiyā tappurisa (rūpena + pasanna)
Commentary (ANa) pañca'me rūpe pamāṇaṃ gahetvā pasanno rūpappamāṇo nāma. rūpappasanno'ti tass'eva atthavacanaṃ.
Sanskrit rūpa + prasanna

Example

rūpappamāṇo rūpappasanno, ghosappamāṇo ghosappasanno, lūkhappamāṇo lūkhappasanno, dhammappamāṇo dhammappasanno. ime kho, bhikkhave, cattāro puggalā santo saṃvijjamānā lokasmin'ti.

AN 4.65 rūpasuttaṃ
rūpabandhanabaddha

adj. imprisoned by form; held captive by material form [rūpa + bandhanabaddha] ~

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning imprisoned by form; held captive by material form
Construction rūpa + bandhanabaddha
rūpabala

nt. power of beauty; lit. power of form [rūpa + bala] ~

Grammar nt, comp
Meaning power of beauty; lit. power of form
Construction rūpa + bala
Commentary (SNa) rūpasampatti rūpabalaṃ
rūpabalahetu

ind. because of the power of beauty [rūpabala + hetu] ~

Grammar ind, adv, comp
Meaning because of the power of beauty
Construction rūpabala + hetu
rūpabhava

masc. existence in the realm of form [rūpa + bhava] ✓

Grammar masc, abstr, comp
Meaning existence in the realm of form
Construction rūpa + bhava
Compound kammadhāraya (rūpa + bhava)
Sanskrit rūpa + bhava

Examples

kati pan'āvuso, bhavā'ti? tayo'me, āvuso, bhavā, kāmabhavo, rūpabhavo, arūpabhavo'ti.

MN 43 mahāvedallasuttaṃ

rūpadhātuvepakkañ'ca, ānanda, kammaṃ n'ābhavissa, api nu kho rūpabhavo paññāyethāti? no h'etaṃ bhante

AN 3.66 kesamuttisuttaṃ
rūpabhoga

masc. enjoyment of forms; pleasure in sights [rūpa + bhoga] ~

Grammar masc, comp
Meaning enjoyment of forms; pleasure in sights
Construction rūpa + bhoga
rūpamaya

adj. made from sights, consists of material forms ✗
rūpayati

pr. is visibly formed [√rūp] ✗
rūparata 1

adj. taking pleasure in forms; pleased by sights [rūpa + rata] ✓

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning taking pleasure in forms; pleased by sights
Construction rūpa + rata
Compound sattamī tappurisa (rūpesu + rata)
Commentary (MNa) rūpe ratan'ti rūparataṃ.
Sanskrit rūpa + rata

Example

cakkhuṃ kho, māgaṇḍiya, rūp'ārāmaṃ rūparataṃ rūpasammuditaṃ. taṃ tathāgatassa dantaṃ guttaṃ rakkhitaṃ saṃvutaṃ, tassa ca saṃvarāya dhammaṃ deseti.

MN 75 māgaṇḍiyasuttaṃ
rūparata 2

adj. taking pleasure in material form; delighting in materiality [rūpa + rata] ~

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning taking pleasure in material form; delighting in materiality
Construction rūpa + rata
rūparasa

masc. taste for forms; pleasure in sights [rūpa + rasa] ~

Grammar masc, comp
Meaning taste for forms; pleasure in sights
Construction rūpa + rasa
Commentary (SNt) arasarūpo'ti ācārarahitasabhāvo. rūpassa assādanavasena uppajjanakasukhadhammā rūparasā. esa nayo saddaras'ādīsu.
rūparāga 1

masc. passion for material existence; desire for worldly existence [rūpa + rāga] ✓

Grammar masc, comp
Meaning passion for material existence; desire for worldly existence
Construction rūpa + rāga
Compound sattamī tappurisa (rūpe + rāga)
Antonym arūparāga
Sanskrit rūparāga

Examples

evam'eva kho, bhikkhave, aniccasaññā bhāvitā bahulīkatā sabbaṃ kāmarāgaṃ pariyādiyati sabbaṃ rūparāgaṃ pariyādiyati sabbaṃ bhavarāgaṃ pariyādiyati sabbaṃ avijjaṃ pariyādiyati sabbaṃ asmimānaṃ samūhanati.

SN 22.102 aniccasaññāsuttaṃ

rūparāgo, arūparāgo, māno, uddhaccaṃ, avijjā, imāni pañc'uddham'bhāgiyāni saṃyojanāni.

AN 10.13 saṃyojanasuttaṃ
rūparāga 2

masc. craving for material form; desire for sights [rūpa + rāga] ✓

Grammar masc, comp
Meaning craving for material form; desire for sights
Construction rūpa + rāga
Commentary (SNa) rūparāgappaṭisaṃvedī'ti kilesassa atthibhāven'eva pana rūparāgaṃ paṭisaṃviditaṃ karoti nāma, tasmā rūparāgappaṭisaṃvedī'ti vuccati.
Sanskrit rūparāga

Example

idha pana, upavāṇa, bhikkhu cakkhunā rūpaṃ disvā rūpappaṭisaṃvedī ca hoti rūparāgappaṭisaṃvedī ca.

SN 35.70 upavāṇasandiṭṭhikasuttaṃ
rūparāgappaṭisaṃvedī

adj. experiencing greed for the sight, experiencing desire for the material form ✗
rūparūpa

nt. concrete form, physical form ✗
rūpalābha

masc. acquiring forms; obtaining sights [rūpa + lābha] ~

Grammar masc, comp
Meaning acquiring forms; obtaining sights
Construction rūpa + lābha
Commentary (SNa) rūpalābho'ti pariyesitvā laddhaṃ saha taṇhāya ārammaṇaṃ rūpalābho'ti vuttaṃ.
rūpavant 1

adj. material; physical; having material form; possessing form; lit. having form quality [√rūp + a + vant] ✓

Grammar adj, from rūpa
Meaning material; physical; having material form; possessing form; lit. having form quality
Root Family √rūp
Root √rūp･8 *e (form, produce)
Construction √rūp + a + vant
rūpa + vant
Derivative taddhita (vant)
Synonym āmisa, oḷārika, kabaḷiṅkāra, kabaḷiṃkāra, kabaḷīkāra, kavaḷīkāra, rūpī
Sanskrit rūpavat
Sanskrit Root √rūp 10 (form)

Example

rūpaṃ attato samanupassati, rūpavantaṃ vā attānaṃ, attani vā rūpaṃ, rūpasmiṃ vā attānaṃ, ahaṃ rūpaṃ, mama rūpan'ti pariyuṭṭhaṭṭhāyī hoti.

SN 22.1 nakulapitusuttaṃ
rūpavant 2

adj. handsome [√rūp] ✗
rūpavicāra

masc. pondering about form [rūpa + vicāra] ✓

Grammar masc, comp
Meaning pondering about form
Construction rūpa + vicāra
Compound dutiyā tappurisa (rūpaṃ + vicāra)
Sanskrit rūpa + vicāra

Example

rūpavicāro loke ... saddavicāro loke ... gandhavicāro loke ... rasavicāro loke ... phoṭṭhabbavicāro loke ... dhammavicāro loke piyarūpaṃ sātarūpaṃ, etth'esā taṇhā uppajjamānā uppajjati, ettha nivisamānā nivisati. idaṃ vuccati, bhikkhave, dukkhasamudayaṃ ariyasaccaṃ.

MN 10 mahāsatipaṭṭhānasuttaṃ
rūpavitakka

masc. thinking about form; thought about shapes [rūpa + vitakka] ✓

Grammar masc, comp
Meaning thinking about form; thought about shapes
Construction rūpa + vitakka
Compound dutiyā tappurisa (rūpaṃ + vitakka)
Sanskrit rūpa + vitarka

Example

rūpavitakko loke ... saddavitakko loke ... gandhavitakko loke ... rasavitakko loke ... phoṭṭhabbavitakko loke ... dhammavitakko loke piyarūpaṃ sātarūpaṃ, etth'esā taṇhā uppajjamānā uppajjati, ettha nivisamānā nivisati.

MN 10 mahāsatipaṭṭhānasuttaṃ
rūpavipariṇāmaññathābhāva

masc. change and alteration of physical form [rūpa + vipariṇāma + aññathā + bhāva] ✓

Grammar masc, abstr, comp
Meaning change and alteration of physical form
Construction rūpa + vipariṇāma + aññathā + bhāva
Compound chaṭṭhī tappurisa (rūpassa + vipariṇāmaññathābhāva)
Sanskrit rūpa + vipariṇāma + anyathā + bhāva

Example

tassa rūpavipariṇām'aññathābhāvā uppajjanti sokaparidevadukkhadomanass'upāyāsā.

SN 22.1 nakulapitusuttaṃ
rūpavipariṇāmavirāganirodha

masc. change, fading and ending of form; alteration, disappearance and cessation of sights [rūpa + vipariṇāmavirāganirodha] ~

Grammar masc, comp
Meaning change, fading and ending of form; alteration, disappearance and cessation of sights
Construction rūpa + vipariṇāmavirāganirodha
rūpavipariṇāmānuparivattaja

adj. born from rolling around after the change of form [rūpa + vipariṇāma + anuparivatta + ja] ~

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning born from rolling around after the change of form
Construction rūpa + vipariṇāma + anuparivatta + ja
Variant rūpavipariṇāmānuparivattija
rūpavipariṇāmānuparivattija

adj. born from rolling around after the change of form [rūpavipariṇāmānuparivattī + ja] ~

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning born from rolling around after the change of form
Construction rūpavipariṇāmānuparivattī + ja
Variant rūpavipariṇāmānuparivattaja
Commentary (SNa) vipariṇām'ānuparivattijā'ti vipariṇāmassa anuparivattito vipariṇām'ārammaṇacittato jātā.
rūpavipariṇāmānuparivattī

adj. rolling around after the change of form [rūpa + vipariṇāma + anuparivattī] ~

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning rolling around after the change of form
Construction rūpa + vipariṇāma + anuparivattī
Commentary (MNa) rūpavipariṇāmānuparivattī'ti mama rūpaṃ vipariṇatan'ti vā, yaṃ ahu, taṃ vata me n'atthī'ti vā ādinā nayena kammaviññāṇaṃ rūpassa bhed'ānuparivatti hoti.
Sanskrit rūpa + vipariṇāma + anuparivartin
rūpasaṅkappa

masc. thought about forms; conception of sights [rūpa + saṅkappa] ~

Grammar masc, comp
Meaning thought about forms; conception of sights
Construction rūpa + saṅkappa
Commentary (SNa) rūpasaṅkappo'ti tasmiṃ'y'eva ārammaṇe tīhi cittehi sampayuttasaṅkappo.
rūpasaṅkhayavimutta

adj. freed by the exhaustion of form [rūpa + saṅkhaya + vimutta] ~

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning freed by the exhaustion of form
Construction rūpa + saṅkhaya + vimutta
Notes saṅkhāvimutta is the preferable reading
rūpasaṅkhāyavimutta

adj. free from classification in terms of form [rūpa + saṅkhāya + vimutta] ~

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning free from classification in terms of form
Construction rūpa + saṅkhāya + vimutta
rūpasaṅkhāvimutta

adj. freed from classification according to form [rūpa + saṅkhā + vimutta] ~

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning freed from classification according to form
Construction rūpa + saṅkhā + vimutta
rūpasaṅgaha

masc. classification of form ✗
rūpasañcetanā

fem. thoughts about sights; intention regarding forms [rūpa + sañcetanā] ✓

Grammar fem, comp
Meaning thoughts about sights; intention regarding forms
Construction rūpa + sañcetanā
Compound kammadhāraya (rūpa + sañcetanā)
Sanskrit rūpa + saṃcetanā

Example

katame ca, bhikkhave, saṅkhārā? cha'y'ime, bhikkhave, cetanākāyā, rūpasañcetanā, saddasañcetanā, gandhasañcetanā, rasasañcetanā, phoṭṭhabbasañcetanā, dhammasañcetanā.

SN 22.57 sattaṭṭhānasuttaṃ
rūpasañcetanāsutta

nt. Saṃyutta Nikāya 25.7 (SN25.7) ✗
rūpasaññā

fem. recognition of form; perception of matter; concept of materiality; (comm) existence in the realm of form [rūpa + saññā] ✓

Grammar fem, abstr, comp
Meaning recognition of form; perception of matter; concept of materiality; (comm) existence in the realm of form
Construction rūpa + saññā
Compound chaṭṭhī tappurisa (rūpānaṃ + saññā)
Commentary (SNa) paṭighaṃ rūpasaññā cā'ti ettha paṭighasaññāvasena kāmabhavo gahito, rūpasaññāvasena rūpabhavo. tesu dvīsu gahitesu arūpabhavo gahito'va hoti bhavasaṅkhepenā'ti.
Sanskrit rūpa + saṃjñā

Examples

idha mayaṃ, bhante, yāva'd'eva ākaṅkhāma sabbaso rūpasaññānaṃ samatikkamā paṭighasaññānaṃ atthaṅ'gamā nānattasaññānaṃ amanasikārā, ananto ākāso'ti ākās'ānañc'āyatanaṃ upasampajja viharāma

MN 31 cūḷagosiṅgasuttaṃ

yattha nāmañ'ca rūpañ'ca,
asesaṃ uparujjhati,
paṭighaṃ rūpasaññā ca,
etth'esā chijjate jaṭā'ti.

SN 1.23 jaṭāsuttaṃ
rūpasaññāsutta

nt. Saṃyutta Nikāya 25.6 (SN25.6) ✗
rūpasaññī

adj. who is percipient of the body; who is conscious of materiality [rūpa + saññī] ✓

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning who is percipient of the body; who is conscious of materiality
Construction rūpa + saññī
Compound chaṭṭhī tappurisa (rūpassa + saññī)
Antonym arūpasaññī
Sanskrit rūpa + saṃjñin

Examples

aṭṭh'imāni, bhikkhave, abhibh'āyatanāni. katamāni aṭṭha? ajjhattaṃ rūpasaññī eko bahiddhā rūpāni passati parittāni suvaṇṇadubbaṇṇāni, tāni abhibhuyya jānāmi passāmī'ti, evaṃsaññī hoti. idaṃ paṭhamaṃ abhibh'āyatanaṃ.

AN 10.29 paṭhamakosalasuttaṃ

vibhūtarūpasaññissa,
sabbakāyappahāyino,
ajjhattañ'ca bahiddhā ca,
n'atthi kiñcī'ti passato,
ñāṇaṃ sakk'ānupucchāmi,
kathaṃ neyyo tathāvidho.

SNP 69 posāla māṇava pucchā
pārāyanavaggo 14
rūpasadisa

adj. similar in form; like the body [rūpa + sadisa] ~

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning similar in form; like the body
Construction rūpa + sadisa
rūpasaddagandharasaphoṭṭhabbāni

nt. sights, sounds, smells, tastes and touches [rūpa + sadda + gandha + rasa + phoṭṭhabba + āni] ~

Grammar nt pl, comp
Meaning sights, sounds, smells, tastes and touches
Construction rūpa + sadda + gandha + rasa + phoṭṭhabba + āni
rūpasaddagandharasaphoṭṭhabba + āni
rūpasamudaya

masc. source of material form; arising of the body [rūpa + samudaya] ✓

Grammar masc, comp
Meaning source of material form; arising of the body
Construction rūpa + samudaya
Compound chaṭṭhī tappurisa (rūpassa + samudaya)
Antonym rūpanirodha
Sanskrit rūpa + samudaya

Example

āhārasamudayā rūpasamudayo, āhāranirodhā rūpanirodho.

adj. generated by sights; produced by forms [rūpa + sambhava] ~

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning generated by sights; produced by forms
Construction rūpa + sambhava
Commentary (THa) tassa vaḍḍhanti vedanā, anekā rūpasambhavā'ti tassa evarūpassa puggalassa rūpasambhavā rūp'ārammaṇā sukh'ādibhedena anekā vedanā kiles'uppattihetubhūtā vaḍḍhanti.
rūpasammudita 1

adj. pleased with forms; enjoying sights; happy with shapes [rūpa + sammudita] ✓

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning pleased with forms; enjoying sights; happy with shapes
Construction rūpa + sammudita
Compound sattamī tappurisa (rūpesu + sammudita)
Commentary (MNa) rūpena cakkhu āmoditaṃ pamoditan'ti rūpasamuditaṃ.
Sanskrit rūpa + sumudita

Example

cakkhuṃ kho, māgaṇḍiya, rūp'ārāmaṃ rūparataṃ rūpasammuditaṃ. taṃ tathāgatassa dantaṃ guttaṃ rakkhitaṃ saṃvutaṃ, tassa ca saṃvarāya dhammaṃ deseti.

rūpasaṃyojanātiga

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning overcoming the fetter of form; surmounting the material bond; going beyond attachment to matter

Sanskrit rupa + saṃyojana + atiga

Example

virato kāmasaññāya,
rūpasaṃyojan'ātigo,
nandīrāgaparikkhīṇo,
so gambhīre na sīdatī'ti.

MN 137 saḷāyatanavibhaṅgasuttaṃ
rūpārammaṇa 1

adj. based on form; founded on the material [rūpa + ārammaṇa] ✓

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning based on form; founded on the material
Construction rūpa + ārammaṇa
Compound kammadhāraya (rūpa + ārammaṇa)
Antonym arūpārammaṇa
Commentary (DNa) rūp'ārammaṇan'ti rūpakkhandhagocaraṃ rūpapatiṭṭhitaṃ hutvā. (ANa) rūp'ārammaṇan'ti rūp'āvacaracatutthajjhān'ārammaṇaṃ, yaṃkiñci rūpaṃ ārabbha uppajjanakaṃ vā.
Sanskrit rūpa + ālambana

Example

upayo, bhikkhave, avimutto, anupayo vimutto. rūp'upayaṃ vā, bhikkhave, viññāṇaṃ tiṭṭhamānaṃ tiṭṭheyya, rūp'ārammaṇaṃ rūpappatiṭṭhaṃ nand'ūpasecanaṃ vuddhiṃ virūḷhiṃ vepullaṃ āpajjeyya.

rūpinī

fem. beautiful woman [√rūp] ✗
rūpiya 1

nt. silver; silver coin; money; cash [√rūp + a + iya] ✓

Grammar nt, from rūpa
Meaning silver; silver coin; money; cash
Root Family √rūp
Root √rūp･8 *e (form, produce)
Construction √rūp + a + iya
rūpa + iya
Derivative taddhita (iya)
Synonym mūla
Commentary (VIN 1.4.2.9) rūpiyaṃ nāma satthuvaṇṇo kahāpaṇo, lohamāsako, dārumāsako, jatumāsako ye vohāraṃ gacchanti.
Sanskrit rūpya
Sanskrit Root √rūp 10 (form)

Examples

yo pana bhikkhu nānappakārakaṃ rūpiyasaṃvohāraṃ samāpajjeyya, nissaggiyaṃ pācittiyaṃ.

VIN PAT NP 19 rūpiyasaṃvohārasikkhāpadaṃ

kusāvatiyā, ānanda, rājadhāniyā catunnaṃ vaṇṇānaṃ dvārāni ahesuṃ. ekaṃ dvāraṃ sovaṇṇamayaṃ, ekaṃ rūpiyamayaṃ, ekaṃ veḷuriyamayaṃ, ekaṃ phalikamayaṃ.

DN 2.4 mahāsudassanasuttaṃ

tesaṃ kho pana, bhikkhu, caturāsītiyā pallaṅkasahassānaṃ eko'y'eva so pallaṅko hoti yam'ahaṃ tena samayena paribhuñjāmi, dantamayo vā sāramayo vā sovaṇṇamayo vā rūpiyamayo vā.

Meaning rule about money; Nissaggiya 18

rūpī

adj. material; physical; having form [√rūp + a + ī] ✓

Grammar adj, from rūpa
Meaning material; physical; having form
Root Family √rūp
Root √rūp･8 *e (form, produce)
Construction √rūp + a + ī
rūpa + ī
Derivative taddhita (ī)
Antonym arūpī
Synonym āmisa, oḷārika, kabaḷiṅkāra, kabaḷiṃkāra, kabaḷīkāra, kavaḷīkāra, rūpavant
Sanskrit rūpin
Sanskrit Root √rūp 10 (form)

Examples

saññā nu kho, bhante, purisassa attā, udāhu aññā saññā añño attā'ti? kaṃ pana tvaṃ, poṭṭhapāda, attānaṃ paccesī'ti? oḷārikaṃ kho ahaṃ, bhante, attānaṃ paccemi rūpiṃ cātumahābhūtikaṃ kabaḷīkār'āhārabhakkhan'ti.

DN 9.4 poṭṭhapādasuttaṃ, saññāattakathā

ayaṃ kho me kāyo rūpī cātumahābhūtiko mātā-pettika-sambhavo odana-kummāsa-upacayo anicc'ucchādana-parimaddana-bhedana-viddhaṃsana-dhammo, idañ'ca pana me viññāṇaṃ ettha sitaṃ ettha paṭibaddhan'ti

Compound sattamī tappurisa (rūpesu + upaya)
Variant rūpūpāya, rūpupāya
Commentary (DNa) rūp'ūpāyan'ti rūpaṃ upagataṃ hutvā. pañcavokārabhavasmiñ'hi abhisaṅkhāraviññāṇaṃ rūpakkhandhaṃ nissāya tiṭṭhati. taṃ sandhāy'etaṃ vuttaṃ. (NIDD1a) rūp'ūpayan'ti taṇhādiṭṭh'ūpayavasena rūpaṃ upagantvā ārammaṇaṃ katvā.
Sanskrit rūpa + upāya

Example

upayo, bhikkhave, avimutto, anupayo vimutto. rūp'upayaṃ vā, bhikkhave, viññāṇaṃ tiṭṭhamānaṃ tiṭṭheyya, rūp'ārammaṇaṃ rūpappatiṭṭhaṃ nand'ūpasecanaṃ vuddhiṃ virūḷhiṃ vepullaṃ āpajjeyya.

SN 22.53 upayasuttaṃ
rūpupādānakkhandha

masc. accumulation of matter that is clung to [rūpa + upādāna + khandha] ✓

Grammar masc, comp
Meaning accumulation of matter that is clung to
Construction rūpa + upādāna + khandha
Compound chaṭṭhī tappurisa (rūpassa + upādānakkhandha)
Variant rūpūpādānakkhandha
Sanskrit rūpa + upādāna + skandha

Examples

katame c'āvuso, pañc'upādānakkhandhā? seyyath'idaṃ, rūp'upādānakkhandho, vedan'upādānakkhandho, saññ'upādānakkhandho, saṅkhār'upādānakkhandho, viññāṇ'upādānakkhandho.

MN 28 mahāhatthipadopamasuttaṃ

katamo c'āvuso, rūp'upādānakkhandho? cattāri ca mahābhūtāni, catunnañ'ca mahābhūtānaṃ upādāya rūpaṃ.

MN 28 mahāhatthipadopamasuttaṃ
rūpūpaga

adj. in physical form; with material body; lit. experiencing form [rūpa + upaga] ✓

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning in physical form; with material body; lit. experiencing form
Construction rūpa + upaga
Compound dutiyā tappurisa (rūpaṃ + upaga)
Antonym arūpaṭṭhāyī
Sanskrit rūpa + upaga

Example

ye ca rūp'ūpagā sattā,
ye ca arūpaṭṭhāyino,
nirodhaṃ appajānantā,
āgantāro punabbhavaṃ.

SNP 38 dvayatānupassanāsuttaṃ

rūpūpāya

adj. attached to form; attracted to form; engaged with matter; lit. approaching form [rūpa + upāya] ~

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning attached to form; attracted to form; engaged with matter; lit. approaching form
Construction rūpa + upāya
Variant rūpupaya, rūpupāya
Commentary (DNa) rūp'ūpāyan'ti rūpaṃ upagataṃ hutvā. pañcavokārabhavasmiñ'hi abhisaṅkhāraviññāṇaṃ rūpakkhandhaṃ nissāya tiṭṭhati. taṃ sandhāy'etaṃ vuttaṃ. (NIDD1a) rūp'ūpayan'ti taṇhādiṭṭh'ūpayavasena rūpaṃ upagantvā ārammaṇaṃ katvā.
Sanskrit rūpa + upāya
rūhati 1

pr. grows; ascends; increases [√ruh + *a + ti] ✓

Grammar pr, intrans
Meaning grows; ascends; increases
Root Family √ruh
Root √ruh･1 *a (ascend, grow)
Base √ruh + *a > rūha
Construction rūha + ti
Phonetic Change with metrically lengthened ū
Synonym pavaḍḍhati, phātikaroti, brūheti, vaḍḍhati, vaddhati
Sanskrit rohati
Sanskrit Root √ruh 1 (ascend)

Examples

akaronto'pi ce pāpaṃ,
karontam'upasevati,
saṅkiyo hoti pāpasmiṃ,
avaṇṇo c'assa rūhati.

ITI 76 sukhapatthanāsuttaṃ

yathā'pi mūle anupaddave daḷhe,
chinno'pi rukkho puna'r'eva rūhati,
evam'pi taṇh'ānusaye anūhate,
nibbattatī dukkham'idaṃ punappunaṃ.

DHP 338 taṇhāvaggo
rūhati 2

pr. (of a speech) is accepted (in court) [√ruh + *a + ti] ~

Meaning (of a speech) is accepted (in court)

Root √ruh･1 *a (ascend, grow)
Base √ruh + *a > rūha
Construction rūha + ti
Sanskrit rohati
Sanskrit Root √ruh 1 (ascend)
rūhati 3

pr. heals (a wound) [√ruh] ✗
rūhana

nt. growing, ascending, rising [√ruh] ✗
rūhi

aor. grew, ascended, healed (a wound) [√ruh] ✗
rūḷha

pp. grown; ascended [√ruh + ta] ✓

Grammar pp of rūhati
Meaning grown; ascended
Root Family √ruh
Root √ruh･1 a (ascend, grow)
Construction √ruh + ta > rūḍha > rūḷha
Derivative kita (ta)
Phonetic Change u > ū
t > ḍ > ḷ
Sanskrit rūḍha
Sanskrit Root √ruh 1 (ascend)

Example

andhakamakasā na vijjare,
kacche rūḷhatiṇe caranti gāvo,
vuṭṭhim'pi saheyyum'āgataṃ,
atha ce patthayasī pavassa deva.

uragavaggo 2
re

ind. (expressing contempt) hey!; oh! [are] ✓

Grammar ind, excl, derog
Meaning (expressing contempt) hey!; oh!
Construction are > (a)re
Phonetic Change are > re (contraction)
Synonym he
Sanskrit re

Examples

ajja't'agge te, āvuso, samaṇ'uddesa na c'eva so bhagavā satthā apadisitabbo, yam'pi c'aññe samaṇ'uddesā labhanti bhikkhūhi saddhiṃ dirattatirattaṃ sahaseyyaṃ, sā'pi te n'atthi, cara'pi re, vinassā'ti.

VIN PAT PC 70 kaṇṭakasikkhāpadaṃ

aho vata re amhākaṃ paṇḍitakā, aho vata re amhākaṃ bahussutakā, aho vata re amhākaṃ tevijjakā

revata

masc. name of a monk; great disciple of the Buddha; foremost disciple in forest dwelling ✓

Grammar masc
Meaning name of a monk; great disciple of the Buddha; foremost disciple in forest dwelling
Commentary (AN 1.203) etadaggaṃ, bhikkhave, mama sāvakānaṃ bhikkhūnaṃ āraññakānaṃ yadidaṃ revato khadiravaniyo
Sanskrit revata

Examples

āyasmatā ca mahācundena āyasmatā ca anuruddhena āyasmatā ca revatena āyasmatā ca ānandena, aññehi ca abhiññātehi abhiññātehi therehi sāvakehi saddhiṃ.

MN 118 ānāpānassatisuttaṃ

evaṃ me sutaṃ, ekaṃ samayaṃ bhagavā gosiṅgasālavanadāye viharati sambahulehi abhiññātehi abhiññātehi therehi sāvakehi saddhiṃ ... āyasmatā ca revatena āyasmatā ca ānandena, aññehi ca abhiññātehi abhiññātehi therehi sāvakehi saddhiṃ.

MN 32 mahāgosiṅgasuttaṃ
revatīpetavatthu

nt. Petavatthu 39 (PV 39) ✗
revatīvimānavatthu

nt. Vimānavatthu 52 (VV 52) ✗
roga

masc. disease; illness; sickness [√ruj + *a] ✓

Grammar masc, from rujati
Meaning disease; illness; sickness
Root Family √ruj
Root √ruj･1 a (hurt, be painful)
Construction √ruj > rog + *a
Derivative kita (*a)
Phonetic Change u > o
j > g
Antonym aroga
Synonym ātaṅka, ābādha, gada, gilānabhāva, byādhi, vyādhi
Commentary (NIDD1a) rujatī'ti rogo.
Sanskrit roga, rujā
Sanskrit Root √ruj 6, 10 (break)

Examples

yathā iṇaṃ yathā rogaṃ yathā bandhan'āgāraṃ yathā dāsabyaṃ yathā kantār'addhānamaggaṃ

MN 39 mahāassapurasuttaṃ

yo'pi c'ettha katakusalo hoti, tam'pi ñātirogabhogabyasan'ādīnaṃ aññatarena byasanena samannāgataṃ disvā vā sutvā vā tesaṃ abhāve'pi vaṭṭadukkhaṃ anatikkantattā, dukkhito'va ayan'ti.

VISM 1.9.2 karuṇābhāvanākathā
rogakāla

masc. time of illness [roga + kāla] ~

Grammar masc, comp
Meaning time of illness
Construction roga + kāla
rogajāta

masc. type of disease; kind of illness [roga + jāta] ✓

Grammar masc, comp
Meaning type of disease; kind of illness
Construction roga + jāta
Compound kammadhāraya (roga + jāta)
Sanskrit rujā + jāta

Example

eso kho, bhikkhave, jarasiṅgālo ukkaṇḍakena nāma rogajātena phuṭṭho. so yena yena icchati tena tena gacchati. yattha yattha icchati tattha tattha tiṭṭhati.

SN 20.11 siṅgālasuttaṃ
rogajāti

fem. type of disease [roga + jāti] ✓

Grammar fem, comp
Meaning type of disease
Construction roga + jāti
Commentary (VINa) setaṭṭhikā nāma rogajātī'ti eko pāṇako nāḷimajjhagataṃ kaṇḍaṃ vijjhati, yena viddhattā nikkhantam'pi sālisīsaṃ khīraṃ gahetuṃ na sakkoti.
Sanskrit roga, rujā + jāti

Example

seyyathāpi, ānanda, sampanne sālikkhette set'aṭṭhikā nāma rogajāti nipatati, evaṃ taṃ sālikkhettaṃ na ciraṭṭhitikaṃ hoti, evam'evaṃ kho, ānanda, yasmiṃ dhammavinaye labhati mātugāmo agārasmā anagāriyaṃ pabbajjaṃ, na taṃ brahmacariyaṃ ciraṭṭhitikaṃ hoti.

AN 8.51 gotamīsuttaṃ
rogato

ind. as disease; as illness [√ruj + *a + to] ✓

Grammar ind, adv, abl sg of roga
Meaning as disease; as illness
Root Family √ruj
Root √ruj･1 a (hurt, be painful)
Construction √ruj > rog + *a + to
roga + to
Derivative taddhita (to)
Phonetic Change u > o
j > g
Synonym ābādhato
Commentary (MNa) ābādh'aṭṭhena rogato (ANa) rujjan'ākārena rogato
Sanskrit rujāyāḥ
Sanskrit Root √ruj 6, 10 (break)

Example

so yadeva tattha hoti rūpagataṃ vedanāgataṃ saññāgataṃ saṅkhāragataṃ viññāṇagataṃ, te dhamme aniccato dukkhato rogato gaṇḍato sallato aghato ābādhato parato palokato suññato anattato samanupassati.

AN 9.36 jhānasuttaṃ
roganiḍḍa

adj. seat of disease ✗
roganiḍḍha

nt. abode of disease; nest of illness [roga + niḍḍha] ✓

Grammar nt, comp
Meaning abode of disease; nest of illness
Construction roga + niḍḍha
Compound chaṭṭhī tappurisa (rogassa + niḍḍha)
Variant roganīḷa, roganiddha
Commentary (DHPa) tañ'ca kho sabbarogānaṃ nivāsaṭṭhān'aṭṭhena roganīḷaṃ, (ITIa) akkhirog'ādīnaṃ anekesaṃ rogānaṃ nīḷaṃ kulāvakan'ti roganīḷaṃ.
Sanskrit roga, rujā + nīḍa

Example

parijiṇṇam'idaṃ rūpaṃ,
roganiḍḍhaṃ pabhaṅguraṃ,
bhijjati pūtisandeho,
maraṇ'antañ'hi jīvitaṃ.

DHP11 jarāvaggo
roganīḷa

nt. abode of disease; nest of illness [roga + nīḷa] ✓

Grammar nt, comp
Meaning abode of disease; nest of illness
Construction roga + nīḷa
Compound chaṭṭhī tappurisa (rogassa + nīḷa)

Commentary (ITIa) akkhirog'ādīnaṃ anekesaṃ rogānaṃ nīḷaṃ kulāvakan'ti roganīḷaṃ.

roganīḷaṃ pabhaṅguraṃ,
bhijjati pūtisandeho,
maraṇ'antañ'hi jīvitaṃ.

DHP 148 jarāvaggo

jātaṃ bhūtaṃ samuppannaṃ,
kataṃ saṅkhatam'addhuvaṃ,
jarāmaraṇasaṅghāṭaṃ,
roganīḷaṃ pabhaṅguraṃ.

ITI 43 ajātasuttaṃ
rogabyasana

nt. health crisis; loss of health; lit. disease disaster [roga + byasana] ✓

Grammar nt, comp
Meaning health crisis; loss of health; lit. disease disaster
Construction roga + byasana

Commentary (ANa) rogabyasane pana rogo'y'eva ārogyavināsanato byasanaṃ rogabyasanaṃ.
Sanskrit rujā + vyasana

Example

idha, bhikkhave, ekacco ñātibyasanena vā phuṭṭho samāno, bhogabyasanena vā phuṭṭho samāno, rogabyasanena vā phuṭṭho samāno na iti paṭisañcikkhati, tathābhūto kho ayaṃ lokasannivāso tathābhūto ayaṃ attabhāvapaṭilābho

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning like a disease; like an illness; lit. become disease
Construction roga + bhūta
Compound kammadhāraya (roga + bhūta)
Commentary (MNa) rogo'va bhūto'ti rogabhūto. sesapadesu'pi es'eva nayo.
Sanskrit rujā + bhūta

Example

ayaṃ kho pana, māgaṇḍiya, kāyo rogabhūto gaṇḍabhūto sallabhūto aghabhūto ābādhabhūto, so tvaṃ imaṃ kāyaṃ rogabhūtaṃ gaṇḍabhūtaṃ sallabhūtaṃ aghabhūtaṃ ābādhabhūtaṃ, idan'taṃ, bho gotama, ārogyaṃ, idan'taṃ nibbānan'ti vadesi.

brāhmaṇā, bhante, pacchābhūmakā kamaṇḍalukā sevālamālikā aggiparicārikā udak'orohakā soceyyāni paññapenti, tes'āhaṃ soceyyāni rocemī'ti

sv'āhaṃ abbūḷhasallo'smi,
sītibhūto'smi nibbuto,
na socāmi na rodāmi,
vata sutvāna māṇavāti.

VV 83 maṭṭhakuṇḍalī vimānavatthu

Meaning rule about crying
Construction rodana + sikkhāpada
rodanta

prp. crying; weeping; wailing [√rud + *a + nta] ✓

Grammar prp of rodati, intrans
Meaning crying; weeping; wailing
Root Family √rud
Root √rud･1 *a (cry)
Base √rud + *a > roda
Construction roda + nta

Phonetic Change u > o
Synonym paridevamāna, rudanta, rudamāna
Sanskrit rudat
Sanskrit Root √rud 2 (weep)

Example

na taṃ kammaṃ kataṃ sādhu,
yaṃ katvā anutappati,
yassa assumukho rodaṃ,
vipākaṃ paṭisevati.

DHP 67 bālavaggo
rodamāna

prp. crying, lamenting [√rud] ✗
rodāpeti

pr. causes to cry; makes weep [√rud] ✗
rodi

aor. cried, lamented [√rud] ✗
rodita 1

pp. cried; lamented; wept; wailed [√rud + *a + ita] ~

Grammar pp of rodati
Meaning cried; lamented; wept; wailed
Root Family √rud
Root √rud･1 *a (cry)
Base √rud + *a > roda
Construction roda + ita
Derivative kita (ita)
Sanskrit rudita
Sanskrit Root √rud 2 (weep)
rodita 2

nt. crying; lamenting; weeping; wailing; lit. cried [√rud + *a + ita] ~

Grammar nt, pp of rodati
Meaning crying; lamenting; weeping; wailing; lit. cried
Root Family √rud
Root √rud･1 *a (cry)
Base √rud + *a > roda
Construction roda + ita
Derivative kita (ita)
Commentary (JAa) roditaṃ mogham'āhu santo'ti, buddh'ādayo pana paṇḍitā roditaṃ moghan'ti vadanti.
Sanskrit rudita
Sanskrit Root √rud 2 (weep)
roditamatta

adj. mere crying; just wailing [rodita + matta] ~

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning mere crying; just wailing
Construction rodita + matta
Commentary (MNa) roditamattā'ti jighacchāpipāsāparetassa pana roditamattaṃ hoti. tam'pi kilesasahagatacitten'eva.
Sanskrit rudita + mātra
rodituṃ

inf. (+acc) to cry, to lament [√rud] ✗
roditvā

abs. having cried, having lamented [√rud] ✗
rodha

masc. obstruction; obstacle; hazard [√rudh + *a] ✓

Grammar masc, from rundhati
Meaning obstruction; obstacle; hazard
Root Family √rudh
Root √rudh･2 ṃa (obstruct)
Construction √rudh > rodh + *a
Derivative kita (*a)
Phonetic Change u > o
Synonym nīvaraṇa, paripantha, palipatha
Variant gedha
Sanskrit rodha
Sanskrit Root √rudh 2, 7 (obstruct)

Example

kathañ'ca, bhikkhave, mahācoro gahananissito hoti? idha, bhikkhave, mahācoro tiṇagahanaṃ vā nissito hoti, rukkhagahanaṃ vā rodhaṃ vā mahāvanasaṇḍaṃ vā.

AN 3.51 mahācorasuttaṃ

rodhana

nt. obstruction, prevention [√rudh] ✗
ropa

Example

ārāmaropā vanaropā,
ye janā setukārakā,
papañ'ca udapānañ'ca,
ye dadanti upassayaṃ.

ropayamāna

prp. planting, cultivating [√ruh] ✗

ropāpeti

pr. (+acc) causes to plant; makes grow; causes to cultivate; lit. causes to causes to grow [√ruh + *āpe + ti] ✓

Grammar pr, caus of ropeti, trans (+acc)
Meaning causes to plant; makes grow; causes to cultivate; lit. causes to causes to grow

Root √ruh･1 *āpe (ascend, grow)
Base √ruh + *āpe > rohāpe > ropāpe (caus, irreg)
Construction ropāpe + ti
Phonetic Change u > o
Commentary (DNa) ropāpesī'ti nānāvaṇṇauppalabīj'ādīni tato tato āharāpetvā na ropāpesi, saha citt'uppāden'eva pan'assa sabbaṃ ijjhati. taṃ loko raññā ropitan'ti maññi. tena vuttaṃ, ropāpesī'ti. tato paṭṭhāya mahājano nānappakāraṃ jalajathalajamālaṃ piḷandhitvā nakkhattaṃ kīḷamāno viya gacchati.
Notes double causative?
Sanskrit ropayati
Sanskrit Root √ruh 1 (ascend)

Example

pāpasamācāro'ti mālāvacchaṃ ropeti'pi ropāpeti'pi, siñcati'pi siñcāpeti'pi, ocināti'pi ocināpeti'pi, gantheti'pi ganthāpeti'pi.

Example

taṃ jaññā vasalo iti.

rūpasaññāya + api
rūpasaññāyaṃ + api
rūpasmimpi

rūpasmiṃ + api
rūpassāhaṃ

rūpassa + ahaṃ
rūpataṇhāyapi

rūpataṇhā + api
rūpataṇhāya + api
rūpataṇhāyaṃ + api
rūpañca

rūpaṃ + ca
rū + pañca
rūpañce

rūpaṃ + ce
rūpaññeva

rūpaṃ + eva
rūpaṃpāhaṃ

rūpaṃ + api + ahaṃ
rūpaṃyeva

rūpaṃ + eva
rūpesupi

rūpesu + api
rūpikā

rū + pikā
rūpiyapātiyāpi

rūpiyapātiyā + api
rūpiyapātiyaṃ + api
rūpiyassāti

rūpiyassa + iti
rūpiñca

rūpiṃ + ca
rūpānametaṃ

rūpāna + etaṃ
rūpānaṃ + etaṃ
rūpānanti

rūpānaṃ + iti
rūpānañca

rūpānaṃ + ca
rūpānaṃtveva

rūpānaṃ + iti + eva
rūpānaṃyeva

rūpānaṃ + eva
rūpāniccatañca

rūpāniccataṃ + ca
rūpānāhaṃ

rūpāna + ahaṃ
rūpāni + ahaṃ
rūpānaṃ + ahaṃ
rūpārammaṇañca

rūpārammaṇaṃ + ca
rūpāti

rū + pāti
rūpa + iti
rūpā + iti
rūpāyāhaṃ

rūpāya + ahaṃ
rūpāyaṃ + ahaṃ
rūpīti

rūpi + iti
rūpī + iti
